loans.name: Yawa Dzidede

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale, elle réalise de bons profits  tous les jours cela constitue un avantage pour elle et est dû au fait qu’elle soit la seule à exercer cette activité. Actuellement son stock de marchandises a un peu baissé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des cartons de détergents, 06 cartons de savons « BF »,05 cartons de boîtes de conserves, 2 bidon d’huile «NIOTO » de 25 litres, des produits congelés et divers 
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
As an income-generating occupation, Ms. K. A. buys and sells basic foodstuffs. She makes good profits; every day she comes out ahead, since she is the only one engaged in this business. Currently, her stores are a bit low. She wishes to restock, and is requesting a loan via WAGES to buy boxes of detergent, six boxes of BF soap, 5 cartons of canned food, two 25-liter barrels of NIOTO oil, and various frozen goods. She is married and the mother of four children. With the money she earns, she contributes to her family's costs of living.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine H. is the mother of two children. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city in Bénin, where she owns a small hairdressing salon. She has been working there for six months. Before, she worked at another salon, but the owner decided that he wanted to build a house on the property. Therefore, Catherine decided to open a salon elsewhere.

Catherine says that business is going well, but that she needs more supplies. She is seeking a loan to buy more cosmetics. In the future, Catherine would like to expand the variety of her products. Along with cosmetics, she has a small selection of clothing, which normally sells very well. She believes that a loan will help to make her business more successful.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Mt Elgon Group

texts.en:
Prisca M., a 42-year-old divorce with a 22-year-old daughter, has operated a salon business since 2004. Working daily from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m., she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $77. This will be Prisca’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, the previous ones being used to purchase a dryer and salon products. Having repaid those loans, she is seeking a new loan to buy a steamer machine.

Prisca will share this loan with her loan group, Mt Elgon, whose 15 members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Prisca is the first on the left, front row.

loans.use: To buy a steamer machine and salon products.

loans.name: Sharifmo

texts.ru: Шарифмо Гафурова  получила кредит 1год назад на покупки фруктов, как раз это был апрель месяц, начала сезона всех фруктов и овощей. После этого ей понравились условия кредитования и она решила  продолжать увеличивать свой товарооборот.  Фрукты привозит поставщик из Душанбе. Также она сама иногда когда ест хорошая прибыль ездит продавать фрукты в Душанбе. Там большая наценка  на фрукты и таким способом ввозом товаров она увеличивает  свой товарооборот.
texts.en:
Sharifmo G. obtained a loan to purchase fruits one year ago, in the month of April, and right at the beginning of the season for all fruits and vegetables. After that, she liked the lending terms and decided to continue to increase her goods turnover. A supplier delivers fruits from Dushanbe. Also, Sharifmo goes to Dushanbe to sell fruits sometimes when profit potential is high. The add-on on fruits is higher there, which allows her to increase her turnover by bringing product there.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32 year old Josephine A. from Mwanza. She is married. Josephine has been running a charcoal business since 2008. She sells charcoal, which is small, black pieces of dry earth that are used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two people. Josephine currently earns about 273USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD in order to purchase charcoal stocks in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Josephine thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal stocks in bulk.

loans.name: Curus United Group

texts.en:
Michael is a 38 year old man with 2 children. The older child is 6 and the younger is 3. Both children are able to attend a private school - a testament to Michael's hard work since private schools can be very expensive in Liberia.

Michael's main business is selling scratch cards and helping people to charge their phones. He also sells rice from the same shop. Sometimes to attract customers Michael gives his customers a bit of rice to go along with their scratch cards. He explains that this makes the customers come back to his shop more!

loans.use: Items for resale in general store

loans.name: Zizi

texts.en: Zizi is a single lady of 38 years; she lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells gift items and cosmetics. Zizi is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more gift items and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gift items & cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: House Of Peace Group

texts.en:
Alfred is a 63 year old man who has been in business for over 30 years. He runs a clothing shop. He makes it successful by talking nicely to customers to encourage them. He also occasionally gives them discounts which makes them loyal to him.

Alfred hopes that he will be able generate enough profit from his business to be able build another house. He has nine children ranging in age from 27 to 18. Those who are still in school are in private schools.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ainess

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Ainess C. from Mwanza. She is single. Ainess has been running a clothes business since 2008. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Ainess currently earns about 200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ainess thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Favor Group

texts.en:
Juah is a single woman with two children. She is able to send them both to private school with the profits from her used clothing business. Juah has been running her used clothing business for 3 years. She moves her business around to different markets and puts her good clothes out. Then she rings a bell to attract customers.

Juah hopes that one day she will be able to go out of the country to purchase more goods. If she is able to do that she thinks that her family will be able to live in harmony together.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. Mary hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29 year old Zuwena J. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 3 and 11 years old. Zuwena has been running a Mobile phone accessories business since 2005. It is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania. This is probably attributable to the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, days per week. Zuwena currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more mobile phone accessories. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Zuwena thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: One Goal Development Group

texts.en:
Abraham is a 33-year-old married man with 2 children, ages 9 and 1.  He was able to go up to his third year in university.    He has been running a business buying and selling VCDs, DVDs, and cellphones for 6 years.  One of the challenges that he faces is that customers come and buy things on credit.  However, they then delay payment for a long time.  This creates issues.  

He also commented that there are a lot of other people who do the same business so sometimes competition is too much.  This cycle, Abraham wants to take out a loan to purchase engine oil for the trips he takes to purchase materials.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for travel to expand the business

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24 year old Magreth M. from Mwanza. She is single. Magreth has been running a clothes business since 2008. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Magreth currently earns about 250USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to add more clothes to her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Magreth thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To add more clothes to her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Josephine M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 17 and 23 years old. Josephine has been running a café business since 2007. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for 12 hours per days per week and is assisted by two employees. Josephine currently earns about 200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase beans, rice, wheat maize and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Josephine thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, wheat maize and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ini

texts.en: Ini is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells drinks and provisions.  Ini hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business for 4 years. Mabel is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For house construction

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Sr. Rubén C. tiene 32 años, está casado con la Sra. Carmen Rosa Cadima Alegre, llevan 10 años de casados, tienen 3 hijos de 10, 6 y 3 años los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona. No cuentan con casa propia, toda la familia vive en casa del padre del Sr. Rubén. 

El y su esposa tienen cuatro vacas lecheras y entregan toda su producción a una microempresa que produce queso para vender en los mercados. 

Con el crédito incrementarán sus vacas lecheras y podrán generar mayores ingresos por la venta de leche. Para el futuro desean comprarse un terreno y construir una casa propia para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén C. is 32 years old and is married to Carmen Rosa Cadima Alegre. They have been married for 10 years and they have 3 children, who are 10, 6, and 3 years old, and go to the local school. They don’t have their own house; the whole family lives in Rubén’s father’s house. Rubén and his wife have four dairy cows and they sell all of their production to a small business that makes cheese for sale in the markets. With the loan they will increase their herd and will be able to generate increased income from milk sales. In the future, they want to buy a piece of land and build their own house for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She sells second clothes. Victoria hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Martha Lorena tiene la edad de 46 años, reside en el bario  Reparto Shick en la capital de Managua,  madre soltera de cinco hijos tres casados y dos estudiando, trabaja como conserje medio tiempo y vende vigoron y golosinas desde hace siete años, los cuales ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos, ella inicio con fondos propios y a través de su salario. Con este crédito quiere invertir en golosinas y productos para preparar el rico vigoron, y pode seguir ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes. A futuro  lo que mas desea es tener un kiosco fijo donde pueda vender sus productos y dejar de trabajar para dedicarse totalmente al negocio y poder tener mejores ganancias. Y poder terminar de construir su casa a si como ayudar a sus pequeños que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 46 years old and lives in the Reparto Shick neighborhood of the capital, Managua. She is a single mother of five children - three married and two students. She works half-time as a janitor and for the past seven years has sold "vigoron" (a typical Nicaraguan dish of cabbage and yucca) and other snacks. She and her children have been able to get ahead through this business, which she started with her own money from her wages. With this loan she wants to invest in snacks and ingredients for making "vigoron", to be able to continue offering her products to her customers. In the future what she really wants is to have a fixed kiosk where she can sell her wares, and then to leave her job in order to dedicate herself completely to her business and earn more. She could then finish building her house and help her children to finish with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks and ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Obiha

texts.en: J., 37 years old and married with six children, lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells cotton, wood and foodstuffs, a business she has been in for 18 years. J. is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cotton, wood and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cotton, wood and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nicole

texts.en:
Nicole D. is married and has two children, one boy and one girl. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city and economic capital of Bénin. Nicole owns a hairdressing salon and has been working there for a year.  Before, she worked in a salon in the Aibatan neighborhood of Cotonou, but she quit that job in order to open her own shop. Nicole’s salon is away from the bustle of the city, but she is well situated to serve the needs of her clientele.  

Nicole is seeking a loan in order to purchase more cosmetic products to stock her salon. She normally buys her products at the Dantokpa Market, one of the largest open-air markets in West Africa. In the future, Nicole would like to expand the variety of her merchandise to include shoes, handbags and pagnes, beautifully colored West African fabrics.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine T., the mother of six children, all of whom are grown, is married to Rigobert Hekptazo. They live in Cotonou, which is located on the coast, not far from Nigeria, and is the largest city and economic capital of Bénin.

Christine owns a small workshop where she runs a machine that produces corn flour which she sells to people in her neighborhood. She has been involved in this activity for two years, and before that, she had a food stand where she sold fish, cassava, and pasta. Christine is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase more corn and increase her sales. In the future, she hopes to be able to open a grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, lo conforman 16 miembros, todos ellos residentes en la ciudad del Cusco.

Un estros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, los socios se dedican a la venta de frutas, comidas, huevos, papas, locería, al por mayor y dan servicios de llamadas telefónicas, restaurante, taxi, electrodomésticos, venta de productos de salud, hay una docente, que requiere el préstamo para uso personal, y otra socia para implementar el kiosco que ella tiene en una escuela, los socios venden sus productos en  el mercado virgen asunta, para lo cual solicitan el préstamo y de este modo poder reinvertir en sus pequeños negocios.

Los socios se encuentran agradecidos por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos establecidos en el cronograma.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Siempre Unidos" (Always United) is made up of 16 members, all residents of the city of Cusco.

The members of this group alternate their activities between their homes and their businesses; they sell wholesale fruit, food, eggs, potatoes, and pottery. Other businesses include phone services, a restaurant, taxi, electrical appliances, and health products. There is also a teacher, who requests a loan for personal use, and another member who wishes to set up the kiosk that she has in a school. Our members sell their products in the Virgen Asunta market; they are asking for a loan so they can invest in their small businesses.

The members of this group are grateful for the opportunity provided by Kiva, and promise to make payments according to the timetable they have established.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for their businesses

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: A. is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells medicine and provisions; she has been in this business for 10 years. A. is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 48 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. Three are in school and the others are learning trades. She lives with her children at Sefwi Dwinase in the western region of Ghana. 

Felicia works very hard to provide for her children. She is a baker and bakes bread which she supplies to her loyal customers. For the past fifteen years, she has been baking bread, pastries, and other foods as well as taking care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces she manages to handle the demand of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time. 

Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials, as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and save more for future eventualities. She said your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: Bakery supplies

loans.name: Awusi

texts.en:
Awusi is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Through her business, she has supported two of her children to finish junior high school and the others are currently in school. Awusi lives with her husband who is a trader. She is a food vendor and has been selling kenkey as well as maize for fifteen years now.

Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education.

loans.use: For raw materials and firewood

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty years old. She is married and is the mother of two children, and all her children are in school. She lives with her husband at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana.

Currently Margaret runs a boutique and sells items like shoes, shirts, belts, jeans, etc., in a rented shop in the market of the community where she lives. She has been in business for the last three years. It is her dream to save more to support her children in their education. She requests the loan to buy an increased stock of jeans, shirts, underwear and shoes, etc. She also desires to rent a shop to expand her business. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy boutique goods like shoes, shirts, jeans, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married and the mother of two children. She is a 32-year-old trader and her husband is a trader, too. Georgina’s children are all currently in school.

Georgina trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. She obtains her stock of goods from importers in Kumasi central market and sells through hawking (going door to door). Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.

For lack of adequate working capital, Georgina buys few stocks of lace materials. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to rent a store to trade in.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials, clothing materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 60-year-old woman and she is married with ten children. Four are in school and others are currently working. She is living with her husband in a family house at Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana. She is supportive, determined and, above all, is very hardworking though she is old.

Monica is a petty trader who trades in cereals like bags of maize, beans, millet, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. She takes delivery of stock from the Northern Region of Ghana. Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling of foodstuffs has enabled her to rent a store in the marketplace where she distributes to her customers.

Monica wants to use the loan to buys more bags of maize, millet, beans and groundnuts to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of maize, groundnuts, beans, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married and is the mother of one child who is schooling. Gladys is 25 years old and currently lives with her husband in their community in the Western Region of Ghana.

Gladys sells flour, bags of rice and other food items in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of goods from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She requests the loan to buy more bags of flour and bags of rice to retail to her customers. It is her desire to save more towards her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy a supply of flour, bags of rice and other cereals in bulk

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a 31-year-old married young woman. She has given birth to two children who are currently in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana.

Vida is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about eight years ago in order to take care of her home. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables and bags rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support and finance her business growth. Currently she also runs a food grocery shop and sells items like evaporated milk.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah started her fish sales three years ago in Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana. She is now 26 years old, married, and the mother of one child. Her husband is a trader, too.

She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base such that some customers travel from the other parts of the communities to buy her fish.

She buys stocks of fresh fish from Kumasi cold stores and retails to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her child and her business growth.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary F. is 60 years old. She is a widowed woman with five children. Two are in school while the rest work. She lives with her family in Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana. Mary has been a baker for seventeen years, in spite of the challenges she has faced. She bakes bread, cakes, meat pies, chips, etc. and sells them by retail to her customers. She takes them herself to the market center, to her customers, and people also come to her to buy. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She is requesting a loan to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and most especially for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Emilio Gutiérrez R. tiene 50 años, es soltero. Vive con su madre en Cochabamba en un barrio periurbano. Cuida de su madre ya que es el único hijo.  Trabaja con el ganado lechero desde hace 20 años y produce queso el cual vende en un mercado de la zona. 

También se dedica al comercio de ganado, los días martes y sábado de cada semana para poder generar un poco más de ingresos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero para poder producir más queso e incrementar sus ingresos. 

En un futuro desea sacar otro préstamo para poder incrementar más su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
Emilio Guitiérrez R. is 50 years old and is single. He lives with his mother in Cochabamba in a neighborhood on the edges of town. He takes care of his mother because he is her only child. He has worked with dairy cattle for 20 years and produces cheese, which he sells at a local market. He also buys and sells cattle on Tuesdays and Saturdays each week in order to generate a little extra income. With the loan he will buy one dairy cow so that he can produce more cheese and increase his earnings. In the future, he would like to take out another loan so he can increase his cheese production.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo Percy y sus hijos; Elvis de 16, Nelly de 8 y Angy de 6 añitos en su casa propia. Ellos son una familia muy unida y sobre todo muy trabajadora, Sonia se siente muy orgullosa y es por ello que trabaja tan arduamente para sacarlos adelante. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa, actividad por la que optó debido a que su esposo trabajó en una fábrica de confección y aprendió el oficio. Ahora venden sus prendas en “Gamarra” un centro comercial muy conocido en la ciudad de Lima, trabajan según los pedidos que les hacen sus clientes. Hoy en día están elaborando casacas a causa del imperante frío de estas fechas. Pero Sonia no trabaja sola, lo hace junto a su esposo y a su hijo, con quienes hace un muy buen equipo. Empiezan su jornada diaria a las 8 de la mañana y no tienen hora de término, ya que deben elaborar gran cantidad de casacas para niños jóvenes y adultos, las cuales son muy difíciles porque requieren de puntadas y acabados muy al detalle. Para el futuro, a Sonia le gustaría terminar la construcción de su casa para poder montar allí su taller, comprando mayor cantidad de máquinas y tener empleados que trabajen para ella. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre le ha ido muy bien, ya que su grupo es muy puntual en sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado espera invertirlo en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales para la elaboración del nuevo pedido de casacas que tiene.
texts.en:
Sonia is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Percy and their children: Elvis - 16, Nelly - 8, and Angy - 6. They are a very close and hardworking family. Sonia is very proud of them and that is why she works so hard to make sure that they progress. She makes and sells clothing, which is work that she took up because her husband worked in a clothing factory and learned how to do the work. Now they sell their clothes in "Gamarra", a very well-known shopping center in Lima, producing clothes made to order for their customers. Nowadays they are making coats because of the cold weather. Sonia does not work alone - she works together with her husband and son, and they make a very good team. They start their workday at 8 am and don't have a fixed closing time, because they need to produce a lot of coats for children and adults, which is difficult because the coats need special stitching and finishing details. In the future Sonia would like to finish the construction of her house so that she can set up her workshop there, buying more sewing machines and hiring employees to work for her. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has always done very well, because her group is very punctual with their payments. The money requested is to be invested in the purchase of materials for fulfilling this new order for coats.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to produce winter coats

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 41 años, vive con sus hijos y su padre, quienes le ayudan en su negocio, el cual realiza desde hace más de 4 años. Ella siempre fue una mujer muy trabajadora y al no poder terminar sus estudios secundaros incursionando en diferentes oficios. Es así que notó en la venta de canela y clavo de olor la fuente para solventar los gastos de su hogar y felizmente no se equivocó, pues ahora obtiene buenos ingresos gracias a esta actividad. El procedimiento no es nada fácil, ya que debe comprar la canela y el clavo al por mayor y empaquetarlo en pequeñas bolsas para su distribución, cada bolsita llega a costar de un sol a más, dependiendo de la cantidad. Las ventas son buenas, porque con los años que viene trabajando en este negocio ya tiene clientes fijos que sólo compran las especerías que ella vende porque saben que son de calidad y buen precio. Es así que ahora Gladys está pensando obtener más ingresos en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de especerías. En Microfinanzas PRISMA lleva trabajando varios años, pero este es su primer préstamo individual, por lo que promete ser tan puntual como lo fue en su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de especerías para poder aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and lives with her children and her father, who help her with her business, which she has had for more than 4 years. She has always been a hardworking woman, and when she was not able to finish high school she started working in different jobs. This is how she found out about sellling cinnamon and cloves as a way to cover her household expenses, and fortunately she has succeeded, earning a good income now thanks to this work. Her work is not at all easy; she buys the cinnamon and cloves at wholesale and then repackages it in small bags for sale. Each bag costs one "sol" or more, depending on its size. Sales are good, because over the time that she has been in this business she has built up a steady clientele who only buy spices from her because they know that they are good quality and reasonably priced. That is why Gladys is now thinking about earning more in her business by buying more spices. She has belonged to Microfinanzas PRISMA for several years, but this is her first individual loan, and she promises to be as punctual in this as she has been with her community bank. With the money requested, she will buy more spices in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sandy Priscila

texts.es:
La señora Sandy Priscila es socia del Banco Comunal San Martin. Ella tiene 25 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos, los cuales tienen 6, 4 y 1 1/2 años. Sandy vende ropa por catalogo, un negocio que viene haciendo desde hace 3 años. Inició con el negocio porque una amiga suya lo hacía y le inscribió para vender. Sus conocidas, vecinas y amigas le hacen pedidos de ropa, y en una semana promedia vende $300 de mercadería, de la cual unos $50-$80 son ganancias para ella. Lo que vende es ropa de alta calidad, entonces los precios son bastante elevados.

Sandy vende su mercadería a crédito, y por eso está necesitando este préstamo. Ella pidió $440 para poder pagar los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes. Dice que la parte más complicada de su negocio es que los clientes a veces se demoran en pagar.

Lamentablemente, Sandy se encuentra ahora con una muñeca rota, debido a que se cayó por las gradas. Le dificulta un poco en el cuidado de sus hijos, especialmente de su hijita pequeña, que no cumple 2 años todavía. 

Su meta para el futuro es poner su propio almacén de ropa estilo boutique.
texts.en:
Sandy Priscila is a member of the San Martin Communal Bank. She is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband, with whom she has three children aged 6, 4 and 1½.
Sandy has sold clothing by catalogue for 3 years. She started the business because her friend was doing it and signed her up. Her acquaintances, neighbours and friends order clothing from her and in one week she sells on average $300 of merchandise, of which she earns $50-$80. She sells top quality clothing, so her prices are fairly high.
Sandy sells merchandise on credit and this is why she needs the loan. She requested $440 to pay for her customer orders. She says that the most complicated part of her business is when customers are sometimes slow to pay
. Unfortunately Sandy currently has a broken wrist from tripping on the stairs. This makes looking after her children a little difficult, especially her little girl who hasn’t turned 2 yet.
Her goal for the future is to set up her own boutique clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing that her customers have ordered

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 42 años, vive con sus hijos: Oswaldo de 22 y Nicol de 20 años en su casa propia.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, incursionando en este negocio porque necesitaba un trabajo que pudiera realizar desde casa. Es por eso que decidió comenzar vendiendo entre sus familiares y amigas, resultándole muy rentable, ahora vende por todo su vecindario y es muy conocida porque siempre sabe dar buenos consejos de belleza. Carmen le dedica a su trabajo casi todo el día, ya que visita las casas de sus vecinas para conversar e informar sobre los productos que ofrece y otra parte la dedica a la cobranza, que es la parte más difícil del negocio, ya que le ha pasado que alargan el tiempo de pago o simplemente no quieren pagar; felizmente son pocos los casos y ella cada vez aprende más y no comete los mismos errores. Entre sus planes a futuro están el tener otro negocio en su propio domicilio por el cual aún no se decide ya que tiene diferentes ideas. Carmen es una cliente muy antigua en Microfinanzas PRISMA y este es su 16avo préstamo, caracterizándose por haber sido muy puntual en todos su pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una vitrina para exhibir y ofrecer sus cosméticos en la puerta de su casa, además invertirá en comprar productos de oferta para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Carmen, 42, lives in her own house with her children, Oswaldo, 22; and Nicol, 20. She has been selling beauty products for two years. She started this business because she needed work that she could do at home. That is why she decided to start selling to her relatives and friends. It turned out to be very profitable. She now sells to the whole neighborhood. She is well known because she always knows how to give good beauty advice. Carmen works almost all day. She goes to her neighbors’ houses to chat and inform them about the products that she offers. The other part of her time she spends on collections. This is the most difficult part of the business when payments are overdue or people simply do not want to pay. Happily, this does not happen often. Each time she learns more, and she does not make the same mistakes. Her plan for the future is to have another business in her house. She has not decided what, but she has different ideas. Carmen has been with Mircofinanzas Prisma for a long time. This is her 16th loan. She is characterized as being very punctual with all of her payments. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy a display case to exhibit and offer her cosmetics in the door way to her house. She will also buy products to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy a display case

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal San Martín. Ella es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 viven con ella (2 mayores y 1 hija que está en el colegio todavía). Sus 2 hijas mayores están casadas con familias propias, ambas viven en la ciudad de Guayaquil. 

María Teresa tiene una pequeña industria familiar junto con su hermana, su esposo y sus hijos. Ellos compran botellas y los decoran con pintura y esmalte para posteriormente venderlas en la feria los fines de semana. Sus clientes se las compran a 6 por $1, y las usan como floreros o cómo ellos quieran. Ella y su familia trabajan de lunes a viernes fabricando estos productos, y los venden en la Feria Libre (un gran mercado en la ciudad de Cuenca) los fines de semana. También venden artículos de plástico como baldes y tinas, los cuales compran al por mayor. La señora también hace confección de carteras y bolsos como la que tiene puesta en la foto. Aunque parecen ser muchos trabajos distintos, ella dice que no es muy pesado el trabajo porque ella y su familia lo dividen entre ellos.  

María Teresa pidió $550 para comprar los materiales que necesita para decorar sus botellas, como pinturas y esmaltes. Además comprará plásticos al por mayor. Su meta para el futuro es comprarse un pequeño terreno para poder construir una casa en la ciudad de Cuenca. Ella sí tiene una casa propia en Guayaquil, en la cual viven sus hijas con sus familias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Theresa in a member of the communal bank “San Martín”. She has a partner and five children, three that live with her (two are older and one daughter is still in college). Her two older daughters are married with their own families. Both live in Guayaquil. Maria Theresa has a small family business with her sister, her husband and her children. They buy bottles, decorate them with paint and varnish and sell them at the weekend market. Her customers buy six bottles for one dollar and they use them for vases or whatever else they wish. She and her family work from Monday to Friday making the products and they sell them in the “Free Market” (a large market in Cuenca) on the weekend. They also sell plastic products, such as buckets and bowls, which they buy wholesale. She also sells wallets and purses like you see in the photo. Even though these seem like many different businesses, she says that the work isn’t that hard because she divides the work among the family members. Maria Theresa is asking for $550 to buy the necessary materials in order to decorate the bottles, such as paint and varnish. Also she will buy wholesale plastic items. Her future goal is to buy a small piece of land in Cuenca where she will construct a house. Her daughters live in a house she owns in Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the materials she uses to decorate the bottles that she sells.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 38 años, vive con sus hijos: Valeria de 15 y Jerri de 6 años, ya que su hijo mayor, Walter de 39 ya vive fuera de casa. Siempre le ha llamado la atención el arte culinario, es por eso que decidió trabajar en este rubro vendiendo salchipapas, que no es otra cosa que papas y salchichas fritas acompañadas con mostaza, mayonesa y salsa de tomate. Cristina realiza esta actividad de 7 a 10 de la noche, ya que el día lo ocupa en las labores de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. La venta es buena, ya que la sazón que le pone Cristina a sus salchipapas no tiene comparación, siendo el puesto que tiene afuera de su casa muy visitado, la clientela siempre se va con una sonrisa, después de deleitarse con este delicioso platillo. En el futuro le gustaría tener un espacio dentro de su casa donde ofrecer con mayor comodidad sus salchipapas y así ganar más clientes y por ende más clientela. Este es su préstamo 16 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos y le gusta mucho su grupo de trabajo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de platitos descartables, bancas e ingredientes al por mayor preparar las salchipapas.
texts.en:
Cristina, 38, lives with her children, Valerie, 15; and Jerri, 6. Her oldest son, Walter, 19, lives away from home. The culinary arts have always interested her. That is why she decided to work with food by selling “salchipapas”. They are nothing more than potatoes and fried sausages with mustard, mayonnaise, and tomato sauce. Cristina sells from seven until ten at night. In the daytime she is busy with household chores and taking care of her children. Sales are good because the way Cristina seasons her salchipapas is beyond comparison. The stand she has outside of her house is well frequented. Her customers always leave with a smile after enjoying this delicious dish. In the future she would like to have a space inside of her house where she could offer her salchipapas more comfortably. That way she would gain more customers. This is her 16th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always been very punctual in her payments. She likes the way her group works. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy more disposable plates, benches, and wholesale ingredients to make the salchipapas.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and equipment for her business

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: Elsy tiene 40 años, se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, además posee un puesto en el mercado. Ella vive con su esposo Basilio quien es soldador y sus hijos Larri de 17 y Sara de 8 años. Desde hace 7 años se ha venido dedicando a esta actividad con la cual se siente muy contenta, ya que tiene la comodidad de realizarla en su propia casa. Además de comestibles también vende artículos de limpieza y de tocador, satisfaciendo la demanda de los clientes, ya que es la única tienda cercana en su vecindario, las ganancias son buenas. Elsy está progresando poco a poco, pero tener que atender su otro negocio en el mercado hace que el día se le haga corto y muy cansado, además los ingresos en su puesto no van bien, porque tiene que pagar la vigilancia y el alquiler, donde se le van casi todas las ganancias. Es así que ha decidido dedicarse netamente a atender la tienda que tiene en su casa, además esto le dará la ventaja de poder cuidar a sus hijos, especialmente a la pequeña que está en edad escolar y necesita de su apoyo. Elsy quiere progresar, es por eso que necesita arreglar su tienda para darles mayor comodidad a sus clientes y por ende vender en mayor tranquilidad. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA viene trabajando hace varios años, siendo este su préstamo número 16, gustándole mucho el trabajo en su banco comunal, ya que todos los miembros son muy unidos y honestos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para implementar su tienda, además de realizar algunos arreglos al local para hacerlo más cómodo y atractivo a la clientela.
texts.en:
Elsy, 40, sells food from the small store that she has in her house. She also has a stand in the market. She lives with her husband, Basilio, a solderer; and her children Larri, 17; and Sara, 8. She has been in her business for seven years. She is very happy because she has the comfort of working in her own house. Besides selling food, she also sells cleaning and bathroom products to satisfy her customers’ needs. Because she is the only nearby store in her neighborhood, earnings are good. Elsy is progressing little by little, but having to take care of her other business in the market makes the day short. It makes her very tired. Income from her stand is not going well because she has to pay the guards and the rent, which takes almost all of the earnings. That is why she has decided to solely work at the store she has in her house. This also has the advantage of allowing her to care for her children, especially the little one who is school aged and needs her support. Elsy wants to progress. That is why she needs to fix her store to make her customers more comfortable and sell in greater tranquility. She has been working with Mircofinanzas Prisma for various years. This is her 16th loan. She really likes the work in her Community Bank. All of its members are united and honest. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy more merchandise for her store. She will also make some repairs to her store to make it more comfortable and attractive to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and fix store

loans.name: Jenny Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Jenny es socia del Banco Comunal San Martín. Ella tiene 29 años, es divorciada, y tiene dos hijos: un varón de 11 años y una niña de 7 años, además ella actualmente está embarazada de 4 meses. No sabe el sexo de la guagua todavía; piensa que puede ser otra mujer pero independientemente ya está feliz con tener un varón y una mujer, así que será feliz con cualquier de las dos opciones. 
Jenny es estilista en su propio gabinete de belleza, donde hace cortes, colores y pinta las uñas de sus clientes. Lleva 10 años con este negocio. Antes tenía un local donde atendía a sus clientes, pero como está embarazada ahora no puede trabajar tanto como antes, porque le ha dado un poco de depresión y tiene que descansar. Entonces, ha decidido cerrar su local por un tiempo y trabajar de casa en casa por un tiempo. De esta manera ahorrará en el arriendo del local pero todavía mantendrá a su base de clientela.  
Jenny pidió un préstamo de $550, el cual será invertido para pagar la escuela de su hija y pagar el arriendo de su casa (la cual alquila de su mamá). Su ex marido debería pagar la educación de su hija, pero se ha atrasado un poco en el pago de la pensión de la niña y por eso le toca a Jenny pagarlo. 
Jenny tiene como meta para el futuro comprarse un pequeño terreno para construir una casa propia. Lleva ya un año sacando préstamos de la Fundación Espoir, y dice que le gusta porque es más fácil y le piden menos papeles que en un banco tradicional. “Me ayuda bastante,” dice.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the San Martín Community Bank. She is 29 and divorced. She has two children, an 11 year old boy and a 7 year old girl. She is four months pregnant. She does not yet know the sex of the baby; she thinks it might be another girl. Regardless, she is happy to have a boy and a girl, and she will be happy with either of the two options. Jenny is a stylist in her own beauty salon where she cuts hair, colors hair, and gives manicures to her customers. She has had this business for ten years. Before, she had a place where she took care of customers. But, as she is now pregnant, she cannot work as much as before. The pregnancy has given her a bit of depression, and she has to rest. Therefore, she has decided to close her place for a while and work from house to house for a while. This way she will save on the rent of her local, but she will still keep her customer base. Jenny has asked for a $550 loan, which she will use to pay her daughter’s school and pay the rent for her house (she rents from her mother). Her ex husband should pay for their daughter’s education. But, he is a little behind in paying support, so it falls to Jenny to pay it. Jenny’s future goal is to buy a small piece of land where she can build her own house. She has been getting loans from the Fundación Espoir for one year. She likes it because it is much easier and they ask for less paperwork than a traditional bank. “They help me a lot,” she says.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her daughter's school and rent for her house

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa es socia del Banco Comunal San Martin. Ella tiene 47 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales están en su poder. Hasta hace poco, la señora trabajaba de cobrador en el bus de su esposo. Pero recién instalaron una maquina para cobrar, entonces ya no era necesario este trabajo. Entonces, ella decidió empezar un negocio de venta de ropa de niño y de calzados, y ya lleva un mes trabajando en eso. Dice que le está yendo bien, y que le gusta el trabajo porque le permite salir de su casa y recorrer la ciudad de Cuenca y sus afueras. Sus clientes son principalmente conocidos de la empresa de transporte, y como ella trabajó bastante tiempo (12 años) en eso, tiene muchos contactos para su nuevo negocio. 
Narcisa pidió un crédito de $660 para invertir en la compra de ropa de niño y calzados. Dice que le gustaría poner un local en el futuro. Su casa no sirve para vender ropa, porque no está ubicada en la misma avenida principal sino en una calle un poco más adentro, entonces no es un lugar muy transitado por la gente. Dice que no tiene mucho sentido poner un local en este momento porque está recién iniciando el negocio y el alquiler de un local le saldría demasiado caro, pero sí lo tiene pensado para el futuro.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a member of the San Martín Communal Bank. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 children, 2 of whom are with her. Until recently she worked as a fare collector for her husband´s bus. But recently they installed a machine for collecting fares and her type of work was no longer necessary. So she decided to start a business selling children´s clothing and shoes and has been working at this for a month. She says that is it going well and she likes the work because it allows her to get out of the house and move around the city of Cuenca and surrounding areas. Her customers are mostly people she knows from the transportation company and since she worked there for a long time (12 years) she has a lot of contacts for her new business. Narcisa requested a loan for $550 to use to buy children´s clothing and shoes. She says that she would like to have a store in the future. Her house is not suitable for selling clothing because is is not located on a main thoroughfare but on a street a bit further away which is not well traveled. It does not make much sense to start a store right now because she has just recently started the business and renting a storefront would be too expensive, but she plans to do it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Lucia Adelaida

texts.es: Doña Lucia Adelaida B. de 51 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos dos trabajan y uno esta estudiando, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad. Su negocio es una repostería que administra desde hace tres años el cual inicio  con préstamos y ha ido creciendo. Sus planes es terminar de hacer su casa y apoyar a  su hijo que estudia. Con este préstamo es para comprar mesas de trabajo y poder fortalecer su inventario, este es su cuarto ciclo de préstamo  en Afodenic y da las gracias por los logros alcanzados. Su objetivo es poner una panadería el cual le generara mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia Adelaida B. is 51 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua, is married and has three children, two work and one is studying. Her husband works as a security guard. Her business is a confectionery which she has been managing for the past three years; she started it with loans and it has been growing. Her plans are to finish building her house and to support her son who is studying. With this loan she will buy work tables so that she can increase her inventory. This is her fourth loan with Afodenic and she is thankful for the achievements reached. Her goal is to start a bakery, which will generate better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables for her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda, es natural de Patria, ubicada en la provincia de kosñipata, pertenece al departamento de Cusco, ubicado a 9 horas desde Cusco, esta es la puerta a la amazonía peruana.

Nuestra socia es conviviente, tiene 31 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos (14 y 12) años, ella alterna sus labores del hogar con el cultivo de tierras, ella siembra arroz y coca, desde los tiempos de los inkas el cultivo de la hoja de coca, fue una actividad primordial, ya que posee proteínas y vitaminas, esta fue una planta sagrada, utilizado en zumos de té, es digestiva, de preferencia se usa 4 hojas de coca en agua caliente. La socia necesita el préstamo para poder limpiar su terreno y abonar sus tierras y así plantar su nueva producción.

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado y de la misma forma se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de sus deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda is originally from Patria, situated in the province of kosñipata, in the department of Cuzco. Located 9 hours from Cuzco - it is the gateway to the Peruvian Amazon. She is married, 31 years old and has 2 children (14 and 12 years old), she alternates her domestic duties with working the land, she cultivates rice and coca. Since the time of the Incas, the cultivation of coca leaves has been a fundamental activity because it possesses proteins and vitamins. The Coca is a sacred plant used in teas, it is a digestive - usually people use 4 leaves of coca in hot water. Hilda needs a loan to clean and fertilize her land in order to plant her new crops. She is very grateful for the support given to her and in the same way promises to fulfill the terms of her loan in the established time frame .

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow coca, plantains and rice

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
El socio JOEL, es natural de Kosñipata, del distrito de Patria, perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, ubicado a 8 horas de la ciudad.

Nuestro socio tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad y se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, el transporta la madera desde el centro de la amazonía hasta los diferentes departamentos del Perú, el socio requiere el préstamo en razón de comprar al por mayor madera de todo tipo y después venderla.

El socio se encuentra agradecido con el préstamo y valora el esfuerzo brindado para poder así dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
JOEL is from Kosñipata, county of Patria, in the state of Cusco, located 8 hours from the city. Joel is 23 years old. He lives with his partner and has a 3-year-old child. His business is buying and selling wood. He transports the wood from the center of the amazons to different states in Perú. He is asking for the loan to buy different types of wood at whole sale price to resell. He is thankful for the loan and appreciates the assistance provided to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy and sell wood

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 42 years old, widowed, and the mother of five, but one child died. Georgina works very hard to provide support for her children as a single parent. Through her hard efforts she has managed to send her four children to school. Georgina sells roasted plantains in the community market, near where she lives. Roasted plantain is enjoyed with groundnuts and is eaten as lunch. She takes her stock of plantains from the market and prepares her food (roasted plantain). She is requesting a loan to buy bunches of plantain, groundnuts, charcoal, etc. to provide food for her customers. She has big dreams of providing educational support for her children.

loans.use: To buy bunches of plantain to roast.

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Feliciana del Socorro O. tiene la edad de 57 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida rápida que junto con su esposo vende como: enchiladas, repochetas,  carne asada, y refresco naturales frutas, y golosinas, llevan ya diez años en las ventas, anteriormente vendía artesanía en el mercado oriental, y con ahorro comenzaron este otro negocio, sus planes son remodelar el local para captar nuevos clientes. Con este crédito va a comprar  productos para hacer la variedad de ricos platos de comida para ofertar a sus clientes lo cual espera vender más y obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para invertir en su pequeño negocio, también espera hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Feliciana del Socorro O. is 57 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married and has three adult children. Her business is fast food which she and her husband sell, including enchiladas, reprochetas, grilled meat, soft drinks made from natural fruits and candy. They have been in sales for the past 10 years. Previously she sold crafts in the eastern market and with her savings started this other business. Her plans including remodeling her stand to attract new customers. With this loan she will buy products for making a variety of delicious food to offer her customers, and she hopes to sell more and have more earnings. She is thankful to Afodenic for their support in investing in her small business. She also hopes to make some improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and the mother of five children who are currently working. She is a 63 year old trader and her husband is a farmer. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. She buys her stock of goods from importers in Kumasi central market. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. Due to her lack of adequate working capital, she can only buy a small stock of lace materials and sells them through hawking. She believes this loan will enable her to expand her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of lace materials and textile. She hopes to use part of her profits to rent a store to trade.

loans.use: To purchase in bulk lace materials, clothing materials and textile.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is married with two children and they are all in school. Adwoa is a 42 year old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and for that matter, she is very serious about her business. 

She trades in foodstuffs like plantains. She started this business fifteen years ago and through this she has been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes with the loan she can buy bunches of plantains from the farmers, instead of through middlemen who sell retail to her at a high price.

loans.use: To buy bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia Susana, ella es natural de la provincia de Kosñipata, del distrito de Patria, perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, ubicado a 8 horas de la ciudad, y situado en la entrada al parque natural del Manu.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el cultivo de yuca, arroz, coca, plátanos, según la época, ella es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 5 hijos de (14,9, 6,4, 3 meses). Ella solicita el préstamo en razón de que necesita limpiar sus tierras para una nueva cosecha.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir en el pago de su deuda.
texts.en:
Susana is from the province of Kosñipata in the district of Patria, which belongs to the department of Cusco. The province is located 8 hours from the city near the entrance to the Manu National Park.

Susana splits her time between household tasks and the seasonal cultivation of yucca, rice, coca, and bananas. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children (14, 9, 6, 4 years, and 3 months old). She is asking for a loan because she needs to clear her lands for the next harvest.

Susana is grateful for and values the support given to her by these institutions and is committed to paying off her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant yucca, rice, and coca.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank K. is twenty-nine years old. He is married with three kids who are currently in school. He is a dealer in electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas etc. He also provides repairs and servicing work for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices from Kumasi and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting this loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.en:
Rosa Luz is a member of the Virgen del Carmen Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Patria. She is 39 and  the single mother of three children, who range in age from 9 to 22. Her oldest child works and is almost entirely independent. 

Rosa Luz has a small neighborhood grocery store in Patria. She has had the store for many years, and works there seven days a week, from 5 am to 9 or 10 pm, depending on the day. 

Rosa Luz is requesting 2000 soles to restock her store. She doesn’t know exactly what she will buy yet, but says that she’s always missing something. She travels to the city of Cusco two to four times per month to buy merchandise she needs for her store. 

Rosa Luz’s goal for the future is to expand and improve her store and to build a house for her family on a plot of land she owns in Patria. She’s also thinking about opening a bar in her home once it is finished.

loans.use: GROCERIES

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is 30 years old. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are still in school. She is very hardworking and supportive to her husband in providing food and shelter for her household. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to expand her business by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She has been in this business for three years now.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 29 years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are currently in school. She lives in Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana. To support her household, she has been hawking and selling cosmetics in her neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income for the family’s needs. Vida walks very long distances to make sales, although sometimes she hires a car to carry her goods. She is therefore appealing for your assistance to make good sales that will take care of the home.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is thirty-three years old. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood in Sefwi, in the eastern region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. Ama is very skillful and a talented hair dresser. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weave-ons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to serve her customers. She has won over many customers in the community who come to her salon to do their hair. She said it is mostly on the weekends that customers come in numbers, as most of them work. She is grateful for your assistance in supporting her business.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a business woman in Sefwi. She trades in clothes, linen, and lace materials. She is 47 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She has five children who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past six years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to bulk purchase clothes, linen, and lace materials to increase her inventory. It is her desire to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To bulk purchase clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Virgen del Carmen Village Bank in the Peruvian jungle town of Patria, located about eight hours from the city of Cusco. She is fifty-five years old and married with seven children. Elsa sells “anticuchos” (beef heart kabobs) in the market in Patria. She works three days a week (Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays), on days when buses from Cusco come through town. She has had her anticucho business for the past ten years. 

Elsa is requesting a loan of 3000 soles. She plans to use half of the money to buy charcoal, meat, potatoes and oil for making anticuchos, and the other half to pay for her son’s education. He is currently in nursing school in Lima, and will finish his studies in just one more month.  

Elsa’s goals for the future are to improve and expand her anticucho business and open a neighborhood bar in her home.

loans.use: Buy meat, charcoal, potatoes and oil

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 35 years old. She is married and has three children, who are all in school. She is very hardworking and supportive to her husband in providing food and shelter for her household. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to expand her business by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She has been in business for three years now.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Adolfo V.,  tiene la edad de 46 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa es comerciante  vende ropa y le tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad,  todos estudian. Don Adolfo tiene un taxi que trabaja desde hace ocho años dando sus servicios de transporte a los usuarios. Con este crédito es su séptimo ciclo y lo quiere para compra repuestos para darles mantenimientos a su taxi y poder dar a sus clientes una mejor atención. Sus planes es lograr adquirir otra unidad de taxi para y poder tener mejores utilidades, a si como hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder dar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adolfo V. is 46 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married, his wife sells clothing and they have four minor children who all study. Don Adolfo has a taxi which he has been working for the past eight years, providing transportation services to his clients. With this loan, which is his seventh, he will buy replacement parts for maintenance of his taxi so that he can provide better service to his customers. His plans are to buy another taxi so that he can have better profits, make improvements to his home and be able to provide his children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Currently both of them are schooling. She lives at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls like lunch boxes etc. She mostly sells through hawking, that is house-to-house selling. She has been trading for five years now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils etc., which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan, she believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits to build a store and reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Two are schooling and one is working. They are a very humble family and want to invest in the future. She lives at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tin tomatoes, bags of rice etc. Selling these products, she says, they move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With her four years experience in her business, she wants to add other stuff like maize, eggs and others, which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of a loan. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tin tomatoes etc. She is convinced that the loan will help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna is married with two children. She sells small home products at Drogobych city and has been in this business for two years. Various small home products are always in high demand and Ivanna makes about 3,000 UAH per month of net profit. She would like to borrow 8,500 UAH to purchase more inventory.

Ivanna is a hardworking and enthusiastic person. She believes that hard work brings success not only in business but in life, too.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Maribel Cecilia

texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old and married with three children. She has been running a clothing store business in Cusco, Perú for the past eight years. Maribel sells both men and womens' clothing, and also supplies uniforms for a few local businesses. With this loan she hopes to import the latest fashion clothing from Lima, Perú, Chile and Bolivia.

Maribel is in her third loan cycle with Arariwa. She is a member of a communal bank that meets monthly with a loan officer at Arariwa's headquarters. She has been appointed the group treasurer for the upcoming loan cycle for her group. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back in full and on time.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for her store to sell

loans.name: Dorita

texts.es: La señora Dorita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 03 hijas, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicio de llamadas telefónicas local, nacional e internacional, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando un celular y un teléfono, todo esto para empezar. Así, siguió superándose y hoy en la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y hoy se encuentra mas implementada.  Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00,  comprará mas celulares y teléfonos fijos, para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando tarjetas virtuales y físicas.Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.Dorita nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Dorita belongs to the "Siempre Unidas" Communal Bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín province, in the department of San Martín. She lives with her common-law husband, is 33 years old and the mother of 3 daughters who she still supports and who are studying. She provides a call center service for local, national and international calls and has been doing this activity for years. Her business is located in a storefront set up so that she can take care of her customers. She started off with a loan from Manuel Ramos, started saving little by little and with this money bought a cell phone and a telephone.
