She has continued to progress with the business, providing service to the local community and today has even more equipment. With this loan, she will buy more cell phones and fixed line phones so that she can offer better service and attend to her customers. Part of the money will also be used to buy virtual and physical phone cards. Today she is an independent woman and she and her husband make decisions and manage the business. Belonging to a women´s group has helped her to better understand her rights and together they make sure these are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cell phones and fixed-line phones.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mas que Vencedoras II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 03 hijos, los tres que aun dependen de ella.Su espíritu  alegre y las ganas de generar sus propios ingresos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de Juanes, humitas y tamalitos, ubicada en su misma casa. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar sus juanes ya que tiene  una sazón muy rica y sus clientes ya la conocen, es  ella  misma quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, desea invertirlo comprando sacos de arroz y maíz, aceites en docenas, huevos en javas, hojas de bijao en rollos, kilos de maní  y artículos de higiene personal como servilletas, cucharitas descartables de plásticas y así continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Nancy, se siente con mucha fuerza aun para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms Nancy belongs to the community bank "Mas que Vencedoras II" (translated as "More than conquerors II") in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin. She is 39 years old and has three children, with all of them still depending on her. Her happy spirit and desire to generate her own income motivated her to undertake her own business selling food (juanes, humitas and tamalitos) made in her own house. Currently, she has regular clients that daily come to her house to buy food since it has a delicious flavor and her clients already know her well. She herself personally attends to her clients with a charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of $175, she wants to invest it by buying sacks of rice and corn, oil, eggs, leaves in rolls, kilograms of peanuts and household kitchen items like napkins, plastic disposable teaspoons so that she can continue giving better service to her clients. Nancy feels strong about continuing to work and persevering day after day. She is grateful for the Manuela Ramos movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in the midst of where they are.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: La señora Sarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años y es madre de 02 hijos, uno de 15 y 13 años; estudiantes y que aun dependen de ella.Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, y por la falta de trabajo, decidió emprender un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela, Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Señora Sarita belongs to the communal bank, "Siempre Unidas" (Always United), which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martín. She is 43 and is the mother of 2 children, who are 15 and 13. Her kids are students and still depend on her economically. Because of the need to provide economic income for her home and because she didn't have a job, she decided to start a small business selling groceries with her first credit of 300 PEN. She saw very good results from the start because of the quality of her products, her reasonable prices, and her good customer service. Currently she continues with the same business, which is located in her home and where her main customers are the people from her neighborhood. With this loan of 2,200 PEN, she will buy more products to supply her business like rice and sugar by the kilogram, eggs in cartons, personal and cleaning products, soft drinks, candy, and other items to keep her customers happy. Today she is very happy with the work and service that she offers, and she is thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and to get ahead. She hopes that they continue their work for a long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nervith

texts.es: La señora Nervith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Nervith, con el apoyo de su pareja y de Manuela Ramos y teniendo  la habilidad para la costura, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos y confecciones, hechas por ellas mismas.En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Nervith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada e Independiente, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nervith belongs to the Siempre Unidas Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has one dependent son. With help from her significant other and Manuela Ramos, and having the ability to sew, Nervith decided to set up her own business in her own house. Sales are going well for her. She works on orders and clothes that she has made by herself. She currently continues making clothes, and she has loyal customers who come to her house every day to buy her work and their orders. She waits on them with her characteristic kindness. With the loan for 3,000 PEN she wants to buy meters of different types of fabric; instruments that she uses like scissors, sewing needles and machine needles, pins; and buttons. Nervith now feels very fulfilled and independent with the desire to make the rest of her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and work instruments

loans.name: Norith

texts.es: La señora Norith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. joyas confeccionadas en metales finos, ubicada en su misma casa donD. poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, ya que los venD. a un precio diferente.En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos, amigos, familiares y transeúntes, que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar donD. ella personalmente les atienD.  con alegría y entusiasmo. Con el préstamo D. S/ 500.00, comprará joyas como aretes, cadenas, dijes, sortijas confeccionados en metales finos, para venderlos al por mayor y menor; así continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Norith, anhela implementar su propia joyería y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo logra.   Agradece el apoyo que viene recibiendo  para emprender su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Norith belongs to the communal bank, "Siempre Unidas" (Always United), which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martín. She is married, is 54, and has 2 children who still depend on her economically and who are in school. Her enterprising character and her love for her family motivated her to start her own business selling jewelry maD. out of fine metals. Her business is located in her home where little by little she expanded it and gained experience in this work. She has maD. herself very well-known and loved among her customers since she sells her jewerly for different prices. Currently she has steady customers, friends, family members, and passersby who come to her house every day to shop, and she personally attends to them with happiness and enthusiasm. With this loan of 500 PEN, she will purchase jewelry like earrings, necklaces, and rings maD. out of fine metals. She sells them both wholesale and retail to offer better service to her customers. Norith hopes to start her own jewelry store, and she says that she is going to make her dream a reality because she is a woman who achieves what she sets out to do. She is thankful for the support that she keeps receiving to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fine metals

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La señora Maritza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mas que Vencedoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Deseando generar sus propios ingresos, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por diferentes dificultades, su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante sola le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de preparación y venta de bebidas refrescantes propias de la región como: chichas de maíz y chichas de jora y como complemento también vende  algunos insumos como huevos, papel higiénico.Maritza, vende sus chichas en su misma casa y también sale por las calles a ofrecer y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que la mayoría son sus vecinos, transeúntes de la ciudad  y amigos, tiene mucha acogida y sus ventas le van muy bien.Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos para sus preparar sus bebidas como: 2 sacos  de harina de maíz amarillo y un saco de azúcar, así como ingredientes para dar sabor a sus bebidas como: clavo de olor, canela, piñas, hielos. Parte del dinero lo invertirá también en la compra de leña para cocinar las chichas. Maritza,  se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de bebidas, sueña con  implementar su misma bodega, en un local muy bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the “Mas que Vencedoras” Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, in San Martín Province, in the Region of San Martín. She is 29 years old and lives with her partner and 2 dependent children.
Wishing to generate her own income, she decided to set up her own business. She tells us that she has faced many difficulties in her life, but her ever-fighting spirit and her desire to succeed on her own served her well in starting her own business preparing and selling refreshing regional drinks like chichas de maiz and chichas de jora. She sells additional items like eggs and toilet paper.
Maritza sells her chichas in her home and out in the streets. Little by little she became well-known among her customers who are mostly her neighbours, people passing through the city and her friends. She is very popular and her sales are going very well.
With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase ingredients to prepare her drinks like two bags of yellow corn flour and one bag of sugar, as well as flavouring ingredients like cloves, cinnamon, pineapples, and ice. She will also use part of the money to purchase firewood to cook her drinks.
Maritza feels she has a lot of strength to continue selling drinks. She dreams of setting up her shop at a well-fitted location to better serve her customers. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her realise her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her drinks and some products

loans.name: Glendys

texts.es: La señora Glendys, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años, 03 hijos; que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Lleva varios años ejerciendo este tipo de trabajo, donde poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección de ropas para dormir, confeccionadas por ella misma.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,200.00, desea invertirlo comprando telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Glendys, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs Glendys is a member of the Community Bank "Siempre Unidas", in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 children who go to school and still depend on her.

She has had a tailoring shop at her home for several years and little by little has been able to have an income and save money. Because of her ability sewing and with the support of Manuela Ramos she decided to start her own business.She states that the sales are doing very well. She works by customer’s orders. One of her dreams is to start to design and make sleeping clothes.

She has loyal customers that every day go to her shop to place orders. Mrs Glendys personally attends to them with the kindness that characterizes her.

She is asking for a loan of $400 that will invested in buying meters of different kinds of fabrics, tools such as scissors, needles, a sewing machine, pins and buttons. Mrs. Glendys feels like a very accomplished woman, with more desire to achieve and realize her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her and other entrepreneurial women to start a business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es: La señora Paquita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y 04 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Paquita, es una mujer trabajadora y Luchadora, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar con muchas ganas y así hacer profesionales a sus hijos, esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Nos cuenta que se inicio vendiendo verduras; y poco a poco fue ahorrando, de esta manera es que decidió implementar su propio negocio.Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. En su puesto, sus clientes encuentra lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región y de otras partes del país. para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. Paquita, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse en lo como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paquita is a member of the Community Bank "Siempre Unidas" in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province. She is 44 years old and has 4 children who still depend on her.

Paquita feels motivated to keep working hard to give a high education to her children. She is very happy with the work she performs which is selling fruits and vegetables at the Central Market in the city. Her business is doing very well because she is well known among her customers. She started selling vegetables and saving little by little until she decided to set her own booth. She has the support of her children.In her booth the customers can find what they need to prepare salads and juices. She personally attended it with a smile.

She is asking for a loan of $1000 that will be invested buying sacks of oranges, mandarins, lemons, citron, tapereba (a small orange) and some other tropical fruits of the region and some other areas of the country. So she can offer a better selection to her customers. Paquita states she has achieved some of her life goals and thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her to start a business and be an entrepreneur woman.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La señora Dora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 72 años 06 hijos, que ya no dependen D. ella y tienen sus familias.Se inicio con la venta D. queso; hace muchos años atrás, nos cuenta que se iniciaron con S/. 500.00 y trabajaban con pedidos D. sus clientes, ahora se encuentra mas establecida, ya que cuentan con un fundo donD. crían sus ganados vacunos y a diario extraen leche para la preparación D. los quesos que los  prepara en su misma casa.  Con el préstamo D. S/. 500.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos como: cuajos D. leche, limón en kilos, sal y algunos moldes para sus quesos. Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro,  cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante y brindarle una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Señora Dora belongs to the Banco Comunal "Siempre Unidas", Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. She 72 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom no longer depend on her and have famillies of their own. She began selling cheese many years ago, starting with 500.00 soles and working only when she received orders from customers. Today, she is more established, working together with a ranch where they raise cattle. The cattle are milked every day so that she may prepare her cheeses, which she makes in her own home. With this loan of 500.00 soles, she will invest in the purchase of supplies such as rennet, kilos of lemon, salt, and various molds for her cheeses. She is very satisfied with the work that she does. Even though it is difficult, she believes that her work is worth the sacrifice in order to fulfill the dreams and goals she has laid out for herself over the course of her life. She gives thanks to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering help both to her and to other women who want to improve their lives and achieve peace and happiness as their lives advance into old-age.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara insumos, para elaborar sus quesos

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La señora Edith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 1 hijo,  tiene estudios superiores (Técnico en Enfermería), vive en el Barrio Chanu Chanu en Puno.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 7 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra  de lana.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, lo utilizará para la compra de lanas acrílica de diferentes colores, lana de alpaca al por mayor, y los vende en Lima, a veces atiende pedidos  en artesanías en variedades diversas.
 
Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando, y buscar un contacto internacional para exportar directamente.

A ella le gustan la  unión entre las socias, las actividades que realizan y las charlas.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 32, in a common law marriage, and has one son. She has a college education (Nurse’s Technician). She lives in the Chanu Chanu neighborhood in Puno.. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost seven years. She bought wool with an initial loan for 300 PEN. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy different colors of acrylic wool and wholesale alpaca wool. She will sell them in Lima. Sometimes she takes handicraft orders of diverse varieties. Her biggest desire is to keep working and to look for an international contact to be able to export directly. She likes the unity between members, the activities they do, and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy acrylic wool

loans.name: Madrith

texts.es: La señora Madrith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos, en etapa escolar y que aún dependen de ella.Se inicio hace dos años en el negocio de Ventas de Zapatos  y Sábanas, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/. 800.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de modelos y tallas.Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprara Zapatos en diferentes modelos y tallas, asimismo sabanas que tiene como pedidos de sus clientes; para así mantener surtido sus productos y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Madrita belongs to the Siempre Unidas Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is 40, married, and she has three school aged, dependent children. Two years ago she started her business of selling shoes and sheets. She was driven by the intention of helping with the family income. She had 800 PEN, which was very well invested. She continues with the same business, only now she deals in larger quantities and a variety of styles and sizes. She also sells sheets that her customers order. That way she keeps her products in stock in order to satisfy her customers’ demanding tastes. She is very pleased to have belonged for many years to a group of women who have helped her overcome difficulties that she at one time had. Now, she can confront difficulties with much strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and sheets

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es: La señora Exilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años, 02 hijos que son Independientes.Exilda, es una mujer que a su edad, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar hasta donde Dios le de fuerzas, se siente muy bien con lo que hace, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Nos cuenta que se inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras en su misma casa y se dio cuenta que no vendía mucho; así que decidió implementar su negocio en el mercado. Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita, para preparar sus comidas y refrescos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa, que día a día, regala a sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. Exilda, se siente una mujer luchadora, y contenta por haber cumplido algunas metas que tenia trazada en su vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Exilda belongs to the Siempre Unidas (United Forever) Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 47 years of age, married and has two children who are no longer dependent on her. Exilda is a woman who at her age feels able to keep going and working for as long as God gives her the strength. She feels good about what she does, which is selling fruits and vegetables in the Central Market of the City. Her sales are going very well since she is well known by her customers. Exilda says that she began selling fruits and vegetables in her own house but she realized that she wasn't selling very much. So she decided to open her business in the market. She still has the same business and is very satisfied with how it's going. She also has the support of her children. She now has a loyal clientele who come to shop every day in the market, where they have everything the the lady of the house needs to prepare meals and refreshments. She personally takes care of them with the smile which she gives her customers day after day. This loan of 1,500 Sols will be used to buy sacks of oranges, mandarins, lemons, citrons, taperibá (Fruit of the Tapir, or Hog Plum; a close relative of the mango) and all different varieties of fruit to provide better service to her customers so that they will find what they need. Exilda seems to be a hardworking woman who is pleased with having reached the goals that she has set for herself in life. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to set up her business and also helping many other women who want to develop themselves personally as well as in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Guida

texts.es: La señora Guida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Conquistadoras de Morales”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.Lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. Guida se inicio, con un capital de 200.00, vendiendo Juanes, a la orilla  del río.Tuvo que pasar por altas y bajas, para llegar a ser una pequeña empresaria y administrar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, sin dar cuentas a nadie. Con su esfuerzo y vigor, llego a implementar ahora su bodega, es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias son buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa.Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. Guida, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Señora Guida belongs to the “Las Conquistadoras de Morales” community bank in the Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 37 years old, and has two children, both of whom she supports. She has many years of experience selling groceries. Guida started her business with 200.00 in capital, selling Juanes on the edge of the river. She went through ups and downs to become a small business owner and to turn a profit without anyone's help. Through hard work and dedication, she was able to build her business and open her storefront. She is well known by her clients in the neighborhood where she lives and her daily sales are good. Currently she runs her business out of her house. She will use the loan for S/. 300.00 to purchase more merchandise such as rice, sacks of sugar, cleaning supplies, soft drinks, and various products to keep her customers happy. She is a very ambitious woman who wants to get ahead so that she can support her family. Guida would like to thank Manuela Ramos, a nonprofit microfinance organization, for allowing her to grow as a business woman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Coni

texts.es: La señora Coni, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mas Que Vencedoras II”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 26 años, 01 hijo; que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Su espíritu  luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en muy pequeña cantidad y empezó vendiendo huevos y galletas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Aura Maria  se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos, y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Coni belongs to the community bank “Mas Que Vencedoras II” (“More than Victorious II”) in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is single and is 26 years old. She has 1 child who depends on her and is studying. Her fighting spirit has always characterised her, and her earnings have improved her life by her own efforts she has been able to begin her own business selling groceries in very small quantities, and she began selling eggs and chickens, and little by little she gained experience in this type of work. She has become very well known and liked among her clients. Currently she has a loyal client base who come to her store daily to shop, where they find all that they need, that the housewife needs. She personally attends to her clients with the kindness that characterises her. With this loan of S/1,000.00, she would like to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar in sacs, vermicelli noodles in packets, milk and conserved fish in boxes and in a variety of brands, utensils for the home, and personal hygiene products so that she can provide better attention to the needs of her clients. Saint Maria fills her with strength to continue working, to move ahead in life, and to assure a good future for her children. She gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for helping her reach her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for Coni's store

loans.name: Luz Ayde

texts.en:
Luz is a 39-year-old single mother with two children who runs an optometry store in Cusco, Perú.  This will be her second loan with Arariwa.  She used the last loan to purchase frames, contact lenses and other eyewear accessories for her store.  With this loan she hopes to purchase more frames (her most profitable item), as well as renovate the shop with a new storefront window and display.  

Luz is a member of a communal bank called "REAL". She is one of sixteen members who meets monthly with a loan officer for repayments and financial training. She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To rennovate her optometry store

loans.name: Denis Ivan

texts.en:
Denis has a small hardware store that sells electrical goods, tubing and PVC piping to individuals and local contractors. Each month he purchases merchandise wholesale from distributors in Lima. With this loan, Denis plans to purchase more electronics to sell in his store.

Denis is 32 years old and has one child with his common-law wife. They live in Cusco, Perú.

Denis is currently the group leader for "REAL", a communal bank made up of 16 members that lends from Arariwa. Each month they meet with a loan officer at the Arariwa headquarters in the Wanchaq district of Cusco. He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a hardware store

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel P. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños a los cuales quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
A la vivienda del señor Juan Manuel le está haciendo falta un portón al frente de la casa paro en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder le pagar a la persona que realizara el portón. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder poner el portón y más que nada la seguridad de sus niños cundo estén en la casa.
Don Juan Manuel ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Manuel P. is the father of a family, and he has two small children whom he wants to do better for. Señor Juan Manuel’s home is missing a front portion of the house wall, and at the moment he doesn’t have the money needed to pay the workmen who could do the repair. This is why he is asking for a loan, to be able to replace the wall and, more than anything, for the security of his children when they are in the house. Don Juan Manuel has already had a loan with FVP which he repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a portion of Juan's home

loans.name: Delmy Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Delmy Azucena R. C. tiene ya dedicándose a su negocio de abarrotes desde hace ya más de seis años, es la fuente de ingreso para darles lo mejor a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder  surtir la tienda y así tener más ingreso para su familia.
La señora Delmy ya ha tenido tres créditos en FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Señora Delmy Azucena R. C. has been working at her grocery business for more than 6 years. It is the source of the income that gives her children the best as she is a single mother. The business lacks a variety of merchandise, but at the moment she doesn’t have the money necessary for the investment. This is why she is asking for a loan, to be able to grow the store and so have a better income for her family. Señora Delmy has already completed three loans with FVP, which she repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for Delmy's shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Interior finishing

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Leobardo C. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material que se requiere, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así realizar tener su casa terminada.
Don Leobardo es empleado de una maquiladora en el departamento de técnico en mantenimiento, está es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte se para pagar el crédito.
Cuando se realizo la visita al domicilio del señor Leobardo el estaba en horario de trabaja y quien nos atendió fue su esposa el señora Rosa Elva Quiroga quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Leobardo C.' house is missing the exterior finishing, but right now he doesn't have the money necessary to buy the material needed. This is the reason he seeks a loan, with which he will be able to have a finished home.

Leobardo is an employee at a "maquiladora" (an assembly plant) in the technical maintenance department. This is the source of income that he has for his family and with which he will be able to pay back the loan.

When we made this visit to the home of Leobardo, it was during the work day, so his wife, Rosa Elva Quiroga, let us in. She is the person in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the exterior of his home

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena P. tiene tres hijos D. edad  escolar bajo su responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera. 
En este momento necesita pagar la colegiatura D. la escuela y L. exámenes pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo. 
La señora María Elena ya ha tenido seis créditos con FVP L. cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
María Elena P. has three school-aged children whom she cares for as a single mother. Right now, she needs to pay for their school's fees and exams, but she does not have the necessary money to do so. This is the reason she seeks this loan.

María Elena has taken out 6 loans with FVP and has always paid them back punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School fees

loans.name: Cumavi Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: CUMAVI fue fundado el 02 D. MARZO del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir. Se encuentra situado en el Barrio VILLA UNION D. la zona Plan 3000. El grupo  esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, como Presidenta tenemos a la señora: MARUJA MARCIA M., Tesorera: MARIA CRISTINA F. y D. Secretaria: ANGELA S. D.,  en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. sandalias, comida, costura y sastreria, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi, tienda D. viveres, venta D. ropa D. interior, que son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos. Las Señoras estan conformes D. trabajar con Emprender, porque aprendieron ahorrar y tener  responsabilidades, respeto y al mismo tiempo compartir con sus amigas y vecinas cada quincena. 			
			
			
			
			
La Sra.MARUJA MARCIA M.  es Presidenta del grupo, es nueva  como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento.La Sra.MARUJA MARCIA M.. Ella se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales medicinales además D. que también trabaja como profesora D. primaria, atienD. a sus hijos, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la defraudara .Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. La Sra MARUJA MARCIA M.  con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar.			
			
			
			
			
La Sra. MARIA CRISTINA F. , ella es nueva como Tesorera del Banco D. Emprendimiento. Ella se dedica al rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos(Avon,Yanbaly Esika) , dentro del rubro tiene 2 años D. antiguedad ,y tambien  realiza labores D. casa. Ella es muy responsable dentro del grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la defraudara. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia y ademas D. considerarla que  es  responsable y cumplida en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda el grupo y Emprender no va defraudarla. La Sra .es unas D. las fundadoras del grupo.			
			
			
			
			
La Sra.ANGELA S. D.,  ella es la secretaria del grupo,se dedica a la venta D. ropa, tiene 3 años D. antigüedad  en el rubro, trabaja todos los días D. la semana, 8 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su tienda en las ferias D. los diferentes barrio del Plan 3000. La Sra es fundadora  del grupo.
texts.en:
Group: CUMAVI was founded on March 2, 2009, and was the initiative of a group of women who have small businesses and wish to continue. It is located in the Villa Union neighborhood in the Plan 3000 area. The group is in it's 2nd loan cycle, is comprised of 10 people. The president is Maruja Marcia M.. Treasurer: Maria Cristina F.. Secretary: Angela S. D.. In the group, there are women who sell sandals, sell food, work as seamstresses, sell cosmetics, pills, mocochinchi refreshments, operate a general store, or sell lingerie, all of which are activities that require loans soon. They are working with Emprender because they learned to save and to have responsibilities, respect, and at the same time, to share with their friends and neighbors every two weeks.

Maruja Marcia M. is the president of the group. She recently assumed the role of president for the group. She sells natural medicinal products and also works as a primary school teacher. She takes care of her children, is a very kind and dynamic person, and she is also a very accomplished and responsible group member, and she will not disappoint Emprender with this opportunity. She is one of the leaders of the group and ensures that all the women make their repayments. She supports her household with her income

Maria Cristina F. is the new treasurer for the group. She sells cosmetics (Avon, Yanbaly Esika). She has been in this sector for 2 years. She also does housework. She is very responsible within the group and she will not disappoint Emprender with this great opportunity. She supports her family with her income, and she is considered to be very responsible and accomplished in the group and she is one of the founders.

Angela S. D. is the secretary of the group. She sells clothes and has three years of experience in this sector. She works every day of the week, for 8 hours per day. The majority of her work consists of attending to the people who visit her shop in the markets in the different neighborhoods of Plan 3000. She is one of the founders of the group.


Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and inventory

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la dama Silvia Elena N. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa el cual comercializa en su propio tramo donde es visitada a diario por muchos clientes.

Ella ha vendido todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Hoy en día, la razón por la cual ella ha solicitado un crédito es para la compra de la ropa porque le es de necesidad adquirirla y así lograr salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
At the Mercado Central in the city of Chinandenga, Silvia Elena N. runs a clothing business. She has her own stall where many customers visit her daily.
She has sold all kinds of clothing for women, men and children. She has now requested a loan to purchase the clothing she needs to make her business successful.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Lilliam De Jesús

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Lilliam de Jesús M. se ha dedicado desde hace 10 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida elaborando diferentes platillos los cuales son ofrecidos por ella misma en las inmediaciones del mercado.

Ella hoy en día, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicita un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los deliciosos alimentos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que hoy más que nunca requiere de inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
At the Mercado Central in the city of Chinandenga, Lilliam de Jesús M. has run a business making and selling food for 10 years. She makes different dishes and offers them herself around the market.
She has now approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy ingredients for her delicious dishes, and thus make her business successful. She needs to invest in her business now more than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make food

loans.name: Floriselda

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo y con mucha alegría, en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Floriselda F. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de carteras las que son vendidas por ella misma en su localidad donde muchas personas le visitan para comprar dichos productos.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un Nuevo crédito para la compra de las carteras ya que debe de invertir en este negocio y así seguir logrando la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes que solicitan las carteras.
texts.en:
In the Mercado Central of the city of Chinandega, Floriselda F. enthusiastically and happily runs a business selling handbags. She sells the bags herself in her shop and many people visit to buy her products.
She has come to Ceprodel to request a new loan to purchase handbags. She needs to invest in this business to continue satisfying each and every one of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handbags

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
Uno de los grandes sueños que por mucho tiempo ha tenido la señora Petrona E. es ampliar su negocio de venta de verduras ofreciendo mas cantidades en su localidad en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Hoy en día, ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel solicitando un crédito para la compra de las verduras ya que le es necesario adquirirlas para continuar ofreciéndolas a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona E. said that one of her biggest dreams is to expand her business selling vegetables. She would like to offer a larger quantity of produce from her vending location in the central market of Chinandega.

Today, she is seeking support from Ceprodel by requesting a loan to purchase vegetables. It is necessary that she acquire more produce to offer her customers so that she can increase her business earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, antes que el sol salga, la señora María A. ya tiene abierto su negocio de pulpería esperando que los clientes le visiten para adquirir los productos en su localidad en la ciudad de Chinandega.

Con el objetivo de mejorar su situación económica y salir adelante por medio de la compra de los productos de pulpería, ella ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos y así mejorar su condición llevando siempre el sustento a su hogar cubriendo las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
In the early morning before the sun comes out, Mrs. María A. has opened for business and is waiting for customers to visit and purchase products from her store in the city of Chinandega.

To improve her economic situation and continue her grocery business, she is requesting a loan to purchase more products. She is always looking to improve her standard of living and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products

loans.name: Las Progresivas Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: LAS PROGRESIVAS  fue fundado el 20 DE NOVIEMBRE del 2008, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras .Se encuentra situado en el Barrio PRIMAVERA , situado enl la calle 4, de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo  esta en su 3er ciclo, compuesto por 12 personas,como Presidenta tenemos a la señora:ANA YNGA R. J., Tesorera : FABIOLA P. D.  y de Secretaria: IDALMI S. R.. En el grupo hay señoras y señores que se dedican a la venta de cosmeticos, comida, venta de Hamburguesa, pasteleras, venta de bijouteria, venta de cd y dvd, venta de zapatos. Son actividades que necesitan créditos rápidos.			
			
La Sra.Ana Ynga R. J.  ella es la presidente del Banco de Emprendimiento, .Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y con este nuevo credito ofrecera zapatos tambien, dentro del rubro tiene 3 años de antiguedad, asimismo  realiza labores de casa. La Sra.Ana Ynga R. J.  es  responsable dentro del grupo y la oportunidad que le brI. Emprender no la defraudara. Con los ingrersos que percibe ayuda al sustento de su familia. La Sra, es  responsable y cumplida en el grupo además de ser una de las fundadoras del Banco de Emprendiemiento LAS PROGRESIVAS.		
			
La Sr. Roberto G. es socio antiguo del del Banco de Emprendimiento.Él se dedica a la venta de CD's, tambien se dedica al mantenemiento de computadoras. Es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo, la oportunidad que le brI. Emprender es importante para él para incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Tambien él es uno de los lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.			
			
La Sra. Fabiola P. es la tesorera del grupo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pasteles,  tiene 3 años de antigüedad  en el rubro , trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia, su trabajo es elaborar los pasteles y entregarlos a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito en el Banco de Emprendieminto, esta muy contenta con la oportunidad que le brI. Emprender y el grupo LAS PROGESIVAS .
texts.en:
Cooperative Bank: LAS PROGRESIVAS was founded on November 20, 2008, at the initiative of a group of women. It is located in the PRIMAVERA neighborhood, located on 4th Street in the Plan 3000 zone. The group is in its 3rd cycle, and is comprised of 12 people. We have as our President: Mrs. ANA YNGA R. J., Treasurer: FABIOLA P. D. and Secretary: IDALMI S. R.. The group has women and men who dedicate themselves to selling cosmetics, food, hamburgers, bakery goods, jewelry, CDs and DVDs, and footwear. These are activities that require fast credit approvals. Ana Ynga R. J. is the president of the cooperative bank. She dedicates herself to clothing sales and, with this new loan, she will also start selling shoes. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and, concurrently, she takes care of the household tasks. Ana Ynga R. J. is responsible for the group, and she will not disappoint given the opportunities presented by Emprender. Her income helps to sustain her family. This woman is responsible and accomplished within the group, in addition to being one of the founders of the LAS PROGRESIVAS cooperative bank. Mr. Roberto Galves is a long-time member of the cooperative bank. He sells CDs and also does computer maintenance work. He is a responsible member of the group, and the opportunities provided by Emprender are important to him in order to augment his income and improve his standard of living. He is also one of the leaders of the group, ensuring that loan payments are made on time. Mrs. Fabiola P. is the treasurer of the group, and she dedicates herself to making and selling cakes. She has been in this line of work for 3 years, working 6 days a week for 8 hours per day. She makes cakes and delivers them to her customers. This is the second loan by the cooperative bank, and she is very grateful for the opportunities provided by Emprender and the LAS PROGRESIVAS group.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es:
La señora Claudia P. es una dama esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de tienda de ropa para niños la que es comercializada en su propio establecimiento en la ciudad de Chinandega donde es muy visitada por personas que compran los diferentes productos para niños.

Entre los productos que ella vende se encuentran pachas, bañeras, juguetes, ropa y zapatos todo para los infantiles. El motivo por el cual ella solicita el crédito es para la compra de los productos y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Claudia P. is a hard-working woman who dedicates herself to her business selling children’s clothing, which she runs out of her own home in the city of Chinandega. People that buy different products for children frequent her store. The types of items she sells include baby bottles and bathtubs, toys, clothes and shoes for infants. The reason she requests a loan is so she can buy more products and this way generate additional income to improve her beloved family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's products.

loans.name: Josefina De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La dama Josefina J., a sus 30 años de edad se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos en la ciudad de Chinandega donde oferta los electrodomésticos en su propia localidad.

Ella ha adquirido un crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos y para ello espera en que el crédito que solicitó en Ceprodel le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así proceder a la compra de los electrodomésticos que tanto requiere para vender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina J., at 30 years of age, dedicates herself to selling home electronics in the city of Chinandega. She offers her goods in her own locality. She has taken credit so she can buy more products, and hopes the loan she requested in Ceprodel will be granted so she can proceed with supplying her business with more home electronics items that she needs badly to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home electronics products.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Con una gran sonrisa para todos sus clientes, en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Martha D. se dedica a su negocio de venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma y ofrecidos todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ocuparlo para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Es por esta razón que espera ser beneficiada con un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
With a big smile for all her customers, in the central market of the city of Chinandega, Martha D. sells food that she prepares and offers every day, starting very early in the morning. Presently, she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy raw materials to make the food. It’s for this reason that she hopes to be given a loan from Ceprodel to buy the raw materials to make food and offer it to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 35  años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 12 años se dedica a la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, junto a su esposo trabaja incansablemente desde tempranas horas de la madrugada para preparar el horno que cose las tejas y ladrillos que termina de modelar por la tarde, posteriormente los deposita en el horno para la cocción durante 3 días aproximadamente. Este esfuerzo que realiza ella y su esposo tiene su recompensa cuando llegan a vender sus ladrillos y teas por millares  en las ferias de construcción de su ciudad. Para el futuro, Dominga desea tener su propio terreno que será su fábrica permanente, pues por el momento alquila el terreno. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo en MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, donde viene trabajando hace varios años, el cual es para ella un espacio de crecimiento personal. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la fabricación de sus tejas, los cuales son aserrín y leña, debido a que en esta época del año es donde aumentan las ventas.
texts.en:
Dominga is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children in a home of their own. For over 12 years now their livelihood has been making and selling bricks and slate. She and her husband work tirelessly starting early in the morning to prepare the furnace which they finish in the afternoon. They then put the bricks and slate in the furnace and wait approximately 3 days for the finished product. All the effort they put in their business pays off when they sell their bricks at cities nearby. In the future, Dominga would like to have her own land for her furnace instead of having to rent from someone else. This is the seventh time Dominga has a loan from MFP. She is very happy to be part of her community's bank with which she has done business for several years and where she feels serves her as a space for personal growth. The money she is requesting will be used to buy production materials such as wood and sawdust to take advantage of the season's high demand for bricks and slate.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, junto a su esposo y a sus hijos, cultiva principalmente la papa, pero cuando es época de la cosecha también vende el maíz seco para transportarlo a la ciudad capital de su país. Para la selección de sus productos contrata los servicios de varias señoras que realizan el arduo trabajo durante todo el día. Los productos que ella vende son muy bien cotizados, lo que anima más a Esther a continuar con esta actividad, la cual le permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ahora quiere acrecentar su producción, porque en la actualidad cuando tiene más demanda y no tiene productos en sus cosechas compra de sus vecinos para complacer a sus clientes. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal, puesto que le permite socializar con los demás integrantes y compartir ideas de progreso. Con el dinero que está solicitando abastecerá a sus clientes comprando mayor cantidad de maíz de colores.
texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and children in her own home. For twenty years she has worked in agriculture with her husband and children. They mainly grow potatoes, but when it is harvest season they sell dried corn that they take to the capital city of their country. For a greater selection of product, they hire the services of several women who work hard in the fields every day. The products that she sells are in demand. Esther would like to continue this activity that allows her to provide for her family. Now she would like to increase her production because when there is a lot of demand and she can’t grow enough products to meet this demand, she needs to buy from her neighbors in order to please her customers. This is the third time that she has received a loan from MFP and she is very glad to belong to this communal bank in as much as it permits her to socialize with the other members and exchange progressive ideas. With the money that she has requested she will please her customers by buying more multicolored corn.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Germán

texts.es: Germán tiene 29 años, vive en una casa arrendada con su primo y la familia de éste. Hace medio año decidió asociarse con su primo y ambos con los ahorros que tenían compraron unos predios de tierra arcillosa ideal para asentar una fábrica de ladrillos. Desde ese entonces ambos trabajan compartiendo las mismas tareas para sostener sus gastos, aunque esta labor es muy dura, es compensada por las ganancias que se dan en cada venta de cada mil ladrillos elaborados. Para German y su primo es básico tomar en cuenta cada detalle minucioso en la  elaboración de los ladrillos, en un inicio sólo trabajaban los dos, pero en la actualidad han contratado a 2 peones que les ayudan a que la producción sea más rápida. Es por ello que German está planeando para un futuro comprar un camión para transportar los ladrillos que fabrican. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él está muy contento de ver que su banco comunal ha superado varios problemas de manera airosa y por su parte renueva su compromiso de trabajar en el fortalecimiento de la unidad. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de los materiales que necesita para fabricar los ladrillos: una camionada de arena fina, aserrín, leña, entre otros.
texts.en:
Germán, 29, lives in a rented house with his cousin and his cousin’s family. Half of a year ago he decided to do business with his cousin. With the savings they both had, they bought some land with clay soil, which is an ideal place to put a brick factory. Since then they have both worked, sharing the same chores, in order to afford the expenses. Even though the work is very hard, it is compensated by the earnings they get for each sale of a thousand bricks they have made. For German and his cousin it is basic that they consider each minuscule detail when making the bricks. When they started, only the two of them worked. They currently have contracted two workers who help them so that the production is faster. In the future, German is planning to buy a truck to transport the bricks they make. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is very happy to see that his community bank has overcome various problems in a successful way. For his part, he renews his promise to work to strengthen their unity. The money he is asking for is to buy the necessary materials to make bricks; a truckload of fine sand, sawdust, and wood, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa y el menor de sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez ha estado muy ligado a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas y desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza en compañía de su esposa, quien es la que siempre vela por la buena salud de sus animales, pues de ello depende la cotización para una venta. Para mantener saludable a su ganado los lleva desde muy temprano a lugares donde abundan pastos frescos y un sol radiante, estas zonas son muy distantes de su casa, como a una hora caminando. Después de varios meses de crianza selecciona a aquellos animales que ha de vender en la feria ganadera, con cuya ganancia puede sostener, durante un tiempo prudencial, los gastos familiares. La ganadería es muy rentable para Jorge porque tiene menos riesgos de pérdida que en la agricultura y pagan un buen precio por cada animal que vende, por esta razón quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y nota que trabajar con su banco comunal es un buen respaldo cuando lo necesita. Con el dinero que solista comprará varios becerros para criarlos y venderlos cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 56 years old and lives in a home he owns with his wife and youngest child. Since his childhood he has been very connected to agicultural work and especially to live-stock farming. For the past five years he has made a living by raising and selling beef cattle. He works with his wife who always looks out for the health of the animals. The health of the animals is important when it comes to pricing and selling the animals. To keep the cattle healthly Jorge takes them out early in the morning to graze where there are abundant and fresh fields and where it is sunny. These areas are very far from his house and take about an hour to walk to. After raising the cattle for various months Jorge selects the animals that he will sell at the livestock market. The money that he makes from selling the animals allow him to provide for his family. Livestock farming is very profitable for Jorge and has less risks than growing crops. He is paid a nice sum for each animal. Because of this Jorge needs to increase the number of animals that he has. This is the third time that he is requesting a loan through MFP. He says that working with his communal bank is a great support for him. With the money that he is requesting he will buy various calves to raise and to sell when they are grown.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace medio año tiene su propia granja de cuyes, dedicándose a la limpieza y alimentación de sus animales. Todos los días por las mañanas sale a cortar alfalfa para alimentarlos y después de varias horas sacar el excremento, este método logra la salubridad de sus animales y de ella misma. Los fines de semana los lleva a las ferias ganaderas para su comercialización y también los ofrece a sus vecinos. Para un futuro cercano, Betty desea tener una granja grande e incursionar en la crianza de pollos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal y está disfrutando mucho de participar en cada reunión de coordinación de su grupo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará cuyes sementales para reproducir la cantidad de sus animales con una raza mejorada, también comprará conejos.
texts.en:
Betty is 20 years old and lives in her parents' home. She has had her own guinea pig farm business for the last six months. She takes care of the farm, cleaning and feeding the animals. Every day in the morning she cuts alfalfa leaves to feed them and then cleans after the stool to achieve the safety of her animals and herself. She takes the animals on the weekends to the livestock fairs to sell them, and also offers them to her neighbors.

For the near future, Betty wants to have a large farm and go into raising chickens. This is the first loan with MFP; she was invited to be part of the community bank and is enjoying a lot her participation at each meeting of the coordinating group. The money from the loan will be invested in buying guinea pigs to improve the race and rabbits.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and rabbits

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin M. makes a living primarily from selling clothing and footwear in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Mylin has been in this clothing business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Mylin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Mylin is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica S. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao. She is 61 years old. Veronica is married and has seven adult children. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos menores en su casa propia. DesD. hace 15 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la fabricación D. faldas típicas D. su zona, a las cuales se les llama “falda mil rayas”. Lucinda implementó un espacio en su casa para su taller y una vez que acaban D. elaborar una gran cantidad D. faldas, como mínimo D. 50, las reparten ellos mismos a los comerciantes D. su zona D. los distintos puestos D. venta. Este trabajo requiere D. todo su tiempo y esfuerzo, pero en unión a su esposo e hijos pueden lograr superar su producción y sus ventas, lo que hace que sea una actividad rentable y puedan cubrir los gastos familiares. Lucinda ve el futuro D. su negocio con grandes expectativas D. éxito y quiere extenderse a otras localidades. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, ella es una persona activa y perseverante que lucha por la unidad D. su banco comunal y se compromete nuevamente a seguir con esta actitud positiva. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra D. telas e hilos en grandes cantidades para sus próximas producciones.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 52 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home. She has been engaged along with her husband for the last 15 years, in the manufacture of skirts typical of her region, which are called "thousand strips skirt ".

Lucinda implemented a space in her house for her work room. Once she produces at least 50 skirts, they go sell them to the merchants in the area. This work requires all her time and effort, but in union with her husband and children they have been able to achieve beyond their production and sales, making it a profitable business that helps to cover the household expenses.

Lucinda has high expectations for the future of the business; she wants to distribute her skirts in other areas. This is her 8th MFP loan. She is an active and persistent person who works hard for the unity of the community bank, and is committed to continue with this positive attituD.. She is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of fabrics and yarns in large quantities for their upcoming productions.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 20 años, vive con su esposo y su bebé (de 8 meses de nacido) en casa de sus suegros. Se dedica a la venta de ganado y otros animales menores, en la actualidad posee 2 vacas y un becerro que más adelante, cuando llegue a un tamaño y peso adecuado venderá en la feria ganadera de su ciudad. Este trabajo es muy rentable, a pesar de que tiene sus riesgos, como el robo de los animales; pero para ello toma precauciones resguardándolos muy bien en su establo. En adelante, Luz va a mejorar la raza de su ganado, pues así podría vender cada animal a un mayor precio, así como también desea empezar a vender toros. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, el dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas para sembrar alfalfa para el consumo de sus animales y también comprará una vaca de mejor raza.
texts.en:
Luz is 20 years old; she lives with her husband and her 8-month old baby at her in-laws’ home. To make a living, she sells cattle as well as smaller livestock. Luz currently has two cows and a calf, which she will sell at her town's livestock market once it reaches the required size and weight. This is a very profitable activity, in spite of the risks, which include animal theft. To prevent the animals from being stolen, she keeps them well protected in her cowshed. Luz would like to start improving the breed of her stock, which would allow her to set a higher price for the animals. She would also like to start selling bulls. This is her second loan from MFP. With the loan, she will buy alfalfa seed to grow feed for her animals. She will also buy a cow with better stock.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and alfalfa seed

loans.name: Juvy Mar

texts.en:
Juvy Mar R. is married to Lyndon and is residing in Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. They have three children: one attending college and the others attending secondary school. Her husband is a gardener of vegetables and fruits while R. manages their sari-sari (variety) store. Their customers are their neighbors and passers-by.

As of now R.’s sari-sari store is improved because of the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is able to obtain loans as additional capital for her business and she enjoys, also, the other benefits like the insurance for her whole family and savings deposits.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte
