She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 which will be use to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plan to use the additional revenue generated from business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Genesis Group 6

texts.en:
Roberto P. L. has worked as a confectioner since he was a boy. Typical Dominican sweet shops usually make and sell candied fruits, jams, and a sugary caramel spread called dulce-de-leche, often mixed with dried fruit or nuts. A few months ago, Roberto decided he wanted to go into business for himself. He developed his own recipe for dulce-de-leche, and has been running his business out of his kitchen, making and distributing one batch at a time as he could accumulate the funds.

Many members of Roberto’s community, Hato Mayor, have received microloans from Esperanza and used them to get their own small businesses off the ground. Seeing their success encouraged Roberto to apply for the program, and he has become the leader of a new loan group. Roberto will use his loan to jump-start his production. He will be taking his product around to as many local stores as possible. His goal is to circulate his new product in the marketplace as quickly as possible and create brand awareness in his area.

Roberto has big dreams for his business, and gets very excited when he shares them. He has no education past elementary school and is illiterate, but he knows the confectionary business and he is determined to succeed. He wants to expand his business enough to someday open his own factory with a large workforce of 50 people or more. He recently married and has a 3-year-old daughter. His business will be his family’s primary source of income.

loans.use: Baking Supplies

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group 3

texts.en:
Victoria C. is the group leader in the ‘Jehova es mi Pastor’ group. She is the mother of three children, and helps support her family by running a small store out of the side of her home. She started her small business five years ago, and she now sells a variety of household goods and women’s clothing. 

Victoria heard about Esperanza’s program from other women in the community. This will be her first micro-loan, and she will use the money to restock the inventory in her store. 

Victoria was elated when she heard about the micro-loan program. The loan came at a time when she was worried about how she was going restock her inventory because her house budget is currently very tight. The new inventory will mean a fresh stream of income for Victoria, and she feels very good about the future of her business and her family.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es:
Josué Manuel G. G. es un joven que reciñe acaba de formar una familia, a el casi lo crió su tía por lo que ella le dio un pedazo de tierra para que fincara. G. ya levanto unos cuartos para que su esposa viva cómodamente y para que en un futuro sus hijos tengan un patrimonio y un hogar  donde no sufran las altas temperaturas. 
El trabaja de despachador de gasolina en una estación muy conocida y trabaja duro para que la economía no le afecte y tener a su esposa como ama de casa.
texts.en:
Josué Manuel G. García is a young man who just recently started a family. He was raised mostly by his aunt, who gave him a plot to build on. G. has already built a few rooms where his wife can live comfortably and which will provide an inheritance for their children and a home where they will be sheltered from the extreme heat.

He is an attendant at a well-known gas station. He works hard so that the economy won't affect him and so that his wife can be a housewife.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Maria Gudalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe C. no aparece en la fotografía pero en su representación sale el esposo.
La señora desde hace 18 años que compro ese terreno construyo su casa el cual opto por poner una tienda de abarrotes llamada “Miscelánea Titos” , donde ofrece a su clientela de todo también los fines de semana se dedica ala venta de barbacoa. Desde que ella tiene su negocio le ha ido muy bien pero ahora quiere implementar más cosas en su inventario para tener siempre al cliente satisfecho con lo que busca.
Su esposo el señor José Guadalupe le ayuda con la venta y le dedica todo el tiempo posible y sobre todo a la preparación de esa exquisita barbacoa.
La prioridad de esta familia es invertirle al negocio  para tener mas ingresos y darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe C. does not appear in this photograph; rather her husband does so to represent her. Eighteen years ago she bought land and built a house. She chose to set up a grocery store called “Miscelánea Titos” in her house. She offers her customers everything. Also, on week ends she sells barbecue. Since she has had the store it has gone very well. Now she wants to put more things in her inventory to always satisfy her customers with what they are looking for. Her husband, José Guadalupe, helps her with the sales. He helps her as much as possible, especially preparing the exquisite barbeque. The family’s priority is to invest in the business in order to have more income and give their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
T. Đỗ Thị (337041136) is a 34 year-old female living in the town of Ph úc Y ên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a restaurant where she serves a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. The previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. T. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND ($575 USD) which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be T.'s 5th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

texts.en:
O. Đỗ Thị (218981253) is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has two school-aged children.

O. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, O. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

O. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ahamad Masod Group

texts.en:
Ahamad Masod is the leader of the five-member Ahamad Masod group. All of the members would like to borrow money for their businesses to purchase more goods and make a good income to support their families in the future.

Ahamad Masod and Zeyawalah want a loan for their tailoring business so that they can buy one or two new machines.

Azmary and Amena want a loan for their general store business to buy more stock.

Latfalah wants a loan for his taxi business to purchase necessary goods.

With this loan the group members can expand and improve their businesses and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy new machines for tailoring business

loans.name: Shamsy Group

texts.en:
Shamsy is the group leader of Shamsy group. There are three members in this group and all of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Shamsy and Latifa want to take a loan for their husbands’ embroidery businesses and they want to buy necessary materials for their businesses.

Shair M. wants to take a loan for his fresh fruit cart business in order to complete his stock.

They say thank you for the loan of 29,400 Afghani. They want to say that this loan process is very useful because it can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand her husband's embroidery business and to buy necessary materials

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. started her business in 2007 and it serves her well as one of their source of livelihood. Her husband, Alfredo, is a carpenter and a "lapida" (tombstone) maker. They only have one child who is already married and currently operates a small welding machine in their house.

Lydia started her membership in PMPC in July 2008 and established a good record in the cooperative. She is now obtaining her third loan with the objective of having additional capital for her business. She is very optimistic that her loan will help her business in purchasing more stock, hence earning more profits and uplifting their standard of living.

loans.use: To use as additonal capital for her fruit and vegetable vending

location.town: Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Juvanne

texts.en:
Juvanne is from the village of Montela, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 24 years old, married, and has no children as of now.

Juvanne engages in a hog-raising business but she is also involved in a snack business as another source of income.

In April 2009, Juvannes joined the PMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and her ability to handle her hog-raising business. This loan will her first from PMPC and will be used to start her hog raising business. She plan to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To start her hog-raising business

loans.name: Jeannei

texts.en: Jeannei M. is from the town of Sapang Daalaga. She is 59 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Jeannei owns and operates a dressmaking business, primarily providing women's dressmaking services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Jeannei joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Jeannei is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be use to redeem a cocoland (a piece of land planted with coconut trees). This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her cocoland

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila B. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Mila operates a family member's business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to finance a corn production project. Mila is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will also be used to finance a corn production project. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finance corn production project

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian lives in Binuangan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She has six children and most of her children are students of the elementary and high schools. She is married to Celso.

Vivian is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and enjoys being a member because she can access capital for her livestock business. With this help she can have plenty of pigs to sell in the market because her business supplies the basic needs of her family. Now she has a happy family through the help of Paglaum.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita J. is 58 years old, a widow, and resides at Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo. She is blessed with seven children who are helping her in generating income for the family.

Conchita’s main line of business is snack and food vending. Her major customers are students and teachers because she sells near the public high school. She has been peddling for three years already.

Conchita is known to be a good member in the cooperative since she joined in July, 2008. She is now applying for her third loan with the purpose of having an additional investment in her business. She is very active in all cooperative activities instituted by the center to which she is affiliated.

Conchita is looking forward to having her loan augment her capital and improve her business status.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her snack and food-vending business

location.town: Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. lives in Barangay Madalag of Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte and is married to Danico. She has four children and all of her children are students. The family members help each other selling coconut shells.

When she became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative Elsa decided to obtain a loan for the purpose of additional capital to purchase more coconut shells and to make charcoal for her business. Her husband is her partner in his business and he is also a farmer. Now she has a happy family with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: To use as additional capital  and to buy coconut shells to make charcoal to sell

location.town: Madalag, Jose Dalan Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nacel

texts.en:
Nacel N. is single and she decided to live separately from her mother because she wanted to achieve her goal to become a businesswoman.

Nacel decided to become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is now applying for her 3rd loan as she has decided to venture into the business of cow raising.

Nacel's ambition to have a cow-raising business was fulfilled by the benefits and services of Paglaum and now she lives happily at her own place because of her successful business.

loans.use: To use for her cow-raising business

loans.name: King

texts.en:
Mrs. King T. is a 38-year-old resident of Siem Reap Province, and is the mother of three children who are students and under her care. Her husband’s name is Nhep Sang, 43, and he works driving a motorbike taxi. Mrs. King T. is currently a domestic cultivator who grows rice and various vegetables on her own farmland in the village.

Mrs. King T. is applying for a loan for her husband to replace his existing motorcycle that has not attracted the clients. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To replace her husband's existing motorcycle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia S. is 49 years of age and is married to Manuel S.. Manuel is a laborer while Cecilia sells food in their neighborhood. The couple has six children to raise and to work hard for.

Their eldest daughter, Mipa, (26 years old) was sent to college. However she chose not to continue with her studies because she knew that her parents have to send her five other siblings to school also and it will be very hard for them to cope with their financial needs. Mipa therefore, worked as a housemaid to at least augment their family income. Cecilia and her husband's income was not stable then, so that even their second child's education in high school was suspended. 

In 2005, Cecilia joined a group of women in ASHI to avail themselves with the opportunity of getting a loan. Her decision was supported by her husband, since they both need a more stable source of income, which means they need to have their own business. Previous loans Cecilia obtained have been very helpful to her and her family. They were able to start up their rice farming business and were able to send their five children to school. Presently, their second child and the third child are in high school, the fourth child is in elementary and two are preschoolers. 

Cecilia's farming business has grown so well that it requires a bigger amount of capital for sustainability. She needs to obtain a bigger loan from ASHI in order to purchase all the necessary farm inputs such as rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Also she needs to spend money on the land preparation and labor charges.

With this business, Cecilia has greater hopes and dreams for herself, her family, and her children. Being the owner and business manager, she believes that in the future her personality will be developed and she will become more sociable. Most importantly, all of her children will graduate from college and she will have more rice field to manage with the help of her husband so that they will harvest more rice and can supply the demands of their consumers.

Despite having a farming business, Cecilia did not let go of her food selling business. The food she sells offers convenience to farmers during planting season. During this time, she can have a big income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay expenses for land preparation

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz S. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old and married with three adult children. To earn a living, Paz cultivates a plot of land. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice. She has been in the business for over 5 years and she earns approximately 8750 PHP per month. In 2008, Paz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help her improve her business and living situation. This will be her fourth loan. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 15000 PHP. She is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers. She hopes to use any increase in revenue to improve her family’s living conditions. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Lak

texts.en: Lak R., 39, is a humble villager who resides in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband own a construction business, where they employ others to help provide their service. The couple has been building houses for more than nine years. They earn an average of $7 per day, which allows them feed their two children, both of whom attend public school. Lak R. requests a loan of $500. Half of the loan will be used as capital to support the construction business and the other half will be used to improve the family’s home.

loans.use: Support construction business and make home improvments

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida M. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Missamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with four adult children. Adelaida owns a sari-sari (general) store. Her income comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. to the local community. She has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2000 PHP per month. In 2009, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business activities and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to put any additional revenue back into her business to continue to grow it. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en:
Mr. Seoung V., 43, is a villager of Ang Krong District of Siem Reap Province. He is married man with two teenage children. One of his sons works in construction and provides his income to help meet his family’s daily foods needs. 

His wife, Lim Sovann (shown in the picture), age 40, is a vegetable seller.  

Mr. Seoung V. plants vegetable and fruit crops on a plot of land behind his house. He sells his mature crops two months after he begins growing them. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase a motor to help reduce the family’s daily travel costs.

loans.use: Purchase a motor

loans.name: Noeur

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Noeur D., 42 years old. She resides in Kompong Cham Province and is the mother of four teenaged children. One of her children is a garment worker, in Phnom Penh Capital, while the other three are going to school. Noeur D. is a farmer who plants a few crops to earn a living. Another source of family income is her husband’s furniture making business. Noeur D. would like to take a loan to buy a scraping machine for her husband to use in making furniture.

loans.use: To buy machinery for furniture making business.

loans.name: Keuk

texts.en: Keuk Y. is 46 years old and the mother of eight children who are still living at home. Two of her sons are employed as local building workers in the village. She sells fritters. In addition, her husband fishes in and around the Tunle Sap River. Keuk Y. has been buying housing tools in order to build a new house but construction has yet not started. Keuk Y. would like a loan from  Kiva to buy wood to begin building her house.

loans.use: To buy wood to begin building her house

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene H. hopes that her "sari- sari" (mini-variety) store will grow into a grocery store /merchandising store, which would provide complete commodities for customers. She hopes that the volume of products she sells will increase and she could be a wholesaler for people in their community who want to start their own "sari-sari" store businesses. This way, she can generate employment in her community and she can also earn more money. Arlene will not only be helping other people in the community but foremost herself and family. These aspirations are rooted from her dream of sending all of her children to school and to have them be college graduates.

Arlene believes that all of her hopes can happen through the support of ASHI and KIVA. Through a loan she received, she had the opportunity to explore her potential in running a business and achieving success. 

Arlene started from scratch but now has a  business she is proud of. The loan she received from ASHI the first time improved her growing business. The first loan was small since she only needed a little capital. Now she requests Php45,000. Arlene plans to increase the volume of the grocery items and wants to have more variety to sell. With the support of her husband,  she is confident in taking a bigger risk for her business this time. Being a woman, she believes that she will be fulfilled if she has her own business and she can help her husband earn money for the needs of her children.

loans.use: purchasing necessary commodities to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Sieng D. was born in 1982 and lives in Siem Reap Province. She is a good mother with three school-aged children. She currently sustains her family’s daily expenses by selling a few grocery items out of her home, and by growing vegetables. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who drives a motorbike taxi. Sieng D. will use this loan for capital for her grocery, and  plans to use half of the loan to repair her house and hedge.

loans.use: To accrue capital for her grocery

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en: Since 1980 Nourn M. has had a business selling fruit near a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. She has an income of US$12 per day. She lives with her husband and her two children; the elder is working at a garment factory and the younger is in high school. Her husband is a village chief who usually earns around US $5 per day. M. wants a loan of US $1000 to expand her inventory. She hopes to generate more income if her business plan succeeds.

loans.use: buying more fruit

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is married and is 43 years old. Emma lives in Tibig, a village in Silang, Cavite, with her husband and five-year-old daughter (shown behind Emma in the picture).

Emma operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in Tibig. The store, which she’s been running for four years, makes 47,500 PHP in profits per month. 

Emma applied for a 50,000 PHP loan from CCT to expand her store’s inventory. Emma joined CCT four years ago and previously had a 32,000 PHP loan from CCT, which she repaid on time. Emma hopes to use the profits from the business to renovate the family’s house and pay for her daughter's education.

loans.use: Expand her store's inventory

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson G. is 43 years old and has a daughter in school.  He is single and  lives in Silang, Cavite. 

Nelson has been raising hogs for five years, and earns approximately 28,000 PHP per month from the business. 

Nelson has applied to CCT for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase feed, a scale, and other supplies for his livestock business. Nelson joined CCT in 2006 and previously repaid a 50,000 PHP loan. As his business grows, he plans to use the profits to renovate the pigpen to improve the pigs’ living conditions, and to pay tuition for his daughter’s schooling.

loans.use: Feed, a scale, and other supplies

loans.name: Tea

texts.en: Tea S., 49, has worked for the government as a soldier since 2000. He is based in Phnom Penh City and has an income of US $6 per day. His wife sells groceries from her house in the village; she has an income of US $6 per day. Together, they have 4 school-aged children. S. wants to borrow US $200 to expand his wife's grocery business. He said his house is convenient for this business, and he hopes to generate more income for the family's use and expenses. (S.'s wife is pictured at her grocery store).

loans.use: buying more groceries

loans.name: Peth

texts.en: Peth M., 51, is a handicraft maker who braids cradles to sell. She lives with her family in the Province of Siem Reap. She has been blessed with six children; three are married and have already started new homes, while the others are single and work in different jobs. Her husband, Cheun Chok, 58, is a local fisherman. Peth M. is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her son to use to transport fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget S., 30, is a construction builder in the city, with an income of US $4 per day.  His wife stays at home selling boiled sweet potato (a very common tropical plant usually boiled and made into a dessert), with a typical income of US $5 per day. They live with their two school-aged children and they want to improve their business. The current economic condition has made  them struggle lately, and they need more money to save to facilitate their children’s study. So S. has asked for a loan US $200 to purchase more potatoes and fruit to expand his wife’s business. (S.'s wife is in the picture)

loans.use: buying more potatoes and fruits

loans.name: Turmunh

texts.en: Turmunh J. lives with his wife and 6-year-old son in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He makes wooden furniture for local customers. Most of his customers are newly married couples who would like to furnish their homes. He mostly makes traditional wooden furniture, including wooden chairs, tables, beds, etc. He has been in the furniture-making business since 2005. In order to attract more locals, he focuses on the quality and design of the furniture that he makes. Since the start, his business has expanded; his business capital has increased from 300,000 MNT to 780,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). With the profits, he was able to equip his small carpentry shop with necessary machinery. He says that in the future, he hopes to have his own small furniture factory for providing quality furniture for locals.  He requests a loan to purchase more cut wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, planks as a raw material

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D. V. is a married, 56-year-old woman with four adult children. Josefina is shown, with her husband, in the photo above. They live in Pooc, a village in Silang, Cavite.

Josefina works in a family member’s business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell in the local area. The family business has been operating for 39 years and earns profits of 25,000 PHP per month.

Josefina has applied for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer for this crop season. Josefina has repaid, on time, a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from CCT, which she joined in 2006. With increasing profits from the business, Josefina would like to buy more lots to further expand the business by growing more crops.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer.

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en: Togtohbayar J. lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. The youngest son is 20 years old and is a third year student at the Mongolian University of Science and Technology in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Togtohbayar has a small business in livestock raising and selling. He purchases livestock including sheep, cattle and goat, in the springtime when meat price plummets. He feeds the animals that he bought in the spring until the fall when meat price peaks at its seasonal high point in the year. He mostly slaughters the animals in the fall and sells the meat at the local market. He and his wife have been in the livestock business since 1995. Since the start, he and his wife have done well; the business capital has increased from 500,000 MNT to 5,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to purchase more livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his business.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Ren K. is 56 years old. She is mother to five children: one is married and lives independently and the others are single and work in construction. Ren K. and her husband currently are local cultivators who grow rice and various vegetables on the farmland that was inherited from their grandparents. They grow two crops per year. This couple sells their mature crops every two months after they plant. This family's living conditions are not so very good. Their house is too old and small for them. Therefore, Ren K. has decided to seek a loan of $600 to add to her savings in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira T. is from the village of Puntod. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Elmira owns & operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elmira has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Elmira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmira repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to  purchase additional products to sell. Elmira is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Elmira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech E., 26, lives in SiE. Reap Province, where she earns her daily income by selling a few vegetables in the local market. She also plants a variety of crops on the land next to her house, while her husband works with her in growing crops. They have been married for a year but have no children. Pech E. hopes to earn additional profit by using a loan from Kiva to build a store in her home where she will sell a few groceries for her neighbors.

loans.use: To build a store in her home where she will sell groceries to neighbors

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam V., 41, manufactures handicraft decorations and a very common Cambodian dessert. Her typical income is US $2.50 per day. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works for ADB (Asia Development Bank) in Pusat Province, he has a daily income of US $3.50. To improve her family's standard of living, V. has decided to request a loan US $500 to purchase a motorbike.  In this way she can  transport her goods to sell at local markets, where her repeat customers are ready buy her products.

loans.use: buying a motorbike

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Сафарова Зухра проживает в райоен Турсунзаде. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Зухра более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на оынке, где в основном торгует продуктами питания. Ей также в этом помогает ее муж. Клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zuhra S. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 50 years old, married and has 1 child. Zuhra has been involved in sales for over 10 years. She has a retail stand at the market, where she primarily sells food products. Her husband helps her with the business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Thla

texts.en: Thla T., 41, raises pigs and plants cucumbers to sell on the plot of land at her house, around 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She earns an income of approximately US$ 2.5. She is married and has three children. One of her children is a student, and the rest are employed at a garment factory. Her husband operates a business purchasing used motorbikes and reselling them at a fairly profitable price. Seeing an opportunity to generate a better income for the family, primarily from cultivation, T. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to expand her business by purchasing fertilizer, plants, and animal food.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en: Hoeurng S., 40, is a local fish vendor who has been running this sector since 2000. She is earning an average of $3 income each day to contribute to her family’s expenses. She is a good mother blessed with seven teenaged children. Two of her children are employed as internal staff members for a hotel. Another source of family income comes from her husband’s occupation, owning a machine to pump a piece of sand to sell. Hoeurng S. requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle to make her family's transportation easier and the remainder of the loan to order extra fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for family transportation.

loans.name: Karema Group

texts.en:
Karema is the group leader of the Karema group, which has four members.
Karema and Sareya want a loan for their carpet-weaving business; they want to buy necessary materials. A. W. wants a loan for his taxi business, and wants to buy necessary materials. Omid wants a loan for his metal shop business; he wants to add to his stock and enlarge his shop. They all want to expand and improve their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families. 
They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank all AFSG and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: enlarge their business

loans.name: Hort

texts.en: Hort K., 57, is involved in a business in the agriculture sector. He plants corn and farms tree fruit for sale on his plot of land, located about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has a typical income of US$ 2.5 approximately. He is married and has three children. One of his children is a student, and the rest are employed at a garment factory. He also specializes in traditional fishing. He produces ordinary fishing tools and goes fishing on his own. Seeing an opportunity to generate a better income for his family in agriculture sector, Teng is asking for a loan of US $800 to expand his business by purchasing corn seeds, fertilizer, manure and materials for creating fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools, corn seed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Jane

texts.en:
Ana Jane M. is from the village of Danao. She is 24 years old. Ana Jane is married. To make a living, Ana Jane owns & operates a fishing business in which she harvests & sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ana Jane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ana Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Ana Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Ana Jane is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ana Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Атахонов Бахтиер проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Бахтиер со своей семьей, более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Он покупает, откармливает и продает мелко рогатый скот. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bahtier A. lives in the Rumy district. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Bahtier and his family have been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He buys, feeds and sells small livestock. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: The woman in the photo, Yim S., 21, is a villager who lives in the rural area of Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are fishermen. They depend on fishing in and around Tunle Sap River, that is the main place of where the fish are found. This couple normally generates an income of $3 a day to buy food for their two children, who are still young and under their care. Recently, this couple has not been able to catch as much fish due to their fishing equipment breaking down. Because of this problem, Yim S. is asking for a loan to buy additional tools for their fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy additional tools for their fishing business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is from the village of Danao. She is 30 years old, is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a fishing business; the main source of income comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Irene is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of  her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang C. H., 47, grows corn and vegetables for sale on her plot of land at her house, which is about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She earns about  US $2.50 a day. She is married and has three children; one is a student, and the others work at a garment factory. Her husband is a building construction foreman. C. H. owns a stand at a local market for selling her products. She would like to have another stand for her daughter to operate a business like hers,  to aid with the household expenses. Hence, she wants a loan of US$ 500 to enable her new business plan. (C. H. is pictured with the cow that she uses to plow her farmland for planting vegetables)

loans.use: buying new stand for selling vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. is from the village of Danao. She is 47 years old, is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a fishing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Grace is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP,  which she will use to expand the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru: Начмудинов Сафарбек проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 58 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Сафарбек более 18 лет работал по специальности, "адвокатом". В данный момент, он более 8 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа крупно рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Safarbek N. lives in the Rumy district. He is 58 years old, married and has 2 children. Safarbek spent over 18 years working in his field, as a lawyer. At the moment, he has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He feeds and sells cattle. Our client is requesting a loan to purchase cattle and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Grenlyn

texts.en:
Grenlyn G. is from the village of So, Poblacion. She is 38 years old. Grenlyn is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Grenlyn owns & operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Grenlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Grenlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Grenlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Grenlyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & for increased working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Grenlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Abdulhair

texts.ru: Саидов Абдулхайр проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Сам Абдулхайр более 8 лет работал на "типографии". В данный момент более 6 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Abdulhair S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 51 years old, married and has 5 children. His oldest son works in Russia. Abdulhair worked in printing for over 8 years. At the moment, he has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock, for over 6 years. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase cattle and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Anes Gull Group

texts.en:
Anes Gull is the group leader of Anes Gull loan group. There are four members in this group and they live in District 4th, Kabul, Afghanistan. The total requested amount is 40000 Afghani and each of them would like to receive the loan for his/her own business.

Anes Gull and Faryda want a loan for their fresh fruit cart businesses. Halema wants a loan for her carpet weaving business. Sema Gull wants a loan for bakery. They admire this process and want to thank Kiva, too.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina M. is from the village of Southern Poblacion. She is 57 years old. Magdalina is widowed. To make a living, Magdalina owns & operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Magdalina is just starting this business.

In 2006, Magdalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Magdalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Magdalina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Magdalina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Musofir

texts.ru: Назиров Мусофир проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 62 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сын находится в России на заработках. Мусофир более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает мелко рогатый скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Musofir N. lives in the Rumy district. He is 62 years old, married and has 4 children. His son is working in Russia. Musofir has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. He feeds and sells small livestock. He is requesting this loan to purchase livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie V. is from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz. She is 27 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elvie is just starting this business.

In 2008, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима Мачитиева проживает в районе Руми. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Возраст 48 лет. Муж занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Рахима более 12 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает национальные материалы. Клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения бизнеса и закупа сезонного товара. На полученный доход, она хочет проибрести магазин.
texts.en:
Rahima M. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is married and has 2 children. She is 48 years old. Her husband offers taxi services. Rahima has been selling at the market for more than 12 years. She mostly sells traditional fabrics. The client is asking for a loan to grow her business and to purchase seasonal products. She would like to use her earnings to acquire a store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Мирзоев Махмадшариф проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Махмадшариф имеет магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahmadsharif M. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Mahmadsharif has a store where he sells food products. He has been in this business for more than 7 years. The client is asking for a loan in order to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Abduraim

texts.ru: Абдураим Джураев проживат в районе Руми. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент вместе семьей занимается сельским хозяйстовом. Он в основном выращивает дыню, арбуз и продает их на рынке. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Клиент просит кредит, для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Abduraim J. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. The client works in agriculture with his family. He mostly grows cantaloupes and watermelons and sells them at the market. He has been in this business for more than 6 years. The client is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Давлатов Анвар проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Анвар более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает мелко рогатый скот на рынке. В этом ему также помогает его семья. Клиент просит кредит, дял закупа мелко рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Anvar D. lives in the Rumy district. He is 31 years old, married and has 4 children. Anvar has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He feeds and sells small livestock at the market. His family helps him with this business. Our client is requesting a loan in order to buy small livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock and feed

loans.name: Roshan Gul Group

texts.en:
Roshan G. is the group leader of the Roshan G. loan group. There are three members in this group. They want to take a loan of 30000 Afghani to expand their businesses.

Roshan G. wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. Ameda wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Anufa wants to take a loan for her son who sells mobile phone cards. So they are very happy that Kiva lenders can support all the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Sosan Group

texts.en: Sosan is the group leader of Sosan group. There are five members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for his or her business. They are requesting a group loan of 50,000 Afghani. Sosan wants to take a loan for the business of carpet making. Omiraw and Aziza and Mena want to take loans for their husbands who have fruit and vegetable shops. Palwasha wants to take a loan for her husband who has trucking business. They are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who can support all poor people.

loans.use: For business progress.

loans.name: Rahmatsho

texts.ru: Бобоев Рахматшо проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, миеет 4 детей. Рахматшо более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает, продает крупно ротагый скот. В этом ему помогает его семья. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа  крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Rahmatsho B. lives in the Rumy district. He is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. Rahmatsho has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. He feeds and sells cattle. His family helps him with this business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy S., 57, is involved in a business selling vegetables at a local market in her village with a typical income of US$2.50 per day. She is married and has six children. Three of her children are students, and the rest are employed at a garment factory. Her husband is unemployed, yet he always assists his wife’s business.

S. now owns a stand at a local market for selling her production; however, she is willing to have one more stand for her daughter to operate a business like hers to financially aid the household expenses. Hence, she really wants to take a loan of US$600 to buy more vegetable and a motorbike to transport the vegetable to the customers for more income and to fulfill her future ambition of having another stand.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and a motorbike to transport them

loans.name: Sied Raem

texts.en: S. Raem is the son of S. Y.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 5 children. He is working on the committee autocratic election and he wants to take a loan of 50000 Afghani. He is very happy for this loan process that can solve all his problems.

loans.use: For needed materials.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch S., 54, is widowed and works as a wedding decorator. One the other hand, she also sells Cambodian noodles in the local market. She has been operating her businesses for eighteen years and earns about $3.00 per day. She has four children, all of whom are teenagers. Two of her children work in Phnom Penh, one is studying at the university and one other is studying to be decorator.

To expand her business, S. is asking a loan of $400 to purchase more decorative materials to upgrade her existing stock.

loans.use: To purchase more decorative materials to upgrade her existing stock

loans.name: Mahmadrasul

texts.ru: Каримов Махмадрасул проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Махмадрасул более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа крупно рогатого скота. На полученную прибыль, хочет достроить дом.
texts.en:
Mahmadrasul K. lives in the Rumy district. He is 30 years old, married and has 1 child. Mahmadrasul has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. He feeds and sells livestock. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy cattle. He wants to use the profit to finish building his house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy T. is a rice farmer who lives in Churomseam Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She also raises pigs to sell, while her husband has a rice mill to provide milling services in the village. The young couple does not yet have any children and works hard to generate revenues for their own family.

Thuy T. planted her rice crop a month ago but her crop is not so good due to the lack of fertilizer. Therefore, she has decided to ask a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield and to use the rest of the loan to purchase a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1014060428) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 14,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is 37 years old and is married with three children. His business is to sell carpets of different sizes. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients, and his business keeps growing.

In order to increase the range of his carpets, he now needs a loan of $1,500 which he will use to purchase more inventory. 

Nidal appreciates your help!

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mahmadkarim

texts.ru: Хайдаров Махмадкарим проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Махмадкарим более 14 лет работает диспетчером на станции. Помимо этого, он более 9 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей скота. Его сыновья тоже работают на станции. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа скота и корма. На полученный доход, хочет сыграть свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Mahmadkarim H. lives in the Rumy district. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Mahmadkarim has been working as a dispatcher at a station for over 14 years. Besides this, he has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock, for over 9 years. His sons also work at the station. Our client is requesting a loan for purchasing livestock and feed. He wants to use resulting profits for his son’s wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (1037061102) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three school-aged children.

T. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2003, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 6th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen M. is 31 years of age and the mother of four children. She is married to Rizalde, a 37-year-old fisherman. Aileen sells her husband’s catch in their neighborhood whenever her husband catches a plenty of fish from the ocean. However, most of the time, she sells nothing because her husband's small paddled boat cannot go further towards the deeper part of the ocean where he could have greater chance of catching more fish. Aileen has no way to sell fish in this situation nor to buy from other fisher folk in the village because she has no capital to begin with. The income she and her husband can generate through their small fishing business is just enough to spend on the needs of their children in school where two of them are in high school, one in elementary grade, and the youngest is a preschool.

Aileen has no any other aspirations in life but to give her children a good quality education which she and her husband did not have in their younger years. She realizes that achieving this could be very hard, even if she is now stronger and more courageous to face life's challenges. Having surmounted a lot of those way back for many many years of her life she knows that she needs something for a weapon. In other words she needs capital to start growing their business so as to generate a bigger income and have more options in running their business.

Just recently, Aileen and her husband embraced the opportunity, brought to them by ASHI, of obtaining a loan for income generating activities. Aileen became a member of the institution. She loaned in order to improve her husband's way of fishing. She proposed that her loan will be used in buying the materials her husband needs to make fishing gear such as a fish trap. This trap will be placed under the water and will be taken out after a day. This way, Aileen' husband has two options to catch fish in case he has less catch in his first way of catching.

Aileen is confident that, someday, through the opportunity given to her by ASHI, the business in which she chose to venture together with her husband will grow since this has been the kind of business she and her husband did since they got married in 1994. However, the business has not grown much because of insufficient business capital. Nevertheless, now that Aileen is a member of ASHI, and knowing that her business endeavor will be supported by a lot of people around the world through Kiva, she is optimistic that she will succeed and that she will be able to achieve her dream for her children.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making a fish trap

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a young mother at 23. She is married to Reyson, who works as an electrician. They live in Barangay Palao Solana, Cagayan, with their two children, Jomaica, who is 2 years old, and Jessica, who is 1 year old. Daisy is very thankful that she is blessed with a happy family and a business that is continuously growing to help her husband earn a living.

Daisy is now asking for a loan of PHP17,000 that she can use to further develop her general store business. Aside from selling different merchandise, she also sells fruits and vegetables in front of her store. She is also hoping that through the financial support of Kiva and her hard work and perseverance, her business will continue to grow. She believes that her business will last long with the support of her family and also the lenders.

loans.use: To expand her general store

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem R., 28, is a married woman and the mother of one lovely young child who is of school age. She currently works sewing clothes in the garment industry and gets a specific salary of $90 a month to support her own family’s food needs. 

Khem R. is married to Mr. Soeung Neang, 31 years old, who works driving a motorbike taxi. He has been using an existing motor for a long time to provide taxi service. Lately, he can’t attract client because their motor is too old and breaks down frequently. Therefore, Khem R. would like a loan to replace it. Note: Khem R.'s husband is picture, because she was not available at that time.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
“The great business of life is to be, to do without, and to depart,” shares Edna E.. She strongly believes in that quotation, which she believes is simply related to doing the right and great things for her family, friends, acquaintances, and other people around her.

Edna is engaged in a general store business. She hopes to purchase more stock in order to meet the demands of her customers and increase her income. To achieve this, she would like a loan of PHP15,000 for the expansion of her general store business.

Edna is 35 years old and lives in the rural barangay of Palao, Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Orlando Jr., who works as a farmer. They are blessed with two children: Gramsel, who is 14 years old and a high school student, and Gerald, who is 9 years old and an elementary student. Both children are studying in a public school in their village.

loans.use: To expand her general store

loans.name: Seho

texts.fr: Seho S. est un jeune homme de 39 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est menuisier à Lomé depuis 4 ans et a de la passion pour son travail. Il est un redoutable artisan et ses œuvres sont très résistantes. Seho désire avec ce crédit acheter des outils de travail pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.
texts.en:
Seho S. is a 39-year-old young man, married, and the father of two. He has been a furniture maker for four years and has a passion for his work. He is a formidable artisan, and his products are really durable. He would like to use this loan to buy work tools to carry out his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools for his projects

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a native of Cagayan. She lives in Barangay Palao Solana, Cagayan, with her family. She is now 53 years old and has six children; only the youngest is still studying in high school. She hopes to give her daughter a better education so she can someday become successful to her chosen career.

Evelyn manages a general store business. She is glad that her business helps her provide the immediate needs of her family. At present she would like to borrow PHP5,000 from Kiva. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise, especially products that are in demand in her village.

Aside from managing her business, Evelyn is also very responsible in keeping their house clean and providing the needs of her family. She hopes that through the continuous support of the lenders to her business, her store will continue to be profitable and that she will be able to save enough money to develop her house and make it concrete.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
“Life without hope is a life without meaning.” This is the passage that Marivic loves to share with her neighbors and friends. She is 42 years old, married, and blessed with five children: Mark Jason, who is 22 years old and a high school graduate; Mario, who is 20 years old and a fourth-year college student; Marlon James, who is 17 years old and a college freshmen; and Maryjones, who is 12 years old and a high school student.

Marivic's husband is working as a farmer while she operates a sari-sari store (community-based store) for additional income. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00. She plans to use the loan to expand her business and sell more commodities. According to Marivic, her income from her business will be invested for the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand her general store

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Issa C. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il détient une boutique d’alimentation générale à Lomé. Issa exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans.  Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son entreprise en approvisionnant son magasin de nouveaux produits.
texts.en:
Issa C. is a young man, 35 years old, married, and the father of two. He has a general store in Lomé. He has been in this business for seven years. He wishes to use this loan to increase the capacity of his enterprise by stocking his store with new products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his store with new goods

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
The photo shows Mrs. Ruos C. selling various items from her own store in her home. She is 28 and married, and has been blessed with three children: two are single and one is married and lives separately. Her husband is a truck driver for a small company.

Ruos C. is a busy woman who works hard every day at her business operations in order earn the money to help support her family. She will use part of this Kiva loan as capital to purchase a market store where she will sell vegetables, and the rest of the loan to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a market store where she will sell vegetables

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 50 years old and married. She lives in Barangay Palao Solana, Cagayan. She and her husband were blessed with four children: Marlon, who is 26 years old and a high school graduate; Marvin, who is 24 years old and a high school undergraduate; Jhona, who is 20 years old and a high school graduate; and Jhon, who is 15 years old and in her third year of high school.

Matilde has operated a village store for nine years. She and her husband are working hard in order to provide the needs of their family. She is now asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP20,000.00 as additional capital for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
“Do not do unto others, what you do not want others to do unto you.” This is the guiding principle in the life of Milagros B.. She is 46 years old and already a widow. She has four children: Jennifer, who is 26 years old and married; Rowena, who is 24 years old and also married; Hazel, who is 22 years and in the third year of college; and Mark Glenn, who is 13 years old and a high school student. Milagros intends to send her youngest child to college; however, lack of financial resources brings her worries. Her family lives in Barangay Palao, Solana, Cagayan.

Milagros is requesting a loan of PHP20,000 from Kiva to use as additional capital for her general store business. She hopes that through the loan, she can further develop her business and make it profitable. She is thankful that two of her children are extending some financial support even though they have their own families. According to Milagros, she will do her best to make her business grow and be productive.

loans.use: To develop her general store

loans.name: Daniela

texts.fr: Daniela O. est une jeune femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de chaussures au grand marché de Lomé. Daniela détient ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise en achetant de nouveaux produits pour la revente. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Daniela O. is a 39-year-old married mother of three. She works as a shoe retailer at the main market in Lomé. Daniela has been in this business for 5 years. She hopes to expand the size of her business with this loan by purchasing new products for resale. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Ka R. is an older woman of fifty-two years and the mother of three children; all of her children are married and have already started new homes. Ka R. sells dried fish that she buys in bulk on credit, which she also repays out of her income after she finishes selling the dried fish. Her husband always assists her in selling the fishes. Ka R. is running her investment well. She has a lot of regular customers who come to buy her fish for their daily cooking, so she has gained much income. To make her business more successful, Ka R. would like a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL as capital in order to increase the quantity of dried fish she has to better meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bilquisan Ashiq Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Bilquisan baji is the group leader of four other women who all live in Vehari, Pakistan. They all are very hard-working ladies. They handle their own businesses of embroidering clothes to share the financial burden of their husbands. Bilquisan baji is married to A. M., who is a carpenter who makes furniture on order to earn income. He has 10 years of experience in this business. Bilquisan baji is applying for a loan to buy wood and nails for her husband’s furniture-making business.

This group loan consists of four additional people:

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Bashiran baji and Shazia baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: In this picture, Bilquisan baji is seated second from the left side.

loans.use: To buy material for a furniture-making business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad and her family have lived in the village of Palao Solana, Cagayan, for already ten years. She is married to Enrique and gifted with four children. Her four children are all now in their 20’s but they were not able to reach college due to financial problems. 

Natividad earns a living by maintaining her clothes repairing and sewing business. Some of the things she makes are uniforms for students and teachers, shorts, pants, bed sheets, and curtains. Aside from that, she is also engaged in selling different vegetables and salted eggs.

Natividad wants her businesses to become progressive and that is why she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 15,000.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
SrE. S. E., 56, has been involved in growing vegetables at her plot of farmland since 1995, with a typical income of US$5 per day. She is married and has two children. All of her children dropped out of school, yet they are employed as garment factory workers with a reasonable income. Her husband works on his own plot of land as well, with his skill of growing vegetables.
