Because S.’s fertile soil on her plot of land is favorable for growing crops and vegetables, she has made cultivation a primary business to generate income for the household expenses. Therefore, she has requested a loan of US$1,000 to buy vegetable seeds to expand her output.

S. E.’s husband is shown in the photo because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Starting a business was fun for Mrs. Leah A. who, at the age of 30 in 1997, took the risk of starting a variety store. Due to limited start-up funds, Leah had only a few items available for sale in her store, items she chose based on her own judgment. Later on, as she gained experience, she realized that the most in-demand commodities in her community were rice and charcoal. Filipino people tend to make rice the main food in every meal, and dried fish for their viand as an alternative to fresh fish when it’s too expensive. Also, most of people in the village cannot afford gas stoves and gas to cook with, instead using charcoal or firewood. Therefore, Leah decided to focus on buying and selling rice, charcoal, and dried fish. This way, her store could deliver relevant service to the villagers.

Leah believes that her loan request from ASHI to buy rice will allow her to achieve larger profits more quickly, thereby enabling her to achieve her goal of building a more secure shelter for her family while her children are still young (elementary grades and preschooler) and before they need more finances for their education when they attend high school and college. She would also love her children to experience the feeling of living in a stable house with appliances.

Even after Leah has stabilized their living conditions with the support of her husband who is a driver, she will continue to work hard and think of more ways to grow her business for the education of her children in order to prepare them for the future.

Leah is very glad to have ASHI and KIVA because they provide the opportunity of having people around the world support her vision for herself, her family, and most of all, for her business.

loans.use: Buying rice to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla has managed a general store for three years and she works hard for the progress of her business. Every day she wakes up early to prepare her store and check her merchandise. She has gained a lot of customers for her store to make it grow.

Perla is now seeking the assistance of Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as business capital that she can use for her store. Some of the things that she plans to buy are soft drinks, sack of rice, sugar, salt, and other commodities that are in demand by her customers. She believes that the amount will contribute a lot in making her business become more productive.

Perla is 42 years old and she is already a widow. She was left with her children and they are: Madelyn, 19 years old; Majelly, 16 years old; Eddie, 15 years old and Ken Jerico, 9 years old. Her eldest stopped her college studies but three of them are still studying. Perla is hoping that her children will someday finish their studies.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Faizan Zahoor Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khalida bjai wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Kaniz begum baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruit for their fruit-selling businesses.

Faizan baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. She has belonged to a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past twelve years and operates a clothes-sewing business. Her husband’s name is Z. A. and he is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor-vehicle) driver. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw because he has no other skill to serve his family. Faizan baji wants to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he enjoys his work and pays more attention to it.

Faizan baji is the one sewing clothes in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Sat S. is 51 years old and is a handicraft maker who makes cradles for sale. She can generate a daily profit of $3 in order to make her family’s living conditions more stable. Her husband is a local trader who orders various produce and sells it in mobile retail around the country. This couple now has five children; one of whom is married and lives independently and the others are still single and studying. Sat S. is looking for a loan for her husband to use as capital to invest in his business activities.

loans.use: To use as capital to invest in his business activities.

loans.name: Phol

texts.en: Phol O., 38, is involved in the agriculture sector, growing garlic plants and beans at her plot of farmland since 2000 with a typical income of US$2 per day. She is married and has five children. Three of her children are students and the rest are employed as garment factory workers with a reasonable income to make a living. Her husband typically makes a living with his skill of fishing and helps his wife with her business. Currently, cultivation is a main source of generating income; however, O. recognizes that her husband’s skill is also important to make improvements to better her family's standard of living. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a fishing boat and fishing tools for her husband. (O.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: Buying a boat and fishing tools

loans.name: Maqsoodan Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
Sarwari baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for preparing embroidered dresses.
Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy food items (biscuits & chips) for her canteen.  
Nafeesa baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. 

Maqsoodan baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. Her members selected her as group leader because of her good behavior. She has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband’s name is A. G.. He is a farmer and grows vegetables. He is very active at growing potatoes and carrots. This very lucrative agriculture activity brings in the money he needs to support his family. Maqsoodan baji’s present goal is to double her production and, thus, her income. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her husband’s vegetable growing business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed amongst the group members; each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Maqsoodan baji is standing at the center of the group.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta manages a typical village store in Palao Solana, Cagayan. She is 46 years old and married to Vicente, a farmer. Vicente also works as a carpenter in their community. They are blessed with three children who are all studying in high school and elementary. 

Violeta needs to expand her small business to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their family. They are helping one another and striving to have a better future for their children. Violeta is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 20,000. She will purchase additional items for her store, such as sacks of rice, soft drinks and other basic commodities. She earns an average daily income of PHP 500. She hopes to maintain the business and someday be able to develop it into a larger selling enterprise.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
R. Mahbuba was born in 1952 in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. She is a happy mother and grandmother who has, during her whole life, worked hard to ensure a good future for her children. She works in the local structure on gas delivery. Her husband works in the local hospital. Mahbuba’s eldest son intends to get married this summer. She made capital repairs to her house and now she wants to build a small summer terrace so that the whole family can sit around the big table. She is applying to KIVA with the request of a loan of 1400 TJS for building this terrace. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following steps of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” seeks a transformation into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore, in October of 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization, known as “Arvand”.
“Arvand”, being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To build the small summer terrace, home improvement.

loans.name: Perm

texts.en:
Perm N., 46, is married and has four children. Three of her children are students while the oldest one is employed as a garment factory worker with a fair income.

N. is engaged in pig raising which is the primary income of the family. She and her husband have been involved in the same business at their house and, together, they can make a typical income of US$4 per day. However, her husband is also a motorbike repairman in addition to his current business to earn more income for his family.

N. has requested a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more pigs and, with the amount leftover, she wants to purchase a small phone shop for her son to sell mobile phones in a local market. She hopes that with the several businesses she and her family members operate, she will be able to better her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and to start a shop for her son to sell mobile phones

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 38 years old and she is married with five children. She sells clothes. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар Намозов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Сафар более 6 лет занимавется животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Safar N. lives in the Rumy district. He is 28 years old, married and has no children. Safar has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. He feeds and sells cattle at a market. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem M., 44, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives in a village approximately thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

M. has ben involved in the agriculture sector as a rice-field farmer and pig-raiser since she was rescued from the genocide regime in 1979. Her husband is a farmer as well, and they both typically make an income of US$4 per day.

Because her primary income is generated from agriculture, she has requested a loan of US$1,000 to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to enable her farmland to achieve its maximum output. By doing this, she hopes that her family’s standard of living will be gradually changed and improved.

M.'s husband is shown in the photo with pigs they have raised.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farming business

loans.name: Mazbudjon

texts.en:
O. Mazbudjon is 34 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Istaravshan and has been engaged for twelve years in selling video cassettes. He started the business practically from scratch but, thanks to his previous loans from MLF MicroInvest, he was able to organize and stabilize the business. He opened his specialized trade outlet in the local crowded bazaar and he has many repeat customers so he trades by licensed production.

Mazbudjon is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of 4,100 STJ for 12 months to enlarge his trade outlet and to import a new assortment that permits him to increase his business turnover. He thanks Kiva for its support.  


About MLF MicroInvest
MLF MicroInvest is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. A following step of its development sees MLF MicroInvest’s transformation into a micro-loan deposit-taking organization. Therefore, in October 2008, MLF MicroInvest together with LLC Frontiers have founded the limited liability company micro-loan deposit-taking organization “Arvand”.

Arvand, being an assignee of MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his trade outlet and to import a new assortment

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Сохибназаров Ахмад проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Ахмад более 10 лет работает преподавателям. В данный момент он занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей скота. Клиент просит кредит для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Ahmad S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. His sons work in Russia. Ahmad has been working as a teacher for over 10 years. Currently, he is involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Nwanneka

texts.en: B. is 32 years old. She sells clothes and drinks and she is also a fashion designer with two apprentices. B. learned her business in two years and she has been in the business for the past fifteen years. She hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more clothes and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and drinks to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San N., age 60, is a widow. She lives with her daughter and her four school-aged grandchildren. Her daughter is employed in a factory as a garment worker with a typical income of US$2 per day.

N. has been involved in raising pigs and selling groceries at her house since 2005 with an income of US$2 per day. She has requested a loan of US$250 to purchase more pigs to raise for their offspring, which can then be sold in the markets. N. hopes that her family's standard of living will be better with the business she is evolving.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Oen's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of two people. Its leader, Mr. Oen B., is age 32, and earns a living as a local carpenter. He is married to Srey Na, 23, who is a homemaker and stays at home to cook delicious meals and care for the kids. The family has only one young child who is enrolled in the local primary school.

Oen B. usually carves wood to make a variety of statues to sell. He will be using his loan to buy more wood and some carving equipment for his business.

The other borrower is Mrs. Chen M., 38, who is a widowed woman that raises pigs. She is asking for a loan to buy extra piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy wood and some carving equipment

loans.name: Ubani Adaku

texts.en:
Ubani sells provisions and she is also a fashion designer. She is 32 years old and married with four children.

Ubani has been in her business for the past eight years. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and tailoring materials to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and tailoring materials

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora G. is a 45-year-old woman, happily married to Waren, and they are blessed with four children. Three among the four are still studying. One is in fourth year college taking a Bachelor of Arts degree in Political Science in the University of the Philippines; another is in her first year of college; and the youngest is in his second year of high school. 

It was never easy for Teodora and her husband to sustain the education of their children. They have been through a lot of struggles in life but they did not give up because they have each other to hold on to. Waren is a municipal ambulance driver and Teodora was a plain housewife before she joined ASHI. Coping with financial struggles at that time was so hard for the couple since Teodora's husband was the only one earning. 

Five years ago, Teodora took the opportunity of loaning when ASHI came into her life. She believed that she had the skill to raise pigs and sell them after four months. She knew that she would be successful and that, in this kind of business, she could help her husband earn because this was what most of her family members do as their way of living.

Through loaning business capital which she can obtain from ASHI, Teodora will be able to make her dreamed business happen and she will be able to support the needs of her children in school. She is confident to venture in the business pursuit she chose knowing that her husband's support will always be there as well as people around the world through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy five piglets, feed, and also rice to retail

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en: Cheab P., 35, is married. She lives with her husband and her ten-year-old, only child who studies at a local primary school. She has been involved in a business of selling rice and corn. She usually goes directly to her customers’ places of business to deliver her products. She has requested a loan of US $900 to purchase more corn and rice to expand her inventory. She is very optimistic that she will succeed with this business plan and investment if she is able to receive this loan.

loans.use: buying corn and rice to sell.

loans.name: Tursunboi

texts.ru: Гиесов Турсунбой проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 27 лет. Женат, детей не имеет.  Турсунбой более 2 лет работает учителем, помимо этого  занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Tursunboi G. lives in the Rumy district. He is 27 years old, married and has no children. Tursunboi has been working as a teacher for over 2 years; besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry. He feeds and sells livestock. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
B. Mavluda was born in 1970 in Istaravshan. She is married and has 4 children. Mavluda has to earn money for her family as her husband went to the Russian Federation and could not find good work. He is not able to help her. Mavluda is engaged in Circassian walnut processing. She also sells this product in the local bazaar. She has been engaged in selling walnut for 9 years. She also has 1 hectare of land where she grows the walnut. Her children help her in this business. Mavluda applied for the KIVA business development loan of 1200 STJ to be used towards the seasonal works implementation that permits her to increase the business turnover. She will then take the next step in the MicroInvest loan program. Mavluda thanks KIVA for helping small entrepreneurs and small business development all over the world. 

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following the steps of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” seeks a transformation into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore, in October of 2008, MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.
“Arvand”, being assignee to “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and to create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: Seasonal works implementation--walnut processing.

loans.name: Ogunlade

texts.en: Ogunlade is in the business of renting chairs, tables and canopies. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. She has been a LAPO client for the past 3 years and she hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more canopies, chairs and tables in her shop to rent. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, canopies and tables to rent.

loans.name: Ogechi

texts.en: Ogechi O. is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells clothes. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to  sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells medicine in retail. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Махбуба несколько лет кредитуется для расширения своего бизнеса продажи хозяйственных принадлежностей для дома.Она вначеле своей кредитной истории имела маленький ларёк и оборотный капитал её составлял всего на 100 долларов.А сегодня она смогла расширить ларёк и увеличить товарооборот.На следующий кредит она хочет привести из Истаравшана партию порошка для стирки , мыла и ещё некоторые виды чистящих средств.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mahbuha has been taking out loans for several years to expand her business of selling household products. At the beginning of her credit history she had a small kiosk and her working capital was only 100 dollars. Today she can expand her kiosk and increase her inventory. Her next loan she wants to use to bring a stock of washing detergent from Istaravshan, and also soap and other kinds of washing products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling of household products

loans.name: Okuezuru

texts.en: N. bakes chin chin (cookies), meat pies, fish rolls, and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. N. is 35 years old and married to Mr. Okuezuru. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell and ingredients such as flour to use in preparing her baked goods. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell and ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina L. is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells plastic in a retail shop. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more plastic to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell.

loans.name: Mohi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мусоева Мохи кредитор в организации с 2003 года. Она занимается шитьём матрасов для диванов и кроватей. А мастерит кровати и диваны её муж.На следующий кредит она с мужем хочет закупить деревянные доски и паралона  несколько рулонов. На снимке она вовремя работы шьёт облицовку матраса на заказ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mohi M. is a client of our organization since 2003. She makes mattresses for sofas and beds. And her husband makes the beds and sofas. She and her husband want to use the next loan to buy wooden slates and several rolls of cushioning foam. On the photo she is during work making a custom cover for a mattress.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for making of mattresses

loans.name: Salohat

texts.en:
K. Salohad lives in Istaravshan. She is married and has 4 children. She is a happy mother of 3 pretty children and one  daughter. Istaravshan is famous for its apricots and walnuts. Salohad has been engaged for 10 years in a home-based business of walnut processing and selling. It is the family business. Salohat applies to KIVA with the request of a business development loan of 1200 STJ to be used towards seasonal works implementation and business turnover increase. She thanks KIVA for the small business support.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following each step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.
“Arvand”, being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a poultry business where she sells birds. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more poultry birds to sell. She says thanks you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds.

loans.name: Leoum

texts.en: Leoum P. is 47-years-old and resides in the Province of Siem Reap. He is a staff member for a mobile phone company. Beside his current work, he has always cultivated a rice crop. He is married with three teenage children who are students and under his care. His wife works planting vegetables in the farm field. Leoum P. and his family always need to pay for a taxi when they want to go anywhere. He hopes to reduce the cost of transportation by using the Kiva loan to buy a motorbike for his family transportation needs. He will use the remainder of the loan to buy fertilizer for growing crops.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his family's transportation.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en: B. Malohat lives in Istaravshan and she is married with five children. She has been engaged for three years in a home business making velvety pillows (pads) and selling them in the local bazaar. Her daughters help her in the business, too. She makes about twenty pillows per week. Malohat has repeat customers and she is applying to Kiva for the business development loan of 600 STJ for 5 months. With the loan she will import the velvety material and increase her business turnover. She thanks Kiva for its support. About MLF MicroInvest MLF MicroInvest is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. A following step of its development sees MLF MicroInvest’s transformation into a micro-loan deposit-taking organization. Therefore, in October 2008, MLF MicroInvest together with LLC Frontiers have founded the limited liability company micro-loan deposit-taking organization “Arvand”. Arvand, being an assignee of MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import more velvety material

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi N. is 42 years old and she is married with 6 children. She sells provisions at retail. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions for resale

loans.name: Ngideka

texts.en:
C. is 32 years old and married with a child. She sells wine, canned drinks and she rents DVDs and VCDs in her shop. She acquired the skill from her mother and she has been in the business for the past seven years.

C. hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more wine, canned drinks and DVDs to sell and rent. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more wine, canned drinks and DVDs to sell and rent

loans.name: Okpara

texts.en: F. sells foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past 7 years. F. is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 3 years and she is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Haleema Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Samina baji and Akbari baji and Hanifan baji each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (the local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Ghulam Ayesha baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

Haleema baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. They all belong to a mid-size city name Vehari, Pakistan. She married to a man whose name is M. R. and he has a school-bag-making business. He can make cloth bags and leather bags. She is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth, leather, and zippers) for her husband’s bag-making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Haleema baji is seated in the center of the baji’s in white dress.

loans.use: To buy material for a bag-making business

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en:
The photo shows Mrs. Chhea S. standing on her farm field. She is a local farmer who grows different kinds of crops. She also buys vegetables from other farmers in bulk and sells them in the retail market.  Chhea S. also raises a few pigs from home.

She is married to Mr. Hum Kimrann, 30, a fisherman who also works in the farming business. They have two children who attend school. 

Chhea S. requested a loan of $1000 for the purchase of fertilizers and seeds to grow a morning glory crop and to buy additional tools for her husband's fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for her morning glory crop.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza S. is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children. Dilfuza lives in Istaravshan where she makes and sells special Korean salads. She makes by herself the salted tomatoes and cucumbers and special Korean salads with carrot and cabbage. Also she trades by fresh vegetables. She has repeat customers who come just to buy her food. 

Dilfuza applies to KIVA for a loan of 600TJS for 5 months. She will buy more vegetables and widen her assortment of foods to sell, to improve her business. Dilfuza thanks KIVA for its support.

MLF MicroInvest is one of the leading microfinance organizations rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. After its inception, MLF MicroInvest became a microloan deposit-taking organization. In October, 2008 MLF MicroInvest and LLC Frontiers founded the limited liability company microloan deposit-taking organization with the name Arvand.

As an assignee of  MLF MicroInvest, Arvand continues the mission of MLF MicroInvest which is to improve the standard of living of Takjikistan's population and to create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and widen her food assortment.

loans.name: Obodo

texts.en:
S. is a single woman who is 27 years old. She sells hair extensions and second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the past two years. S. hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more hair extensions and second-hand clothes to sell. 

She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong R. (pictured with his wife) is 26 years old and owns a trailer-motorbike. He uses it to run a taxi. He normally picks up passers-by, tourists, and merchandise for a profit. 

His wife has had a job as a poultry seller. They have been married for years but have no children. 

Kong R.'s existing taxi is a small width so he can transport a few people only. He hopes to replace this taxi by using a Kiva loan to purchase a new one. This will help him to increase his income and better meet his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To replace his existing taxi.

loans.name: Ojubanire

texts.en:
R. Ojubanire is 43 years old and married with four children. She sells frozen food and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 7 years. 

R. is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks, chicken and turkey to sell. 

She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en:
K. Mahina was born in 1987 in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. She is married. Mahina is engaged in commercial service and trade. Mahina has been selling women’s shoes in the local bazaar for 3 years. She works straight with suppliers and trades in lower prices than the regular bazaar prices. Her husband works in the Russian Federation and he sends money for her every month. Mahina also goes to Kukanda herself to purchase goods for her business. Mahina could improve her business significantly. Thanks to the previous loans from MicroInvest, today she has a good trade outlet that brings a good business turnover. Mahina thanks KIVA for its support.  She applies to KIVA for the business development loan of 3000 TJS (Tajikistan Sonomi) to use for the importing seasonal goods.   
   
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following steps of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees a transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore, in October of 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization known as “Arvand”.
“Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and to create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import seasonal goods.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mr. Chann K., 25 years old, is a local taxi driver who picks up tourists who need to visit Angkor Wat Temple. He is married with one teenage, school-aged child. His wife works as a fruit vendor. Chann K. is applying for a loan for his wife to use as capital in ordering various fruits, at bulk pricing, from farmers. They will purchase the fruit this approaching mature-fruit season and then resell them at retail prices at the market to gain income. Note: Mr. Chann K. was not available for photograph, so his wife is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To order various fruits in bulk from farmers during this approaching mature-fruit season.

loans.name: Pearse

texts.en: J. sells food and provisions. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. J. is happily married with 3 children and she is 47 years old. J. lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more food items and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Bassirou O. G. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, mariée et père de 2 enfants. il est revendeur de cassettes à Lomé. Bassirou exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Il désire avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant de nouveaux produits et aussi assimiler le commerce des appareils électroniques.
texts.en:
Bassirou O. G. is a 35-year-old married father of two. He works as a cassette retailer in Lomé. Bassirou has been in this business for 3 years. With this loan, he wishes to expand his business by purchasing new products and also incorporating the sale of electronics.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase CDs, DVDs and electronics for resale

loans.name: Bisanje 1 Namukisa Yudaya Group

texts.en: N. Yudaya is thirty years old married with five children, all in schooling. She is also looking after two dependents who go to school. She deals with livestock and poultry, so far five years in the business. She is using the loan to purchase cows and chickens for livestock and poultry to sell. She is a hardworking business lady who is encouraging fellow women mostly not to sit down and wait upon their husbands to provide unto them with everything but to wake up and work or be creative. N. Yudaya’s future hope is to purchase a car to use as a taxi to generate a daily income.

loans.use: To purchase cows and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Berdikul

texts.en:
H. Berdikul is a small agricultural producer devoted to the cultivation of onions and wheat. He carries out this work along with his wife and sons. Everyday, very early, Berdikul goes to his planting area. When he started out, he worked very hard so he could provide his children with food and shelter. His plan for the future consists of buying more land so that he can leave equal parts to his children. Berdikul is now asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and other needed items to help increase production and to sell his crops for a good price in the market. This is his tenth loan with Kiva partner IMON International, and he wishes to express his gratitude for this opportunity and help for his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Thanks to lots of hard work, Khosiyat can offer her family enough to eat and help her husband. She dedicates herself to growing potatoes, onions, wheat and other crops. Although she has to work every day, she approaches her job with a sense of care and optimism, knowing that thanks to her work she can continue growing, not only economically, but also as a person. Khosiyat wants very much to increase the size of her farm and grow a more diverse base of delicious products, and thereby increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Andokul

texts.en:
S. Andokul owns a small parcel of land. He is 51 years old and has three  loving children. Andokul dreams of building a good life for his family. He wants his children to graduate college because this will allow them to find better jobs in the future. His wife is a teacher. Together, they work very hard to sustain their family. Andokul is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides because this will definitely help him improve his yield.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Owolo

texts.en: K. makes a living selling various types of foodstuffs. She is 41 years old, married, has four children and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. K. is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and wishes to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Abdurafi

texts.en:
K. Abdurafi is 42-years old and lives with his wife (pictured here) who works with him on the family farm. They are raising three children. His goal is to improve his family's living conditions to provide a better life for everyone. Abdurafi has worked in agriculture for two years, and his main difficulty has been lack of financing, which limits him severely. His farm lacks fertilizer and other supplies, which leads to weak yields. With this loan, Abdurafi will buy seeds and fertilizer so that he can grow crops that will fetch a better price in the market. He and his family are very thankful for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Agbenike

texts.en: Agbenike makes a living selling drinks and providing office services. She is 55 years old, married and has nine children.  Agbenike has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell, and wishes to thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bisanje 1 Nanyonyi Makilina Group

texts.en: N. Makilina is forty-five years old, married and has four children. She also looks after two additional dependents. These two and her own four children are all going to school. She is a tailor and she has been in her business for 15 years. She is using the loan to purchase material to make dresses, trousers, uniforms, etc. that she then sells. She is a hardworking businesswoman and her hope for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase material for making dresses, trousers, uniforms, etc to sell.

loans.name: Benkoro Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkoro sont mariés majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 41 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle. 
Ce groupe fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habits, le charbon de bois, le bois de chauffe, les céréales etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre premiers prêts, elles sont à leur  5ème prêt solidaire.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 9 sacs de riz, 18 sacs de mil, 4 chargements de  camions remorques en bois  de chauffe et son transport.
 Elles se ravitaillent en mil au grand marché de Ségou, à la foire hebdomadaire, en riz à Dougabougou et parfois au grand marché de Ségou avec les forains, en bois de chauffe à Djonforoko, Tinkoni et Binguébougou. Les produits sont revendus au marché de Ségou Coura et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et faire face aux évènements sociaux (mariage baptême et décès).
Elles ont pour objectif d’avoir un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkoro group are married and mostly live in monogamous families; they are on average 41 years old and have 6 children. They all live in the Bagadadji neighborhood of the town of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and met due to living in the same neighborhood and belonging to the same traditional association. This group sells various articles such as clothing, charcoal, firewood, cereals, etc.

Wishing to increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having reimbursed correctly their first four loans, they are on their 5th solidarity loan.

This new loan will be used to buy 9 sacks of rice, 18 sacks of millet, 4 big truckloads of firewood and to pay the cost of transporting it. They buy their millet in the big open-air market of Ségou, in the weekly market, their rice in Dougabougou and sometimes in the big market of Ségou from the itinerant merchants; their firewood comes from Djonforoko, Tinkoni and Binguébougou. The products are sold at the market of Ségou Coura and out of their homes, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 51,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and cover societal expenses (marriages, baptisms, and funerals).

Their ambition is to have a piece of land to build a house on.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood and cereals (millet and rice)

loans.name: Sinsin Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinsin est constitué de huit  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Sebougou de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Les membres du groupe Sinsin font le commerce d’articles divers tels, les pagnes, les condiments alimentaires (tomates et oignons), les fruits exotiques, la pâte d’arachide, du savon, les activités de tricotages etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elles ont décidé de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur 2ème  deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  15 pièces de tissus légers, 20 rouleaux de laine et 2 sacs de graines d’arachide.
La laine est transformée en napperons et les grains d’arachide en pâte d’arachide après être triés, grillés, décortiqués et broyés. Elles se ravitaillent en matières premières au grand marché et au marché château de Ségou chaque semaine. Les produits sont revendus à domicile et au marché de Sebougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et faire face aux évènements sociaux (baptême, mariage et décès) sans l’apport d’autrui.
Elles ont pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités dans la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso
NB : Mariam S. est absente de la photo pour raison de décès de son père.
texts.en:
The Sinsin group is made up of 8 women, married and mostly from monogamous families, with an average age of 38 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the Sebougou neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).

The members of the Sinsin group sell various articles, such as “pagnes” (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), condiments (tomatoes and onions), exotic fruit, peanut butter, soap, knitted goods, etc. So as to satisfy the needs of their ever growing clientele, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly reimbursed their first loan, they are on their second solidarity loan that will be used to buy 15 lengths of light-weight cloth, 20 skeins of wool, and two sacks of shelled peanuts.

The wool is made into place mats, and the peanuts are made into peanut butter after being cleaned, grilled, shelled, and crushed. They get their raw materials in the big market and the “château” market in Ségou every week. The products are sold out of their homes and at the Sebougou market to a clientele composed mainly of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and to cover societal expenses (baptisms, marriages, funerals) without having to rely on anyone else.

Their ambition is to increase their business collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

NB: Mariam S. is absent from the photo because of the death of her father.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various raw materials to process

loans.name: Holmahmad

texts.ru: Холмахмад Шерматов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Холмахмад вместе семьей занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа крупно рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Holmahmad S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. Holmahmad and his family are involved in animal husbandry. He feeds and sells livestock. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa S. lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is a student in a local university. Tsetsegmaa has a small food retail business in the town. She has a small convenience store located close to the local secondary school. She mostly sells convenient food products, including softdrinks, biscuits, candies, etc. Since the start in 2003, she has been doing well; her business capital has increased from 150,000 MNT to 2,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). As her store is located in the busy area of the town, product turnover is quite good. She usually purchases her products from the local wholesale market. With the profit, she was able to expand the building of the store. In the future, she would like to expand her business by offering more variety of food products that meet local demands.  
She requests a loan to purchase more food products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase food products.

loans.name: Kalu

texts.en: For the past 15 years, Kalu M. has sold foodstuffs.  Forty-seven years old and married with four children, she hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
Y. Phạm THị (1047061258) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. Married with two school-aged children, Y. raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale. Y. has been engaged in this business for over six years, earning approximately 2500000 VND a month.

In 2003, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be her sixth from TYM Fund, and Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Peniel Grupo 4 Group

texts.en:
Zoraida N. is the coordinator of a group of five entrepreneurs. They are looking for their first loan to invest in their respective businesses. Zoraida owns a small salon and is looking to invest in her business by purchasing more hair products and making small improvements to her store. She decided to approach Kiva partner, Esperanza, because she has been working in the salon business for several years, but has never been able to grow her salon substantially. A loan from Esperanza will allow her to make capital improvements necessary for substantial growth.

Some of the improvements Zoraida needs for her salon include installing a fan and a door. A door and a fan seem very minor, but they represent major improvements for Zoraida’s salon. In the future, Zoraida would like to be able to hire several employees and have a large, modern salon.

Zoraida is happily married with two daughters and one son. Her daughters are aged 19 and 6, and her son is 22. Her son works at a water factory, while her eldest daughter is in college studying administration. Her youngest daughter just finished her first year of elementary school. Zoraida's family is very important to her, and she is taking a loan from Esperanza in the hope that her business investment will make her family’s life better.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and to make improvements to the salon

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:

To make a living, B. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling aluminum products to local businesses and community members. B. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, B. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. B. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her eighth from TYM Fund. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Altangarid

texts.en:
Altangarid B. lives with his wife and four teenage children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His four children are all high school students. Altangarid owns a small truck that he uses to transport freight between nearby towns. When he travels to outer towns, he mostly transports cut wood. Once he drops the wood at a client's site, he carries back various products in return for a fee.

Altangarid has been in the transport business since 1999. He started his business with 100,000 MNT of capital and is now doing well with working capital exceeding 1,250,000 MNT. Altangarid's wife is a big supporter of his small business. Whenever she has free time, she helps in the business. Altangarid says that he would like to expand his business as capital allows and ideally would like to save some money for his children's future education. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cut wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cut wood

texts.en:
Buuveibaatar B. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughters are students in a local high school. Buuveibaatar has a small factory for half-processing animal intestines, which he purchases from local herders. Once intestines are half-processed, he transports them to sausage factories in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.

Buuveibaatar runs his factory with the help of his wife and two daughters. Since he started out in 2003, his factory has done well; his business capital has increased from 1,000,000 MNT to 3,800,000 MNT. Buuveibaatar is now requesting a loan to purchase more unprocessed intestines for his business. In the future, he hopes to put aside some of his profits for his daughters' university tuition.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed intestines

texts.en:
Byambasuren D. is 64 years old and lives with his wife and two grown-up daughters in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Byambasuren and his wife are both retired and live on their pension.

Since the pension compensation is not enough to support his family, Byambasuren has started a small retail business with his wife. He sells, in the local market, various women’s and men’s clothes imported from China. He frequently travels to Ereen, China, a border town where many of Chinese cheap products are imported from, and purchases cheap yet in-demand clothes for both women and men. When he is away traveling to China, his wife sits at the local market and sells the clothes.

Since the start in 2002, he has done well; his business capital has increased from 300,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 3,500,000 MNT. He says that he would like to expand his business as capital allows. He requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen for his retail business.

loans.use: To purchase more men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. EUFRACIO, es natural del distrito de Patria en kosñipata, ubicado en el departamento de Cusco, es aquí dónde empieza la entrada a la amazonía peruana, tenemos al majestuoso parque natural del Manu.

El socio es conviviente de la socia Elsa Martinez, y el se dedica a la construcción, y al cultivo de tierras, el trabaja personalmente las tierras en el sembrío de yuca, arroz, plátanos y coca, dependiendo la época el alterna su producción. El socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de semillas para su nueva producción y comprar algunas herramientas.

El socio agradece y del mismo modo valora el esfuerzo y respaldo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Senor Eufracio is from the district of Patria in Konispata, located in the department of Cusco. It is here, where the entrance to the Peruvian Amazon begins, that we have the majestic natural park of Manu.

Eufracio lives with Elsa Martinez and engages in construction and farming. He personally works the land, planting yucca, rice, bananas and coca, varying his production depending on the season. Eufracio is requesting a loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of seeds for his new crops and to buy some tools.

He is thankful and values the effort and support offered by means of this loan and is committed to making payments on his debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and tools

H. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be H.'s fifth loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos  vive en el manzano “D” de la zona  Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es casado, vive junto a su esposa, la cual es ama de casa y sus pequeños hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
Trabajo como costurero en una pequeña fabrica de chompas, ubicada en la zona de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de material de construcción (estuco, pintura, arena) y con ello realizar arreglos en la habitación de sus hijos, que por motivos de asentamiento de terreno sufrió varias rajaduras
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives on block “D” in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto. He is married. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two small school- aged children. He works as a sewer in a small sweater factory, which is located in the El Alto zone. The loan is to buy construction material (stucco, paint, sand) in order to fix his children’s room. The settling of the ground has caused various cracks. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that he is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, stucco, and paint to refurbish his children's room

loans.name: Allen

texts.es:
Allen vive en la calle  3 de Mayo de la zona  Villa Nuevo Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija, en casa de los padres de su esposa.
 
El trabaja en su automóvil, como chofer propietario de servicio publico, en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo normales. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Allen lives on the street 3 de Mayo (“Third of May”) in the Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood in the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and young daughter in his in-laws’ house. He uses his own vehicle in his work as a public transportation driver, on one city's central bus lines. He will use the loan for the repair of his engine. The constant use of his car causes mechanical failures and prevent him from being able to complete his normal work shift. This is his second loan with Impro; the completed evaluation qualifies him to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his taxi engine

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro  vive en la avenida Chacaltaya de la zona  Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar,
Su esposa, aparte de ser ama de casa, trabaja como panificadora en su pequeño horno artesanal ubicado en su propio domicilio, donde elabora pan a pequeña escala y lo distribuye en las tiendas de barrio del sector.
 
Leandro trabaja en su automóvil, como chofer propietario de servicio publico, en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor, y otros accesorios de su vehiculo
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Leandro lives on Chacaltaya Avenue in the Achachicala district of the city of La Paz.

He lives with his wife and school-aged children. In addition to her household duties, Leandro’s wife works as a baker out of their home using a traditional oven. She makes miniature loaves of bread and distributes them to stores in the neighborhood.

Leandro works out of his car. He is an independent taxi driver who services one of the central routes in the city.

His loan will be used to repair his engine and purchase other accessories for his vehicle. This is Leandro’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is eligible to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Engine repair and vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
Emilda  vive en el Manzano “M”  de la zona Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus dos hijos  de 6, y 1 año respectivamente, su esposo por razones de trabajo tuvo que emigrar a otro departamento en busca de fuente de trabajo.

Tiene un salón de peluquería donde realiza cortes de pelo, tanto a varones como a mujeres, también realiza tintes y peinados a señoras.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de algunas maquinas de peluquería y así mejorar la atención a sus clientes
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Emilda lives on Block “M” in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto.

She lives with her 2 children who are 6 years old and 1 year old, respectively. Her husband had to move to another department in search of employment.

Emilda has a hair salon where she cuts hair for both men and women. She also does hair dyeing and styling for women.

She will use the loan to purchase hairdressing equipment, which will improve the service she provides to her customers.

This is her second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that she is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair cutting tools for her hair salon.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia E. F. tiene 31 años y está casada por más de 11 años. Tiene 2 hijas y un hijo, las dos hijas ayudan con el cuidado de las vacas después de la escuela. Al  menor lo deja en una guardería todas las tardes. La señora Celia vive en la comunidad de Sumumpaya en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche vende a una microempresa que produce queso. 

La señora Celia cuida las vacas en las mañanas y trabaja como cocinera en las tardes para una empresa local. Su esposo trabaja como encargado de mantenimiento en el cementerio, por casi 15 años. 

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de 2 vacas lecheras que incrementarán la producción actual de leche, y así mejorar sus ingresos de tal forma que ya no sea necesario trabajar en las tardes y poder cuidar las vacas todo el día y poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijas. La familia sufrió un robo hace 2 meses atrás perdiendo casi todo lo que tenían, y ven en el crédito una oportunidad de recuperarse económicamente.
texts.en:
Señora Celia E. F. is 31 years old and has been married for more than eleven years. She has two daughters and a son. When school is over for the day, the two girls help her look after the cows. Celia puts her son in a nursery in the afternoons. She lives in the community of Sumumpaya in Cochabamba where she has three cows, the milk from which she sells to a small cheese-making business. Celia looks after the cows in the mornings, and in the afternoons works as a cook for a local business. Her husband has been in charge of maintenance at the cemetery for almost 15 years. The loan will be used to buy two cows so that the production of milk can be increased. This will also improve Celia’s earnings so that it will no longer be necessary for her to work in the afternoons; she can spend the whole day caring for the cows and spend more time with her daughters. The family was robbed two months earlier and lost almost everything they owned. They see this loan as a chance to get back on their feet financially.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Lenga

texts.en:
Born on the 1st of January 1975, G. is married and is a mother of five children, one of whom is still under the age of fifteen. The death of her husband in 2008 and the fact that all her children are still in school has made life very difficult for her family.  

As an ambitious woman, she decided to put all the effort she can into seeing her children established in good vocations in life. Because of the hardship in life, she was not able to pay school fees for her children so they all exceeded the primary school age. Therefore, the only option for them was to be trained in a trade.

She then sought help from GHAPE to start a business and pay apprentice fees for the children, and she received her first loan in 2008. With this new loan, she plans to buy a bail of second-hand dresses. Part of the loan will be used for her transportataion. She knows the business will succeed because people in her area do not have enough money to buy ready-made dresses, so their only option is second-hand dresses. She plans to pay her loan in 12 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the date of disbursement of loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand dresses

loans.name: Nkwain

texts.en:
M. is married and the mother of  five children, two of whom are under the age of fifteen years. She was born on the 8th of September 1963. M. and her family live in a four-room house in the Baingo neighborhood in the Belo subdivision in the North Region of Cameroon. Because she is the breadwinner of the family, she finds it very difficult to take care of the family single handedly. In addition, she sustained a serious accident and she was robed by thieves.  Faced with her low level of education, she could not secure a good job for herself. Thus, she embarked on the sale of second-hand dresses, which she has been doing for 2 years.

Becoming a member of GHAPE in 2008, she was fortunate to have acquired some techniques which have helped her to improve her business. She has proven successful with her previous loan, which she had conscientiously managed and repaid. Her business is going to help her community in that she will be able to supply the market with second-hand dresses. She plans to repay the loan in 12 months and repayment shall commence on the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand dresses

loans.name: Unidos Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Irma Olinda Huamán Calderón, tengo 49 años de edad, hace tres años participo como presidenta en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD en la alcancía comunal “Unidos al Progreso”, los doce integrantes que formamos esta ALCOM nos dedicamos al comercio, la llamamos así porque si estamos unidos, el progreso será para todos.
Siempre tuve la idea de generar mis propios ingresos, para ello empecé a vender chups de frutas en mi casa, además hacía servicio de costura. Esto me generó pequeñas ganancias que pude comprar golosinas; pero sentí que quería seguir creciendo, para ello era necesario contar con un capital el cual no lo tenía. Por tal motivo acudo a EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD a fin de obtener el crédito, lo que ayudó a crecer más mi negocio, quien diría hoy en día es una pequeña tienda que pienso seguir implementando con los siguientes préstamos que recibiré de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD hasta verlo convertido en una bodega. Hoy me siento una mujer superada con el apoyo de EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, no sólo ayudó en los gastos, también pude darle una mejor calidad de vida a mi hijo (especial) de 24 años.
texts.en:
Irma Olinda Huamán Calderón, I am 49 years old. For 3 years I have been the president of EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD in the community group “Unidos al Progreso” (united for progress). The 12 members of our group work in retail, we call ourselves “Unidos al Progreso” because we believe that being united will bring us progress. I have always had the initiative to generate my own income. In order to do that, I started selling fruit candy from my home. I also worked as a seamstress and these activities generated a small profit with which I bought more sweets. I felt that this business could move forward but I needed some capital that I did not have. For that reason, I reached out to EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD in order to obtain a loan to help me improve my business. Who would have thought that I would now have a small shop, which I intend to continue improving with additional loans from EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD until it is converted into a grocery store. Today I feel very fulfilled with the support of EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, it has not only helped me with expenses, but has also helped me provide a better quality of life for my 24 year old disabled son.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Supplies for Shop

loans.name: Yibem

texts.en:
Born on the 21st March 1957, Pa S. married and has six children, 2 of which are below the age of fifteen years. Pa S. and his family lives  in a two room’s apartment in the Baingo neighbor hood in Belo Sub division in the NWR of Cameroon.    
Due to circumstances beyond his control he hadn’t any privilege to have basic education nor learn a trade because his parents where poor, worst of it all was the dead of his parents when he was still very young which occurred due to lake of money to pay for medication. Also her cocoa plantation was destroyed by fire. Motivated by all these circumstances and the need to bring up a good family, he became a member of GHAPE in 2008. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid his first loan of 40000FCFA and the profit of this loan has helped him sustain his life and that of the family and also cater for the school needs of his children

Given a loan he plans to buy  plantain suckers , clearing of farm land and the purchase of two goats . He will use the profit of this loan to continue to educate his children and build a good house for the family. He thinks his business will succeed because his farm produce are highly needed in the urban centers of Bamenda, Bafussam and Yaonde and he has enough grazing land.
He plans to pay his loan in 12 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase of Suckers, clearing of farm digging of holes and the purchase of 2 goats.

loans.name: Yibem

texts.en:
Born on the 21st March 1957, Pa S. married and has six children, 2 of which are below the age of fifteen years. Pa S. and his family lives  in a two room’s apartment in the Baingo neighbor hood in Belo Sub division in the NWR of Cameroon.    
Due to circumstances beyond his control he hadn’t any privilege to have basic education nor learn a trade because his parents where poor, worst of it all was the dead of his parents when he was still very young which occurred due to lake of money to pay for medication. Also her cocoa plantation was destroyed by fire. Motivated by all these circumstances and the need to bring up a good family, he became a member of GHAPE in 2008. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid his first loan and the profit of this loan has helped him sustain his life and that of the family and also cater for the school needs of his children

He will use the profit of this loan to continue to educate his children and build a good house for the family. He thinks his business will succeed because his farm produce are highly needed in the urban centers of Bamenda, Bafussam and Yaonde and he has enough grazing land. The first installment repayment shall be on the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase of plantain Suckers, clearing of farm ,digging of holes and the purchase of 2 goats.

loans.name: Nuh

texts.en:
Thirty-seven year old T. has been suffering from unemployment for a long time due to the poor nature of his academic background. He lost his father at the age of fourteen and could not continue school due to financial difficulties, and that has rendered him jobless.
