T. is married and has four children, all of whom are still under the age of fifteen. He joined GHAPE in 2007 and received his first loan of 40,000FCFA ($80) which he invested in the retail sale of palm oil

With his second loan, he intends to extend his palm oil business and improve his grocery store. He foresees a good outcome from this investment because palm oil and salt are in highly demand for food. A lot of people come from nearby towns to buy palm oil and other things from T.. The profit that T. gets from the loan will be used to expand his store.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Sale of palm oil, savon, rice and salt

loans.name: Unidos Podemos Group 13

texts.en:
Jose M. M. is 30 years old and owns his own business selling fresh fruit, vegetables, and other food items. Today Jose is looking to take out a new loan, his third with Kiva and Esperanza International, to buy produce for his small business. With this loan, Jose will buy bananas, plantains, oranges, vegetables, and chickens from farmers in the countryside, which he will then sell to his neighbors in his small community outside of El Seybo, Dominican Republic. Jose's business, which he runs along with his wife, helps support his 8 year-old daughter. 

Jose reports that his fruit and vegetable business hasn't had any problems since he opened it 8 months ago. He used to earn a living by giving people rides on his motorcycle (a transportation service called a "motoconcho"), but switched professions when he realized he could make more money in food sales. It appears that, in doing so, Jose indeed made a wise career move: the loan he is requesting today is over twice the amount of the first loan he took out as a motoconcho. 

Jose is the coordinator for the Bank of Hope group called Unidos Podemos (United We Can) Group 13. He is pictured on the far left of the photo along with the four other borrowers in his group.

loans.use: New produce and other food items

loans.name: Morine

texts.en:
She is a mother of seven children. Life has been a living hell for her and her children ever since she was attacked by thieves and of all her belongings were taken away. When GHAPE extended its services to Belo Sub-Division where she lives, she saw the dawn of a new and promising day with GHAPE. She received her first loan of 40.000 FCFA in 2007 which served as her take-off capital. Her greatest dream is to be able to build a house of her own some day and also increase her farm land.

With her second loan, she plans to buy palm oil, salt, packets of maggi, and goats for rearing. The profit she gets from this loan shall be used to pay for her children’s education and provide food, clothing, and medication for them.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of palm oil, salt, maggi and goats

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina trabaja en una escuela de regente y vende perfumes y cosméticos a crédito en las oficinas y mercados.
Es madre soltera, y la actividad que realiza es para poder cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y estudios de su hija..
Vive en la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La paz en casa Alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo ( Compra de perfumes y cosméticos)
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Etelvina works in a regent school and sells perfumes and cosmetics on credit in the offices and markets. She is a single mother, and this activity allows her to cover her expenses for food and her daughter’s schooling. She lives in the Bolognia area in the city of La Paz in a rented house. The loan will be used as capital for her business, to buy perfumes and cosmetics. This is the third loan that she has requested from Impro and the second time that she has had the support of Kiva. She is a good client based on her history of repaying her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene venD. chicharrón seco y también tiene un puesto D. dulces, su esposo es empleado D. una chicharroneria. 
Vive en la Zona D. Bajo Irpavi D. la Ciudad D. La Paz en casa Alquilada
Requiere el crédito para capital D. trabajo (compra D. dulces y chicharrón seco)
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la sexta vez que requiere el apoyo D. kiva las ganas D. superarse le dan la oportunidad D. poder acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Irene sells dried pork rinds and also has a sweets stand. Her husband is an employee of a pork rind manufacturer.

She rents a house in the in Bajo Irpavi zone of La Paz.

She requests a working capital loan for the purchase of sweets and dried pork rinds.

This is the seventh time that she has requested a loan from field partner IMPRO and the sixth time she has requested the support of Kiva, who have given her the opportunity to improve her life and gain access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food and sweets to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana vende mercadería como ser carteras, bolsas, chamarras de cuero.
Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. En casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería ( Chamarras, carteras bolsas, de cuero).
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la quinta vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juliana sells merchandise like leather wallets, leather bags, and leather jackets. She lives in the Irpavi II area in the city of La Paz in a rented house. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (leather jackets, leather wallets, and leather bags). This is the sixth time she has requested a loan from Impro, and the fifth time that she has requested the support of Kiva. Her history qualifies her as a good client in terms of making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa trabaja vendiendo chamarras, carteras en su puesto, su esposo es chofer taxista.
Vive en la zona D. Irpavi II D. la ciudad D. La Paz, en casa D. sus suegros.
El crédito será destinado para capital D. trabajo ( compra D. mercadería chamarras, carteras).
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo D. Kiva.
Es una persona responsable por lo cual le califica como cliente bueno en el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa sells jackets and wallets in her stand. Her husband is a taxi driver. She lives in the Irpavi II area in the city of La Paz in the house of her in-laws. The loan will be used for capital for her business, to buy merchandise like jackets and wallets. This is the seventh time that she has requested a loan from Impro and the third time that she has requested the support of Kiva. She is a responsible person, who qualifies as a good client in terms of making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como profesor.
Vive en la zona de irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo ( compra de abarrotes y conservas.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Martha has a grocery store in her home, and her husband is a teacher. She lives in the Irpavi II area in the city of La Paz in her own house. This loan will be used as capital for her business, to buy groceries and canned food. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from Impro and the second time that she has requested the support of Kiva. Her desire to work gives her the opportunity to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Betty Santusa

texts.es:
Betty vende ropa a crédito y su esposo es chofer de taxi.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz
El crédito será destinado para Capital de trabajo ( compra de chompas, pantalones y camisas)
Es la quinta  vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva. Las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito, ya que su negocio es una ayuda poara poder solventar los gastos de alimentación.
texts.en:
Betty sells clothes on credit, and her husband is a taxi driver. She lives in the Irpavi II area in the city of La Paz. This loan will be used as capital for her business, to buy sweaters, pants, and shirts. This is the fifth loan that she has requested from Impro, and the third time she has had the support of Kiva. The desire to make her life better has given her the opportunity to receive this loan, since her business helps her to pay for food.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix vive en casa propia en la Av. buenos aires de la zona las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; la esposa se dedica a la venta de comida en la misma casa. Felix tiene un minibus con el cual trabaja como transporte publico de lunes a sábado y con estas dos actividades ellos mantienen a sus hijos. El crédito que solicita es para reparar el motor y comprar batería así de esta manera mantener en funcionamiento su herramienta de trabajo ya que no tienen mas ingresos.

Este será su primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio económico lo califica.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix lives in his own house on Av. Buenos Aireas in the area of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. His wife sells food in their house. Felix has a minibus, which he uses as a form of public transportation from Monday to Saturday. With these two activities, they take care of their children. This loan will be used to repair the motor and to buy a battery to keep his vehicle functioning, since he needs it for his job and he doesn’t have another source of income. This is his first loan with Impro, and his socio-economic status qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his minibus

loans.name: Hector Constancio

texts.es:
Hector vive en casa propia en la calle Simeon Roncal de la zona de alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en la Alcaldía, donde percibe un salario bajo motivo por el cual con sus pocos ahorros inició otro negocio relacionado a la venta de productos para la salud. Con esta actividad Hector aumentó sus ingresos y además generó fuentes de empleo ya que trabaja con promotoras.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más producto y mantener el negocio estable.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 1999 y sus pagos han sido siempre puntuales.
texts.en:
Hector lives in his own house on Simeon Roncal Street in the area of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He works in the mayor’s office, where he receives a low salary. Because of this, he used his small savings to start a business, through which he sells health products. With this activity, Hector increased his income and generated sources of employment since he works with promoters. This loan will be used to increase his capital, so that he will be able to buy more products and maintain a stable business. He has been an Impro client since 1999, and his repayments have always been made punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Valentín Abecia de la zona de san pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, tiene un taller de mecánica en la calle Canónigo Ayllón  que administra con ayuda de su hijo, también genera fuentes de trabajo porque tiene tres empleados.

El crédito que solicita es para ampliar el taller, comprar herramientas y de esta manera  estabilizar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos y el de sus empleados.

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives with his wife and children in his own house on Valentín Abecia Street in the San Pedro zone of the city of La Paz. He has a mechanic’s shop on Canónigo Ayllón Street, which he runs with his son’s help. He is also a source of work because he has three employees. The loan he is asking for is to expand his shop and buy tools. This way he can stabilize his business and improve his income and his employees’ income. He has been a client of Impro since 2006. He was very good at making his payments, and that is why he can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his shop

loans.name: Alejo Marcelino

texts.es:
Alejo  vive en la avenida “A3” de la zona  Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto

Vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus hijos los cuales se encuentran realizando estudios universitarios. Su esposa, posee un negocio de venta de carne vacuna, en un mercado de la zona.
 
Alejo trabaja en su vehiculo como chofer, en rutas céntricas de la ciudad de la Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la refacción de su vivienda, la cual se encuentra demasiado deteriorada. Para esto necesita comprar materiales como cemento, arena, estuco y pinturas.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Alejo lives on Avenue “A3” in the Villa Adela zone in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and two of his children who attend the university. His wife has a business selling beef in a market in the zone. Alejo works as a driver in his vehicle. He drives on routes that are central to the city of La Paz. The loan is to refurbish his house. The house is much deteriorated. To refurbish it he needs to buy materials like cement, sand, stucco, and paint. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish his house

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito  vive en la calle Manuel Oyola  de la zona Bautista Saavedra en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus 3 hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposa vive y trabaja en su comunidad ubicada en otra provincia del departamento,
 
Trabaja como comerciante de papa, que adquiere en su comunidad y vende  semanalmente en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de mercadería y así mejorar sus ventas
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Benito lives on Manuel Oyola Street in the Bautista Saavedra district of the city of El Alto. He lives with his 3 school-aged children. His wife lives and works in a community located in another province.

He works as a potato trader, buying crops grown in his community and selling them on a weekly basis in the city of El Alto.

His loan will be used to acquire a greater amount of merchandise and thus improve his sales.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The results of his evaluation indicated that he qualified for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nataly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nataly  vive en la zona Huayna Potosí  calle  20  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es soltera, vive junto a su pequeño sobrino del cual se hizo cargo al morir la esposa de su hermano mayor.

La señora se dedica a la venta de sombreros en una feria matinal que se realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta horas 10, en una zona céntrica de la Ciudad de la Paz. Dicha mercadería la adquiere de su abuela y su tía las cuales confeccionan dichos sombreros.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de mayor mercadería y así  incrementar su producción, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro,  y el segundo via KIVA. la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Nataly lives at calle 20 in the Huayna Potosí region of the city of El Alto.
She is single and lives with her young nephew. She began taking care of him after the death of her older brother’s wife.
She sells hats at a morning market that takes place from 6 in the morning until 10 in central La Paz. She gets her merchandise from her grandmother and aunt who make the hats.
She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to increase her production and therefore her income.
This is her third loan with Impro and her second via Kiva. An evaluation determined that she qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aydee Mery

texts.es:
Aydee  vive en la calle 14  de la zona Villa Alemania en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Por circunstancias de la vida, quedo sola a cargo de su hijos, ya que el esposo hizo abandono del hogar hace bastante tiempo, desde entonces se convirtió en madre y padre de sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales la mayor egresó de la secundaria el pasado año.

Actualmente trabaja en un sindicato de transporte urbano, como control de 
Asistencia, rutas de las movilidades y los conductores.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de una computadora de segunda mano, para el estudio de sus hijos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Aydee lives on calle 14 in the Villa Alemania zone of the city of El Alto.
Due to life’s circumstances, she has been left to look after her children on her own. Her husband left them a while ago and since then she has become a mother and father to her four children, the eldest of whom graduated from high school last year.
She currently works for an urban transport union monitoring the transportation routes and the attendance of the conductors.
She will use this loan to get a secondhand computer for her children’s studies. This is her first loan with Impro- an evaluation determined that she qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino vive en la calle Enrique Oblitas de la zona villa Ingenio  en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es casado. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de café en un puesto callejero en la feria principal, que se realiza los días jueves y domingos en la ciudad. 

Trabaja como empleado de limpieza en una fabrica de la ciudad de la Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de algunos materiales de construcción que le hacen falta para la reparación de una de sus habitaciones en su domicilio.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Sabino lives on calle Enrique Oblitas in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto.
His wife sells coffee at a stall in the city's main market on Thursdays and Sundays.
He works as a cleaner at a factory in La Paz.
He will use the loan to purchase some building materials that he needs to repair one of the rooms in his house.
This is his first loan with Impro; an evaluation determined that he qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Teofilo Cesar

texts.es:
Teofilo Gutiérrez Sánchez vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Villa la Merced, ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Victoria Patti y sus dos hijas.
El señor Teofilo es mecánico y Trabaja en un taller de reparación de vehículos de su propiedad en su barrio, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos nuevas habitaciones en la parte posterior de su vivienda ya que sus hijas no cuentan con espacio para poder desarrollar sus actividades diarias.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Teofilo Gutiérrez Sánchez lives in his own house in Villa la Merced, on a hillside north of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Victoria Patti, and their two daughters.

Teofilo is a mechanic and works in a car repair shop that he owns in his neighborhood, and he supports his family with that income.

He will use the loanhe is applying for to build two new rooms on the back of his house, since his daughters don't have space for their daily use. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic evaluation performed qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Ingrid Selma

texts.es:
Ingrid Reinstch C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Miraflores, ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
La señora Ingrid es secretaria en una oficina privada,  ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia, ya que sus dos hijos están cursando los últimos semestres para culminar sus estudios.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de la instalación sanitaria y los muros interiores de su vivienda, que por el paso del tiempo sufrió un deterioro considerable.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ingrid Reinstch C. lives in her own home in the Miraflores Zone, beside the city of La Paz, with her son. Mrs. Ingrid is a secretary in a private office, income with which she uses to maintain her family. She has two children who are studying to finish school and are currently in their last semester. The loan requested is to renovate the plumbing and internal walls of her house, which over time have deteriorated considerably. This is the third time they have requested a loan, and a socioeconomic analysis carried out has qualified them favorably and thus they can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations

loans.name: Javier Alberto

texts.es:
Javier V. C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de San Pedro, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Mercedes Montoya y sus dos hijoS. Javier es mecánico y Trabaja en un taller de reparación de vehículos de su zona, y su esposa atiente una tienda de barrio en su domicilio ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de ingreso principal de su vivienda y la puerta posterior de la tienda  de su esposa.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Javier V. C. lives in his own home, in the San Pedro area, on the western hillside in the city of La Paz, with his wife, Mrs. Mercedes Montoya and their two children. Javier is a mechanic and works in an auto repair shop in his area. His wife attends a neighborhood shop out of their home, they use the revenues to care for their family. The loan requested is for construction of the entrance to their home and the rear door of his wife's store. This is the third loan requested and a socioeconomic analysis carried out has qualified them positively and thus they are able to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.en:
The women in this group are tight-knit and sell a variety of products. Some women sell clothes and cosmetics, while others have food stores. One woman cleans homes, while others sell bedspreads and pillows. Most of the members just started their businesses less than five years ago and are looking to grow their businesses. These businesses help them to earn enough money to pay off their loan. The majority of these women have previous experience taking out loans.

There is considerable competition in all of their markets, but their dedication to their businesses will allow them to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To further their businesses

loans.name: Women For Development Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres para el Desarrollo son D. L. comunidad D. Erusco, Distrito D. Cayara, Provincia D. Víctor Fajardo. L. comunidad se dedica a L. agricultura D. cereales, tubérculos, crianza D. animales menores, venta D. animales y cereales.
Hermelinda es casada, tiene 2 hijos, Hermelinda tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además tiene un molino en donD. brinda servicio D. molienda y también elL. misma los procesa y venD. en las ferias, su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. cereales. Los sueños D. Hermelinda son ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Por otro lado Dolores es casada, Dolores se dedica a L. crianza D. cuy en su casa, actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias, su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. cuy mejorado. Los sueños D. Dolores son tener mas galpones D. cuy y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Village Bank Women for Development are from the Erusco Community, Cayara District, Victor Fajardo province. The community is dedicated to agriculture of grains, tubers, small animal husbandry, and selling animals and grains.

Hermelinda is married, with two children. Hermelinda has a small house where she sells general groceries, further she has a mill where she offers grinding services, also processing it herself and then selling it at fairs. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of grains. Hermelinda dreams of expanding her business and to proviD. a better education for her children in the city of Ayacucho.

On the other hand there is Dolores, who is married. Dolores is dedicated to raising guinea pigs in her home, an activity she carries out with the help of her husband. She sells them at the fair, and her loan will be invested in the purchase of better guinea pigs. Dolores dreams of having mO. guinea pig farms and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains, guinea pigs, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra  vive en la calle Yuqui  de la zona Villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus 2  hijos,  de 19 y 14 Años respectivamente.
 
Trabaja como comerciante de ropa de lana, tejida  a mano los cuales adquiere de diversos artesanos, y los vende de manera ambulante en el centro de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de mercadería y así mejorar sus ventas
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in Yuqui Street in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her two sons, aged 19 and 14.

She works as a vendor of hand-woven woolen clothes, which she purchases from various craftsmen and sells in the streets of the city center. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise and thus increase her sales.

This is her first loan with Impro. Our evaluation qualifies her to be granted this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.en: The members of this group all live in the same neighborhood and have a variety of businesses, including selling clothes, cosmetics, food, and shoes, and many of their husbands drive taxis. Though there is a lot of competition in the area, the effort and dedication that these members place in their businesses has allowed them, thus far, to stay ahead of the curve. All of the members have previous experience taking out loans, and would like to have another loan to help increase the amount and variety of their wares and bring in more income for their families.

loans.use: To buy stock for stores and repairing vehicles

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Ccenhuacucho Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Ccenhuacucho son D. la comunidad D. Ccenhuacucho, Distrito D. Vinchos, Provincia D. Huamanga, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la agricultura D. papa, cebada, trigo, olluco, también la piscicultura, crianza D. ganado vacuno  y ovino.
Celina es casada, tiene 7 hijos, Celina compra y venD. animales menores, quesos, productos que comercializa en las diferentes ferias D. la región con l ayuda D. sus hijos y esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. quesos y animales menores. Los sueños D. Celina son incrementar su capital para mejorar las condiciones D. vida en su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
Mientras que Doris es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos, Doris tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, también un restaurante, además Doris venD. combustibles, actividades que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, hijos y hermana, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. combustible. Los sueños D. Doris son educar a sus hijos y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the Ccenhuacucho Community Bank are from the Ccenhuacucho community in the Vinchos district in the Huamanga province. The primary activities in the community are potato, barley, wheat, and olluco (root vegetable) farming. Also, there is fish breeding and the raising of cattle and sheep. Celina is married and has seven children. Celina buys and sells small animals and cheese in the different regional fairs. She does this with the help of her children and her husband. The loan is to buy cheese and small animals. Celina’s dreams are to increase her capital in order to improve her family’s living conditions and to give her children a good education. Doris is in a common law marriage and has six children. Doris has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. She also has a restaurant. Doris also sells combustibles. She does this with help from her husband, children, and sister. Doris’ dreams are to educate her children and improve her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, cheese, small animals, rice, sugar, and combustibles

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Leonidas es soltera, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Leonidas viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y pollos para criar, y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los diferentes mercados. Además Leonidas tiene un kiosco cerca del hospital en donde vende bebidas.
Leonidas necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, leche y papel.
Lo sueños de Leonidas son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Leonidas is a member of the Paloma (The Dove) Communal Bank. She is 46 years of age, single and has five children. Leonidas travels to the different fairs in the region where she sells fruits and chickens for raising and breeding. She also buys grains at the fairs that she then sells in various markets. She also has a stand near the hospital where she sells beverages. Leonidas needs a loan of 1,000 Sols which will be used to buy carbonated drinks, milk and paper. She dreams of her children finishing their studies and being able to get ahead. Click Here to see her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated drinks, milk and paper.

loans.name: Sabina Alejandra

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Sabina es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Sabina tiene un puesto en el mercado las Nazarenas en donde vende abarrotes en general, además los días domingos viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos que vende en el mercado.
Sabina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y cereales.
Los sueños de Sabina son surtir con mas productos su puesto y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sabina is a partner in the Paloma Community Bank. She is 38 years old and lives with her partner and four children. Sabrina has a stall in the Nazarenas market where she sells groceries, and on Sundays she travels to markets across the region where she buys the grains and cheese to supply her stall. Sabrina needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll invest in rice and grains. She dreams of supplying her stall with more products and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and grains

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina  es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Delfina es casada, tiene 62 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Delfina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras. Además Delfina elabora molidos D. cereales que venD. en los mercados.
Delfina necesita un préstamo D. 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, bebidas y cereales.
Los sueños D. Delfina son terminar D. construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Paloma Community Bank. She is married, 62 years old, and has 9 children, 4 of whom live with her. Delfina has a storefront in her house where she sells groceries and vegetables. In addition, Delfina produces ground grains, which she sells at the markets. Delfina needs a loan for 2,400 soles so that she can purchase rice, sugar, drinks, and grain. Delfina's dream is to finish construction on her house and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, drinks, and grain.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Sara es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Sara junto a su pareja tienen una empresa llamada Inversiones Alex Aroni SAC. Que se dedica a la administración de servicios higiénicos, alquiler de tiendas, todo ello a través de concesiones.
Sara necesita un préstamo de 3600 soles dinero que será invertido en la remodelación de un local.
Los sueños de Sara son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir una casa para cada hijo.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Paloma (The Dove) Communal Bank. She is 37 years of age and living with her domestic partner and her three children. Together with her partner, they have a business called Alex Aroni Investments, S.A., which is dedicated to restrooms, commercial rentals, and all those things having to do with concessions. Sara needs a loan of 3,600 Sols which will be invested in remodeling a commercial location. Her dreams are that her children will become professional people and that she will build a house for each of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel a location.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
For the past five years, Maria has been selling beauty products out of her home. She sells cosmetics through word-of-mouth referrals and by visiting beauty salons and spas. Her work pays off and she's able to supplement her income as a housekeeper, which in turn helps provide for her four sons and eight grandchildren.

Like many entrepreneurs, Maria has faced many challenges, the biggest one being not having access to capital to grow her home-based business. The lack of capital has delayed her plans for expansion, plans for opening a small cosmetic retail store in the neighborhood where she lives. 

Maria was very grateful to hear about ACCION USA and applied for $1,000 loan to buy merchandise in bulk to diversify her inventory and to get better pricing, thus increasing her profit margin. Maria plans to continue growing her business so as to turn it into a small retail store one day. She also gets a sense of accomplishment from helping other women in her community start their home-based sales businesses.

loans.use: purchasing beauty merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Rosa es casada, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
Los sueños de Rosa son ampliar su local, aumentar su negocio e hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Paloma Community Bank. Rosa is 60 and has five children. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells general groceries like vegetables, fruits, and drinks. She works every day with some help from her children. Rosa needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy rice, sugar and drinks. Rosa’s dreams are to expand her store, increase her business, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and drinks

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Originally from Colombia, Luz moved to Miami four years ago in hopes of establishing a life in the United States. She has 14 brothers and sisters, some of whom still live in Colombia, as well as two daughters. Luz is trying to learn English, so that she can start expanding her business outside of Spanish-speaking Miami. She tries to practice English daily with her clients.

Luz has always enjoyed the work of a seamstress and has successfully earned a very small monthly contract with a company that pays her to create clothing patterns. Luz’s work requires her to travel from Miami to places such as Illinois and Pennsylvania. To save on costly train and plane tickets, Luz will use her loan to purchase a car, so that she can get around to client meetings more easily and increase the efficiency of her business.

This is Luz's first loan from ACCION USA, and while it is small, it will help her build her credit so that she can borrow more in the future.

loans.use: A vehicle for her business

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Gudelia es casada, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Gudelia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Gudelia necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Gudelia son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gudelia is a member of the New Life communal bank group.

Gudelia is 62 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a store in her home where she sells general merchandise. She works at her business every day.

Gudelia needs a loan of 1250 soles loan money to by rice and sugar. She dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Juana es conviviente, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, además los fines de semana vende picarones cerca del cementerio de manera ambulatoria.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y harina.
Los sueños de Juana son mejorar su negocio y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Nueva Vida (New Life) Communal Bank. She is 51 years of age and lives with her domestic partner and her four children. Juana has a store in her house where she sells mostly groceries and beverages. In addition, on the weekends she goes on foot near the cemetery selling picarones (a donut-shaped, fried pastry, sometimes incorporating pumpkin or sweet potatoes, served with syrup). Juana needs a loan of 1,250 Sols which will be used to buy rice, sugar and flour. She dreams of improving her business and buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Martha Consuelo

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Martha es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Martha vende productos naturales por medio de catálogos. Además Martha tiene una empresa de confecciones de polos, gorros, su taller se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Martha son tener una fabrica.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of “Nueva Vida” Community Bank. She is 40 years old and a single mother who has one daughter. She sells natural products through catalogs and owns a clothing business where she makes t-shirts and hats, at her studio in the city of Lima. Martha is asking for a loan of $300 which will be invested in the purchase of fabrics. Martha's dream is to have a factory

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en un local alquilado, en donde vende mochilas, maletas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas y maletines.
Los sueños de Victoria son tener una bodega en su casa y que sus 3 últimos hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of”Nueva Vida” Community Bank. She is 45 years old, has a partner and 4 children.

Victoria has a shop in a rented space, where she sells backpacks and suitcases, Activity that she performs every day with the help of her daughters. She needs a loan of $400 that will be invested in the purchase of backpacks and briefcases. Victoria's drem is to have a cellar in her house and that her 3 youngest kids get a high education.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gladis Vilma

texts.es:
Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Gladis es casada, tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende condimentos diversos, cereales precocidos, productos que ella misma prepara en su casa. Además tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa.
Gladis necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de menestras.
Gladis sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda mas grande.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of “Nueva Vida” Community Bank. She is married and has a booth at “Abril 12”, a market where she sells various spices/seasonings and pre-cooked cereals, products that she makes in her house. She also has a small cellar in her house.

Gladis is asking for a loan of$350 that will be invested in the purchase of “menestra”, a saucy lentil stew dish. Gladis’ dreams are for her children to be professionals and have a bigger booth.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gianina Victoria

texts.es:
Gianina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Gianina es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, de profesión Abogada, Gianina junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos de motos, además tienen un taller de reparaciones de motos, para lo cual cuenta con 4 personas. Además Gianina hace poco tiempo aperturó una oficina de asesoría jurídica y contable en asociación con otros profesionales.
Gianina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de muebles para el consultorio.
Los sueños de Gianina son comprar una casa e impulsar su consultorio.
texts.en:
Gianina is a member of the Nueva Vida Communal Bank.
Gianina lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has one son. She is a lawyer by profession. Gianina and her husband own a store in a rented space where they sell spare motorcycle parts. They also have a motorcycle repair garage with 4 employees. Gianina also recently set up a legal and financial consultancy in association with other professionals.
Gianina needs a 600 PEN loan to purchase furniture for her consultancy.
Gianina dreams of buying a house and of kick-starting her consultancy.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her consultancy

loans.name: Belinda Walkiria

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Belinda C. tiene su propio negocio de pulpería el cual atiende muy alegremente con el propósito de mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia.

El motive principal por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y de esta forma mejora su situación y salir adelante en el negocio que ella posee.
texts.en:
Mrs. Belinda C. has a grocery shop at the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, where she is happy to work in order to improve her family economic situation. The main reason she has gone to Ceprodel is because she needs a loan for the purchase of grocery products that will help her to improve her financial situation and succeed in the business she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nuevo Despertar Group

texts.es:
En uno de los 	Centros Focales de Pro Mujer “Alto Lima”, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal  “Nuevo Despertar”, con aproximadamente 5 años de vida, cuenta con 11 integrantes que tienen  diferentes negocios como: venta de manta de vicuña, verduras, cafetería, peinados, comida, ferretería y costura, ellas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería e insumos.

Su presidenta es Juana C. que tiene el negocio de tejido de manta de vicuña, Juana indica que el grupo se formo con amigas y vecinas de la zona, una funcionaria de Pro Mujer les había organizado y capacitado en la casa de una de las integrantes, sus primeras reuniones lo hacían en ese domicilio y con el pasar del tiempo se vinieron a el Centro Focal, donde además tienen acceso al consultorio.
texts.en:
The community association "Nuevo Despertar "is located in one of the focal points of “Pro Mujer Alto Lima”. It has been running for approximately 5 years and has 11 members who have different businesses, they sale vicuña wool blankets, vegetables, coffee, food, hardware, and cloths. They need a loan for the purchase of working materials.

The president of the association is Mrs. Juana C., who has a vicuña blanket business, she states that the group was formed by friends and neighbors in the area, an official of Pro Mujer organized and trained them at the home of one of the members. They had their first meetings in the home and with time they moved to the community center, where they have access to the office.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia C. se ha destacado por ser una dama que vende diferentes tipos de electrodomésticos comercializados en la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario ofrece dichos productos.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos y para ello espera que su crédito sea otorgado sin problemas y así salir adelante en su situación económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia C. works every day selling different types of appliances in the city of Chinandega. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel that will be invested in the purchase of appliances. She hopes to get the loan so she can keep her business running and improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Darling Scarlet

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega, la señora Darling G. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de alimentos y bebidas las cuales han sido comercializadas desde hace 15 años en su establecimiento.

De manera muy inteligente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bebidas para el negocio y también para comprar la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así comercializar dichos productos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling G. is devoted to her business selling meals and soft drinks at the Central Market of Chinandega. She has been selling them for 15 years.

She has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of soft drinks and ingredients to make the meals that she will sell at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fanny Dareli

texts.es:
Fanny es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bella.
Fanny es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Fanny tiene cabinas de Internet en la casa de su suegra, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, también vende golosinas, caramelos y bebidas.
Fanny necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una moto.
Los sueños de Fanny son tener una tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanny is a member of the Community Bank “Imasumacc” which means how beautiful. She is 33 years old, has a partner and one son. Fanny has an internet booth business at her mother's in law home. She works in this activity with her sister’s help; she also sells candy, sweets and soft drinks.

Fanny is asking for a loan of $350 that will be invested as a down payment for a motorcycle. Her dream is to have a store of spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Down payment for a motorcycle

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Cipriana es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bella.
Cipriana es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Ciprina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, además los días viernes viaja a las ferias D. donD. compra quesos, carne que venD. en su tienda.
Cipriana necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la ampliación D. su tienda.
Los sueños Cipriana son ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cipriana is a member of the Community Bank “Imasumacc” which means how beautiful. Cipriana is 38 years old, married and has 6 children. She owns a grocery shop at her house, where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat; activity that she performs with the help of her sons. She also travels on Fridays to the fairs where she buys cheese and meat that later sells in her shop.

Cipriana is asking for a loan of $500 that will be invested in expanding her shop. Her dreams are to expand the business and proviD. a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Raquel Rebeca

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo, en la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Raquel S. se dedica a la venta de productos personales como productos del cabello.

Actualmente, la señora Raquel tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos personales para el cabello. Espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel porque el crédito le ayudará a mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Raquel S. runs her business with great effort selling toiletries such has hair products.

Currently, Mrs. Raquel feels the need to invest in her business, so she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase more hair products. She has much confidence in Ceprodel because this loan will help improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toiletries

loans.name: Glicerio Eloy Honorio

texts.es:
El socio Eloy, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, el tiene una pequeña tienda a una cuadra de la plaza de armas de la ciudad del Cusco, en la que expone sus trabajos y los vende al por mayor y menor, en el stand nº 6, el socio necesita el crédito para poder comprar materiales y así pueda elaborara sus trabajos e incrementar su producción.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eloy belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" ("Always United") Community Bank. He is a native of the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco. He is 39 years old, lives with his partner and has two children. He alternates his household duties with his craftwork. He has a small shop a block from a main square in Cusco where he displays his works and sells them wholesale and retail. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase materials to make his works and increase his production. He is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to fulfill his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make his craftwork

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia Evangelina, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas, ella tienen un pequeño puesto de caramelos y demás en la esquina de su casa, en la cual vende todo tipo de golosinas a los niños del barrio o cuanta gente pase por el lugar, ella solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar al pòpr mayor dulces y galletas y diversos productos para venderlos.

Nuestra socia encuentra muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evangelina belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" ("Always United") Community Bank and is a native of the Santiago neighborhood in the city Cusco, Peru. She is 49 years old and single. She makes a living buying and selling snacks, and she has a small snack stand at the corner of her home, where she sells all kinds of goodies to the neighborhood children and the people who are passing by. She is requesting the loan to purchase candy, cookies and other products at wholesale to then sell. She is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to fulfill her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia Clotilde, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 60 años de edad,  es separada y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de joyas casa por casa, ella también visita instituciones y lleva sus joyas y las ofrece, luego al cabo de 15 días a un mes, cuando se acerca la fecha de pago de los trabajadores, ella va a cobrarles, este tipo de trabajo lo viene haciendo para cubrir sus necesidades y para que se sienta útil, manifiesta nuestra socia, para lo cual requiere el préstamo para poder comprar más joyas y exponerlas en las diferentes instituciones.

Nuestra socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clotilde belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" ("Always United") Community Bank and is a native of the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 60 years old, separated from her husband, and alternates her activities from her household obligations to buying and selling jewelry door to door. She also visits institutions and brings her jewelry to offer them up, and then can charge the workers after their payday. She does this type of work in order to meet her needs and to feel useful, she says. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase more jewelry and display them at the different institutions. She is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to fulfill her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Libertad”  se encuentra en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”, con 14 integrantes, una de las integrantes es Teresa M., que llegó al grupo cuando ya estaba conformado a invitación de una miga  y le agradó mucho la garantía solidaria y los temas de capacitación que imparten, como la mora y el sobreendeudamiento porque les hace reflexionar.
Las integrantes de  “Libertad” tienen diferentes negocios tales como la venta de ropa, guitarras, videos, regalos, cosméticos, tienda de barrio, comida, golosinas y carpintería. Todas aseguran que necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y poder ofertar a sus clientes productos variados.
texts.en:
The “Libertad” group, located in the “Los Andes” center, is comprised of 14 members. One of the group members, Teresa M., joined the already-established group when a friend invited her. She liked the group’s surety bond, and the training topics they give, such as loan defaults and debt overhang, because they make them think.

The members of the “Libertad” group own different businesses, such as clothing sales, guitar sales, gift sales, cosmetics sales, general store, food sales, candy store, and carpentry. They all assert that they need this loan so that they can purchase merchandise and offer their customers a wide variety of products.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marco Alexander

texts.es:
El socio M., pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, entre sus actividades están su pasión por la música y de profesión electricista, arregla todo tipo de electrodomésticos, el tiene su pequeño taller en su misma casa, el nació en la ciudad blanca de Arequipa, pero radica en Cusco 16 años, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios de electrodomésticos.

El socio se encuentra agradecido y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Don M. is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS", he is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

He is 36 years old, lives with his life partner and has 4 children, he has a passion for music and is a professional electrician. He fixes all kinds of electrical appliances in his small workshop at home. He was born in the white town of Arequipa, but has been living in Cusco for 16 years. He requests the loan to buy accessories for electrical appliances. The partner is grateful and appreciates the loan and the opportunity and he is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase accessories for electrical appliances

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo, la señora Mirna Malespín se dedica a la venta de café y de pan ambulantemente en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde oferta sus productos en todo el mercado y buscando la manera de satisfacer a sus clientes por medio de la elaboración de un excelente café. 

La circunstancia por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de un crédito para la compra del café, pan y de algunos materiales de trabajo como vasos descartables y servilletas. Con este crédito ella se beneficia grandemente en su actividad de venta ambulante.
texts.en:
Filled with enthusiasm, Ms. Mirna Malespín sells coffee and bread as a street vendor in the city of Managua’s wholesale market. She offers her products throughout the marketplace, searching for ways to attain customer satisfaction by brewing excellent coffee.

The reason why she has now turned to Ceprodel is that she needs a loan to purchase coffee, bread, and other work supplies, such as disposable cups and napkins. This loan will greatly benefit her as a street vendor.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee and other supplies

loans.name: Yelibeth

texts.es:
La socia es la Srta. Yelibeth, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Ella es soltera y entre sus diversas actividades ella trabaja en un restaurante turístico en el barrio de plateros a media cuadra de la plaza principal de Cusco, zona turística, por lo que la socia entre algunos de los gastos que efectuará ella invertirá en su curso de ingles.

Nuestra socia valora y  agradece el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Miss Yelibeth is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS", she is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

She is single and among others she works at a restaurant visited by tourists in the neighborhood of Plateros, half-a-block from the center of Cusco, a tourist area, and therefore part of the loan will be invested in an English learning course.

Our partner appreciates and is grateful for the loan and the opportunity through this means and she is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal use.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos, tiene estudios de primaria completa. Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace muchos años en otro Banco Comunal, pero en este Banco desde hace 7 años, inició su trabajo con un préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, etc, para su tienda.

Su mayor  deseo es ampliar se tienda y surtida y también le gustaría dedicarse a la crianza de animales.

A ella le gustan las actividades que se organizan y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Mercedes Z. is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Microfinance Institute, located in the Chucuito district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 46-year-old married mother with 3 children. She completed elementary school and lives in the Chinchero Sector Central Community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for many years through another microfinance institute, but she has been a member of this institute for 7 years. She started her business with a 300.00 PEN loan, which she used to purchase provisions.

At this time, she needs an 800.00 PEN loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, and other products for her general store.

Her biggest wish is to expand her store and have it well-stocked. She would also like to raise livestock.

She likes her microfinance institute’s activities and the way it helps her save.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijo, tiene estudios superiores técnicos. Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de lana de acrílica para elaboración de artesanías, también comprará pollos para crianza.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando y poder exportar sus productos.

A ella le gustan la actividades de su organización.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia C. is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Microfinance Institute, located in the Chucuito district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 34-year-old single mother with one son. She has a technical degree and lives in the Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza Community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for a year. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan to purchase wool to make handicrafts.

At this time, she needs a 600.00 PEN loan to purchase synthetic wool to make handicrafts. She also needs the loan to purchase chickens to start a chicken farm.

Her biggest wish is to continue working and to be able to export her products.

She likes her microfinance institute’s activities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and different-colored wool

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La socia Lilian, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, entre las labores del hogar, ella comparte las de sus esposo, quien tiene una carpintería y requiere el préstamo para así poder invertir en la compra de herramientas y madera para hacer sus pendientes. Motivo por el cual ella solicita el préstamo.

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Doña Lilian is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS, she is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

The partner is 39 years old, married, with 2 children, she does the chores as well as helping her husband at his carpenter's workshop and she requests the loan in order to invest in the purchase of tools and wood for unfinished work. The partner is very grateful and appreciative of the loan and the opportunity through this means and is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and wood.

loans.name: Angelica Flora

texts.es:
La señora Angélica, Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 3 hijos, tiene estudios de primaria completa y vive en la Comunidad de Potojani Grande Sector Achara.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  el cual utilizó para la compra de artículos de limpieza.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar betunes, detergentes, pasta dental, condimentos en general, al mismo tiempo compara lana acrílica para elaboración de artesanías en miniaturas.
 
Su mayor deseo es mejorar su negocio y surtirlos mejor.

A ella le gustan las facilidades que ofrecen a las mujeres que trabajamos para sacar adelante a nuestros hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Angelica A. is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Microfinance Institute, located in the Chucuito district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 49-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children. She completed elementary school and lives in the Potojani Grande Sector Achara Community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost 5 years now. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan in purchasing cleaning products.

At this time she needs an 800.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase shoe polish, detergent, tooth paste, condiments, and synthetic wool to make miniature handicrafts.

Her biggest wish is to improve her business and have it well-stocked.

She likes the opportunities that working women have to help their children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoe polish, detergent, tooth paste, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia Karina, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, entre sus actividades del hogar, está la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella tiene entre sus clientes a las compañeras de trabajo de su esposo que están en el área educacional.

La socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Doña Karina is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS", she is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, lives with her life partner and has 3 children, among her daily activities she sells beauty products from catalog. Among her clients are colleagues from her husband's workplace who are working in education.

The partner is very grateful and appreciates the loan and the opportunity through this means and she is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia,  pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, entre sus actividades del hogar, ella se alterna con el empleo en un café snack en av. infancia, ella se dedica a procesar el café y vender, tortas, empanadas, gaseosas, te, jugos. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

Nuestra socia se encuentra agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Doña Julia is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS". She is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, lives with her life partner and has 4 children. Among her chores she works at a snack cafe on Av. Infancia, she processes coffee and sells sandwiches, soft drinks, tea, juice. She requests the loan for personal use.

Our partner is grateful and appreciates the loan and the opportunity through this means and she is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Nery Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Nery Amalia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y es madre de 01 hijo, tiene estudios Universitarios (Ing. Agrícola) y vive en el Barrio Cruzan av. Jesús Ilave.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra y venta de ropa.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2300.00 Nuevos soles, parte del dinero será utilizado para compra de ropas para adultos y niños, y la otra parte  para implementar su negocio de servicio de locutorio e Internet.

Su mayor  deseo es ampliar sus  cabinas de Internet y abrir una tienda de venta de ropas.

A ella le gustan la unión entre las socias y los ahorros de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Nery Amalia belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chuchuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 23, in a common law marriage, and has one son. She has a college education (Agricultural Engineering). She lives in the Cruzan neighborhood on Jesús Ilave Avenue. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy and sell clothes. She now needs a loan for 2,300 PEN. Part of the money will be used to buy clothing for children and adults. She will use the other part of the money to set up her business, booths for Internet service. Her biggest wish is to expand her Internet booths and to open a store for selling clothes. She likes the unity between members and the savings in her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for children and adults.  Set up business of booths for Internet

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana Maria, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.
Nuestra socia tiene 37 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos, entre sus actividades del hogar, ella se dedica también al comercio minorista, ella vende comida en el mercado, ella misma cocina en su stand y vende comida, ahí se reúnen con sus hijos después de que ellos salgan del colegio, es una mujer emprendedora y es padre y madre para sus hijos, ella desea darles mejor calidad de vida y para ello se esfuerza más cada día, solicita el préstamo para poder comprar insumos y elaborar los diferentes platos. 

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana Maria belongs to the Siempre Unidos Community Bank. She is from the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco. She is 37, divorced, and she has two children. In addition to her household work, she is also a small business woman. She sells food in the market. She cooks in her stand and sells the food there. Her children join her when they leave school. She is an entrepreneur as well as mother and father to her children. She wants to give them a better quality of life. To do this, she works hard every day. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies and make different dishes. She is very grateful, and she values the loan and the opportunity it offers. She promises to repay according to the time line.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make food

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia Florentina, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, entre sus actividades del hogar ella se dedica también al comercio minorista, ella vende comida en la plazoleta de Urcos, ella misma cocina y lleva a vender la comida cacera, lo hace todos los días de la semana, para esto ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar insumos y elaborar los diferentes platos y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, ella es madre y padre para sus niños y desea darles una buena educación e invertir parte de ese dinero en la adquisición de muebles y artefactos, también en los pasajes de sus niños y otros usos más. 

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Florentina belongs to the Siempre Unidos Community Bank. She is from the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco. She is 46, single, and she has two children. In addition to her household chores, she is also a small business woman. She sells food in the small plaza in Urcos. She cooks and then takes the homemade food to sell. She does this every day of the week. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies to make her different dishes. This way she can improve her quality of life and that of her family. She is both mother and father to her children. She wishes to give them a good education. She will use part of the money to buy furniture and kitchen utensils. She will also buy tickets (transportation) for her children among other things. She is very grateful, and she appreciates the loan and the opportunity it offers. She promises to repay according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food sales in the small plaza in Urcos

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene estudios universitarios (2do siclo de Turismo), vive en el Barrio Cruzani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de golosinas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de chocolates, galletas, caramelos, jugos, yogures, etc.

Su mayor  deseo es ser mayorista, y poner un negocio de servicio de hospedaje en la Comunidad de Chinchero.

A ella le gustan la unión y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Fany belongs to the "Cajas Reales” communal bank that is located in the Chucuito District in the Province of Puno in the state of Puno. She is 22 years old and single. She has had university study (tourism) and lives in Barrio Cruzani. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 1 year. Her first loan was for 300 Nuevos Soles which was used to purchase candies to sell. Currently she needs a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be used to purchase chocolates, cookies, caramel candies, juices, yogurt, etc. Her goal is to become a wholesaler and also have a lodging service in the community of Chinchero. She likes the unity and solidarity of the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chocolates, cookies, caramel candies, juices, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Leonarda Martina

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 55 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 8 hijos, (2 dependientes aun D. ella), tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en la Comunidad D. Chinchera - Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 2 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. lana sintética.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar lanas D. diversos colores  para la producción D. artesanías en miniatura.
 
Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas D. capacitación.
texts.en:
