Leonarda belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 55, married, and has eight children (two are still dependent). She has a first graD. education. She lives in the Chinchera community in the San Bartolomé sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for nearly two years. She bought synthetic wool with her first loan for 300 PEN . She now needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy diverse colors of wool to make her handicrafts in miniature. Her biggest wish is to keep working. She likes the savings and the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy synthetic wool

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y es madre de 01 hijo, tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 7 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella  requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual piensa invertir en la compra de lana con los que elaborara artesanías, como títeres de dedo que luego los vende para la exportación.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan la forma de trabajo y la puntualidad del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Verónica belongs to the “Cajas Reales” Communal Bank which is located in the Chucuito district, province of Puno, in the Department of Puno. She is 26 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of one child. She completed her secondary school studies. She lives in the community of Chinchero in the San Bartolomé sector. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost the past 7 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase wool to make crafts. At this time she needs a loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, which she plans on investing in the purchase of wool with which she makes crafts like hand puppets that she will then sell for export. She greatest wish is to continue working to settle the household expenses. She likes the communal bank’s way of working and its punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of wool for crafts

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es:
La socia Wilda, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad,  tiene 1 hijo y es conviviente y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta por catálogo de productos de belleza, ella visita las diferentes instituciones con sus catálogos y los ofrece y al cabo de 15 días ella puede pasar a dar los productos que le pidieron y en un tiempo de 2 semanas mas puede cobrar, ella requiere el préstamo para cubrir algunas pequeñas deudas en cuanto espera que sus clientes le pagen.

Nuestra socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Wilda is member of the communal bank "Siempre Unidos". She comes from the barrio Santiago in the city of Cusco. Wilda is 32 years old, has 1 son and lives together with her partner. She alternates her efforts between her household work and selling beauty products from catalogs. Wilda visits various salons to offer them her catalogs, and after 15 days she returns to deliver the products that the people from the salon have ordered. She then must wait 2 more weeks before she is able to charge her customers for the products. Wilda requires a loan to help her cover various small debts during this period in which she must wait for her customers to pay her. Wilda is very thankful for the opportunity to receive a loan that is offered to her by her communal bank, and she promises to complete all of her payments on time and in accordance with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital para comprar y vender productos de belleza.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La señora Jesusa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil Casada, es madre de 2 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchera Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la elaboración de artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos soles, con el cual comprará lana acrílica y lana de alpaca para la elaboración de artesanías en miniatura los cuales los vende en las ferias de Acora.

Su mayor  deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes, ella ya cuenta con local.

A ella le gusta la unión que hay entre las socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Jesusa belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 49, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Chinchera community in the San Barolomé sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the foundation of her Community Bank. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought wool to make her handicrafts. She now needs a loan for 1,800 PEN to buy acrylic wool and alpaca wool to make her handicrafts in miniature. She sells them in the Acora fairs. Her biggest wish is to have a grocery story, she already has the location. She likes the unity among the members and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool and acrylic wool

loans.name: Yessica Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Yessica, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad,  tiene 2 hijos, es madre soltera y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la fabricación de piñatas y todo lo referente a fiestas infantiles, ella tiene su propia piñatería, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder confeccionar y fabricar todo lo relacionado a la venta de articulos para fiestas infantiles y despedidas de solteros.

Nuestra socia se encuentra muy agradecida y valora  la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yessica belongs to the Mosoc Killa Community Bank. She is from the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco. She is 32, single, and she has two children. She alternates her household activities with making piñatas and products for children’s parties. She has her own piñata shop. She needs a loan to be able to make and sell products for children’s parties and sweet sixteen celebrations. She is very grateful, and she appreciates the loan and the opportunity it offers. She promises to repay according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make piñatas

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El socio Abrahan, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 41 años de edad,  es soltero tiene 2 hijos y se dedica al prestar el servicio de taxi, el socio requiere este préstamo para uso personal pero parte de ello es para mantenimiento de sus taxi. El lleva 15 años trabajando como taxista y ahora tiene su propio auto

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate Abrahan is a member of the community bank "Mosoc Killa" and lives in the Santiago neighborhood of the city of Cusco. Our member is 41 years old, single and has 2 children. He makes a living providing taxi services. He needs this loan for personal use and to pay for the maintenance of the taxi. He has been a taxi driver for the last 15 years and now owns his own car. The member is very grateful for this opportunity that is available to him and agrees to comply with the payment terms in the contract.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Luis Alberto, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio,  tiene 23 años de edad, se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares, el socio tiene un pequeño stand en el centro comercial el paraíso, el compra todo tipo de celulares y los repara, y vende celulares de segunda mano, también vende accesorios de celulares, motivo por el cual el socio requiere el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y así adquirir mayor número de celulares y accesorios para tener más entrada económica.

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Luis Alberto, belongs to the community bank "Mosoc Killa" and lives in the Santiago neighborhood of the city of Cusco. Our member is 23 years old and makes a living purchasing and selling cell phones. He has a small stall at the El Paraiso commercial center. He buys all types of cell phones and repairs them and then sells the second hand phones. He also sells cell phone accessories. The reason for his loan request is to be able to reinvest in his small business, obtain a larger quantity of cellular phones and accessories and increase his income. Our member is grateful for the opportunity that this provides for him and therefore promises to comply with the payment terms that correspond with this contract.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply his cell phone stand.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio Luis Alberto, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio,  tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica al mantenimiento de computadoras, debido a que de profesión tiene la carrera técnico en informática, el repara y hace trabajos en computadora y otros, el socio requiere el préstamo para uso personal y para comprar algunos accesorios para implementar su computadora.

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate Luis Alberto belongs to the community bank "Mosok Killa" and lives in the Santiago neighborhood of the city of Cusco. Out member is 36 years old, single and has 2 children. He makes a living repairing computers. He is an information technology professional and repairs and works with computers. The member needs this loan for personal use and to purchase some accessories to improve his computer. Our member is grateful for the opportunity that this provides for him and promises to comply with the payment terms in the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase accessories for his computer.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su madre. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías, empezó a vender estos artículos en diversos lugares, pero posteriormente se logró establecer en una feria comercial donde tiene un puesto de ventas. Irma vende todo tipo de artesanías y también, en ocasiones, bebidas lácteas como leche y yogurt. De preferencia trabaja los fines de semana, junto a sus hijos que la apoyan cuando es necesario, para ella este negocio es rentable porque le genera buenas ganancias debido a la demanda de los turistas por estos objetos. Para el futuro, Irma desea tener un puesto más grande y mejor equipado con mercadería. Esta es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal porque le gusta trabajar en equipo con los demás integrantes. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado en la compra de más mercadería en artesanías, aprovechará la época de fiestas patrias donde hay mayor cantidad de turistas.
texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old and lives in her mother’s house with her husband and two children. For two years she has sold handicrafts and has begun to sell these items in different places. Before this she had a stand at a street market. Irma sells all types of handicrafts and also, on occasion, dairy products like milk and yogurt. She prefers to work on weekends together with her children who help her when necessary. For Irma her business is worthwhile because it has generated good profits due to tourists' demand for these items. In the future Irma would like to have an even larger stand that is better equipped with merchandise. This is the first time she has requested a loan with MFP and she is very happy to be a part of her village bank because she likes working as a team with other members. The loan that she requests will go towards the purchase of merchandise so that she can make the most of the upcoming national holiday period when there is a greater amount of tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase handicrafts and merchandise

loans.name: Parcifal

texts.es: Parcifal tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años trabaja reciclando todo tipo de objetos para luego venderlos por kilos. Para esto, a partir del medio día recorre las calles aledañas a su casa y por su localidad para recolectar de las personas todos estos artículos. Una vez que tiene una cantidad considerable  los vende por kilos a las empresas recicladoras. Para él es muy rentable esta actividad, ya que  aumenta su precio por el kilaje o el peso, lo cual le permite seguir trabajando para solventar sus estudios universitarios. Parcifal desea adquirir un terreno propio para tener un gran almacén y vender en mayores cantidades; asimismo quiere dedicarse a la agricultura, utilizando los desechos orgánicos como abono natural. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él fue invitado a formar parte de este grupo porque notaron en él a un joven con ganas de salir adelante y muy responsable; por su parte, Parcifal desea ser muy colaborador en su banco comunal. El dinero está solicitando será utilizado en la compra de más objetos para reciclar, ya que este crédito incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Parcifal is 22 years old and lives with his parents in his own house. For the past two years ago he has worked recycling all types of objects to later sell them. To do this he goes around the streets of his neighborhood and village to collect these items from people. The instances when he has a considerable amount he sells the items to recycling companies. For him this activity is very profitable, so much that he has raised his prices per unit, which allows him to continue working to pay for his university studies. Parcifal would like to purchase his own property in order to have a large store and sell larger quantities. Likewise he would like to get into agriculture and use organic waste for natural fertilizer. This is the first time he has requested a loan with MFP and was invited to be a part of this group because they saw in him a responsible young man who wants to keep moving forward. Parcifal very much wants to be a contributor to his village bank. The loan he requests will be used to purchase more objects to recycle and increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase recycled merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 6 meses se dedica a la venta de papa pelada y picada; anteriormente trabajó elaborando y vendiendo porciones de gelatina (postre) y con los ahorros que logró juntar decidió comprar la que es ahora su herramienta básica de trabajo: una picadora de papa, con la que puede realizar hasta 100 kilos al día. Con la ayuda de su esposo distribuye este producto a los principales restaurantes de su localidad y en una provincia aledaña. Las ganancias son satisfactorias y compensan el gran esfuerzo físico que hace, sobre todo levantarse de madrugada para avanzar con el trabajo. Para el futuro, Rebeca quiere tener máquinas más sofisticadas que produzcan mayor cantidad de papa pelada y picada. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está decidida a realizar un trabajo honesto y puntual en el cumplimiento de sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de 15 sacos de papa de 100 kilos cada uno y el pago del transporte del mismo.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children in her in-laws’ house. For the past six months she has sold peeled and chopped potatoes. Before this she made and sold dessert portions of gelatin and with her savings she decided to buy what is now her basic tool for her work: a potato mincer, with which she can chop up to 100 kilos a day. With the help of her husband she distributes this product to the main restaurants in her neighborhood and in a provincial village. Her profits are satisfactory and make up for the great physical effort that she exerts, including waking up at dawn to get started with her work. In the future Rebeca would like to have more sophisticated machines that will produce a greater quantity of peeled and chopped potato. This is the first time she has requested a loan from MFP and she is dedicated to working honestly and being punctual in fulfilling her payments. The loan that she requests will go towards the purchase of 15 sacks of potatoes of 100 kilos each and the payment to transport it.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de unos parientes. Desde hace un año realiza bellos bordados, se inició en esta actividad debido a la invitación de una de sus amigas que le enseñó esta labor. Ahora trabaja independientemente en la comodidad de su casa para poder atender su hogar y a sus hijos. Por ello tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados, ya que por la complejidad puede demorar hasta un mes en bordado. Teniendo como resultado una bella prenda típica que causa admiración en sus clientes y finalmente le compran al contado. La época más rentable de su negocio es durante las festividades típicas de su región, llamadas “la fiesta del Santiago”. Para el futuro, Victoria desea hacer crecer su producción de faldas bordadas y contratar a otras personas que la ayuden con el bordado. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha de ser una nueva integrante en su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable con la devolución del préstamo. La razón de su crédito es poder adquirir más telas e hilos de diversos colores, los cuales son materiales básicos para aumentar la producción de sus bordados.
texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and she lives with her husand and children in a house belonging to her family. For the past year she has been creating beautiful embroidery. She started this business through an invitation from one of her friends that showed her the trade. She has been working independently from the comfort of her home, so that she can maintain her home and care for her children. She has a fixed work schedule, having very steady work carrying out her craft. Given the complexity of some of the embroidery work, she can take up to one month to complete. The fruit of her work is a beautiful traditional piece that is admired by her clients. They ultimately purchase her pieces of work. The most profitable time of year is during the traditional festivals in her region called "la fiesta del Santiago", meaning the Feast of Santiago. In the future Victoria wishes to increase the number of embroidered skirts she makes and to contract out some work to help out with the embroidery. This is the first time she has requested a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to be a new member of the Community Bank. She has committed herself to be very responsible in the repayment of this loan. The loan will be destined to purchase more fabric and threads of various colors, which are basic materials to increase production.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Maria, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socia,  es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, hoy trajo a su menor niño de a penas unos meses de nacido, esta dormidito en su coche ella es una madre muy trabajadora y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia requiere el préstamo para uso personal.

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the community bank "MOSOC KILLA", and she is from the town of Santiago in the city of Cusco.

She lives with her partner and has 3 kids. Today she brought with her her youngest son who is only a few months old and is asleep in his buggy. She is a very hardworking mother and she alternates her activities at home with business. She needs a loan for personal use.

She is very grateful for the opportunity that has been brought to her by this means, and she is committed to repaying the corresponding amount on time.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use/Uso personal.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 57 años, vive con sus hijos; Ken de 19 y Erick de 17 en su casa propia, sus 2 hijos mayores ya son independientes. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, como el “extracto de sábila” para la piel, el “jugo de Noni”, la “uña de gato” para el colesterol, entre otros productos que son muy buenos para la salud. Julia tiene muy buenas ventas, ya que hoy en día existen bastantes personas que optan por los productos naturales para los males que padecen. Hace algunos años atrás sufrió un fatal incendio que destruyó su puesto y todos los productos que poseía, es así que tuvo que comenzar de cero e ir levantándose poco a poco. Felizmente sus hijos siempre la apoyaron y ahora han salido adelante, ella sabe que tiene que ponerle muchas ganas y empeño y logrará volver a tener el negocio que tenía antes. Ella es una clienta antigua en Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos naturales para aumentar sus ventas. Julia compra por catálogo y ahora aprovechará las ofertas.
texts.en:
57-year old Julia lives in her own house with her two sons, Ken aged 19 and Erick aged 17. Her two older children have already left home. For approximately ten years Julia has been selling natural medicines such as aloe extract for the skin, and noni juice and cat’s claw for cholesterol, as well as other products that are very good for one’s health. Julia has a successful business as there are many people today who choose natural products for their ailments. A few years back Julia had a serious fire which destroyed her stall and all the products that she owned, so she had to start again from scratch and gradually get back on her feet again. Fortunately her children were always there to help, and now they are making progress. She knows that if she makes a determined effort, she will once again have the successful business that she had before. Julia is a long-time member of Kiva partner Microfinanzas PRISMA and has always paid back her loan on time. With the money she is asking for she will buy a bigger quantity of natural products and thus increase her sales. She buys from a catalogue and will now be able to take advantage of special offers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her stock of natural products

loans.name: Agustina Marina

texts.es:
La socia Marina, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socia tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, ella tiene su pequeño stand en la av. Sol, en un centro artesanal muy concurrido por turista de todas partes del mundo. Ella solicita el préstamo a razón de reinvertir en la compra de mayor número de artesanías para la venta.

Nuestro socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Partner Marina, who is part of the communal bank "Mosoc Killa," is native to the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco. Our partner is 43 years old, cohabitates and has 2 children; she alternates her home activities with handicrafts and has a small stand in Sol Avenue in a handicrafts center very busy with tourists from all over the world. She is soliciting a loan to reinvest in the purchase of the majority of crafts for sale. Our partner is appreciative for the opportunity available by means of this medium and herself commits to complete the repayment according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and Sell Crafts

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana N. is one of the most empowered women of ASHI. Her experiences in her own life - being an adopted child and unrecognized by most of her family members because her parents were poor - pushed her to soar high and be brave in surmounting the challenges she encounters for her own family. Roberto, Diana's husband understood his wife's emotional struggle because they share a common experience. Both of them belonged to a very poor family and have almost fallen or drifted from the real world because of too much insecurity. However, when they both met and got married they found their strength in each other. Diana felt quite secure having her loving and understanding husband beside her. 

When Diana had two children, she gained more strength to fight the battles she is facing - financial, and emotional battles. When they started having their own family, she and her husband had no stable job nor source of income. Life then was so hard for both of them, especially for Diana. When ASHI came to their village Diana's clear vision of tomorrow started to flourish. She saw the bright future for her children waiting ahead of her when she received a loan from ASHI. Since then, Diana and her husband have been venturing into several kinds of business, searching for their success. However, life seemed to be cruel for them, she said, yet giving up was far from her thoughts.

Eventually, Diana found her happiness in life. She was elected as member representative to the Board by ASHI members in Antique, Philippines. Her eldest son graduated from college and was a scholar of a state university. Her second child is in high school and is very active in church. For these things she achieved, Diana was so thankful for the loan she obtained from ASHI because she had the opportunity to enhance the agricultural skills she learned from her husband as well as her commercial skills from being a commerce student when she was in college.

Now, Diana and her husband are farming three hectares (7.5 acres) of rice field. Rice production (planting of rice) is one of their businesses as well as tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire. Diana has her own tricycle and her rice production business generates employment in their community during planting season. She hires laborers to work with them in the field.

Aside from her rice production business and tricycle for hire, Diana plans to venture in the buying and selling of rice and also a motorcycle-for-hire business. This loan will be used for these things.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products and a second hand motorcycle and to pay for registration and licence

loans.name: Lerna

texts.en:
Lerna G. is a picture of a brave woman. Despite failing in three relationships with men she thought loved her, she managed to stand tall and raise her three children well. It was hard for Lerna to ignore people's negative perception towards what happened to her. But Lerna ignored those opinions and managed to focus her attention on the people that make her happy and complete- her children. After having her heart broken several times, she no longer dreams of having another man in her life. She has to prepare her three daughters for the future and provide them with a sense of security. 

Lerna has "sari-sari" (mini variety) store business to grow. She is not content with having only one type of business because she wants to diversify to ensure she can meet the family’s needs. In addition to her sari-sari store, Lerna also started a buy-and-sell business. Someday when her businesses have grown, she dreams of building a house to shelter her daughters from harm. She hopes that her daughters will grow up differently and that they will have a better education.

Through Lerna's membership in ASHI, she believes that she has the opportunity to achieve her dreams for her children. With access to credit, she is able to have a business of her own and doesn't have to depend on other people to help her. This loan will help bring her business and self confidence to a higher level. Her achievements thus far are because of ASHI, her children, and because of people who trusted her in so many ways.

loans.use: restock variety store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a specialized retail store selling gasoline and bread in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her inventory. This will be the third loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family and towards the children’s tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishing folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand products to sell.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Aylen

texts.en:
Aylen is 33 years old and married to Eduardo. They are blessed with four children. Their family is residing in a rural village in Nueva Vizcaya. Two of the children are now in their elementary level and they are hoping that all of them will finish their studies and have a bright future.  
Despite the hardships of life, Aylen and her husband strive very hard and sacrificing a lot, under the heat of the sun, as they till their farm just to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their family. They plant rice, vegetables and citrus in their farm lot in the upland. Aside from farming, Aylen also sells their harvested crops every week. Aylen is hoping to avail a loan amounting to PHP12,000 in order to support their farming needs and also to expand her vending business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito P. is a responsible father who lives in a rural community, located at Barangay Darubba Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, with his family. He and his wife were blessed with three children. As a father, Charlito is doing his best to earn income and be able to support the needs of his family. His children are all studying and he wants all of them to earn a college degree.  He works very hard and patiently in farming activities so that they will have a good harvest.  

He plants vegetables and fruit trees. His wife sells the harvested fruit and vegetables in their village. Aside from farming, Charlito is also maintaining a rice mill at their place. Lack of capital encouraged him to request a loan of PHP 5,000. He said that this amount will be of great help in assisting his farming needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long B. is an older, modest woman of 56. She lives in the province of Pursat, where she raises pigs in a stall next to her house to earn a living. She is married with three children, who are married and have already started new family homes. Her husband works driving a motor taxi. Long B. will be using a loan to buy pig feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men V. is a 47-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with two kids, both of whom are attending the public high school. Her husband, Oun Meng, is 49 and works in the farming business. Men V. inherited the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops from her grandmother. In the past, Men V. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is a simple farmer in the village of Darubba Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. His family lives happily in the village despite their poor living situation. He is married to Charity and they were blessed with four children, who are all presently studying in high school and elementary school. With their desire to uplift their living conditions, Guillermo and his wife work hand in hand to earn enough income for their family. 

The couple help each other in maintaining their farm lot in the upland. They plant vegetables, root crops, rice and some fruit trees. Guillermo is seeking financial capital in order to sustain their supply of needed farm inputs for the maintenance of his crops. He would like to borrow a loan of PHP12,000 that he will use for his farm. He is so glad that every month, he can generate an average income of PHP4,000 from his vegetables, root crops and fruits, which is enough to support the school allowances of their children and their family needs.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
“Overcoming crisis in life is through patience and hard work”. 

Lolita considers this quotation as her principle in life. They belong to a poor family but she is still determined to uplift their status of living by improving her hog raising business. They live in a rural place located at Barangay Darubba Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Lolita is married to Emilio Band they have been gifted with seven children.

Due to lack of capital, Lolita is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000. This amount will be used to maintain her hog raising business and to buy feed for her hogs. She believes that her business is a big help in sending her children to school. She is hoping to maintain her business well and to make it become more sustainable. Some of her children married at an early age and she prays that they may have a better life with their families.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin S., 35 years old, is the mother of three young children, all of school age. She is a farmer who grows rice crop as well as raising chickens, from home, for her daily income. Her husband, 35 year old Peang Khoun, owns a small rice mill that provides a rice hulling service for the village. He also works with her in growing crops. Due to this coming rice growing season, Bin S. is looking for a loan from Kiva to buy a cultivating machine to alleviate plowing her farmland. In addition, she will rent the machine out to other farmers for a profit.
Note: Bin S. was not available for photographing, so her husband is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine to alleviate farmland plowing.

loans.name: Aurea Marie

texts.en:
Aurea Marie B. is from the village of Danao. She is 24 years old. Aurea Marie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Aurea Marie operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Aurea Marie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Aurea Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Aurea Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Aurea Marie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Aurea Marie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the fishing business.

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mr. Saom B., 36, and his wife, Kong Chan Veasna, age 30. This couple earns a living by selling fish and some vegetables in the market. Aside from this, they own a few equipment to provide decorating service for wedding parties and other ceremonies. The couple has three young children who are of school age in Pursat Province. Saom B. and his wife is seeking for a loan to buy a cow which can be rented out to farmers for additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so they can also raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise offspring and for renting it as draft animal to farmers

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi C., 37, is a domestic farmer who owns a hectare of farmland in the village, where she grows rice. She has been in this sector for more than 20 years. She is married and blessed with four children, all of whom are students in the local public school. Her husband is responsible and works as a local building worker. Yi C. will be using the loan money to purchase a water buffalo in order to help with plowing her farmland during this rice-growing season. This will alleviate the hard physical labor of growing her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo

loans.name: Holnazar

texts.ru: Холназар Саидов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сын работает в России. Холназар по профессии болеее 6 работает преподавателем. В данный момент он более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Клиент хочет купить крупно рогатый скот, для откармливания  и продажи.
texts.en:
Holnazar S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. His son works in Russia. Holnazar has been working as a teacher for over 6 years. Currently, he has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. Client wants to buy cattle for feeding and selling.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou T., 37, is a local cultivator who breeds female ducks to produce eggs to sell. On the other hand, she has always planted a crop of rice during the rice-growing season. Another source of family profit comes from her husband, who has a job driving a motorbike taxi. This couple was blessed with four children: two are students and the others are working in different occupations. 

Because the rice-farming business is the main source of this family's income, Ou T. would like a loan of $600 as capital to hire labor to plow a plot of farmland and to buy more fertilizers for her rice crop.

loans.use: To hire a plower to plow her plot of farmland

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Four years ago, Sotera R. began a business buying and selling fish. The idea of having this kind of business crossed her mind when her fisherman husband, Elly, had caught more fish than their family could consume. Sotera sold those in their neighborhood and realized that selling fish earned bigger and faster profits than any other kind of business she had in the past using her loan from ASHI. 

Fish-selling could be done daily if she could buy fish from other fishermen in their village at times when her husband has a small catch. Unlike other products sold, fish is salable because it is one of the most basic needs of human beings, especially for people who live in very remote areas of the province. They are far from the market thus, the possibility of buying from vendors who come to their community is very high. Also, more people choose to buy fish than any other meat because it is cheaper and healthier.

From then on, Sotera used her loans from ASHI to buy and sell fish. Out of the profits she had, she was able to purchase a motorcycle, which she used in selling her fish all over the town. One of her sons is her driver while her husband goes fishing. 

As a mother, Sotera felt very sad for the choices made by her two sons. Instead of pursuing college after high school, they chose to quit schooling and instead help their parents in the business. Sotera's eldest daughter had graduated from college; however, she chose to work abroad as a domestic helper because employment opportunities in the country are very low, especially for people who live in very remote area of the province and come from a very poor family. 

Instead of getting rustrated with life, Sotera pressed on to what she can do for her children. She kept on borrowing from ASHI to keep her business growing. Now, she plans to use her newly received loan to increasing the volume of fish she buys and sells so that someday, out of her business profit, she will be able to buy another motorcycle for her other son. Being a 60-year-old woman, Sotera wanted her children, especially her two undergraduate sons, to have their own livelihoods. She believes that her business is the only inheritance she can turn over to them.

loans.use: To increase the volume of fish to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Самадова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 33 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Фируза более 6 лет занимается пашивом одежды. Муж в данный момент работает на стройке. Фируза шьет в основном под заказ. Клиентка просит кредит, для закупа оборудывания, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Firuza S. lives in the Rumy district. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Firuza has been involved in sewing clothing for over 6 years. Her husband currently works at a construction site. Firuza sews mainly to-order. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of equipment in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Mrs. Savat K., 60, is a widow with one son who has been a soldier for nineteen years. She lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savat has been selling groceries and Chinese noodles for ten years. She buys grocery items from Korky market, approximately three kilometers from her house, for resale in her village.

She hopes to expand her business; it would better for her to have more income to support her family. So she is asking for a loan of $500 in order to purchase more grocery items for her stock and to fix the door of her house.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale and to fix the door of her house

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
A medium-sized wooden house belongs to Khun N., age 29, and she has established her own family there in the Province of Pursat for years. She currently plants a few crops on her land near her house to earn a living, while her husband helps be responsible for the family by working as a barber. Khun N. is now blessed with two kids who are pupils in the local school.

Khun N. is applying for a loan of $750 and will be using most of loan to buy pig feed and piglets to raise. With the remainder of the loan she will repair her old house that is frequently having problems.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets to raise and to repair her house

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mrs. Theary U., 29, and her husband, Mr. Veasna Loem, 32, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2006 and have one young daughter. Besides Theary’s daughter, Theary also has her old parents living with her.

Theary has been a tailor for three years. It’s a skill she learned from her husband who has been a tailor for six years as well. They rU. the business at their own house. Theary is requesting her first loan of $500 to build a shop and to purchase additional clothes for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To build a shop and to purchase additional clothes for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mam

texts.en:
Mrs. Mam M. is aged 60, and is the widowed mother of seven children: five are single and the others are married and live separately. Two of her children are employed: a son is working in construction and daughter is a garment worker in Phnom Penh.

Presently, Mam M. cultivates rice and vegetable crops, and sells her mature produce to a buyer every two or three months after she plants them. She requests the Kiva loan in order to purchase a pumping machine to irrigate her farm field. She will rent this machine out to other farmers for additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine to irrigate her farm field

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch U., 29, and her husband, Mr. Nob Kong, 35, have been married since 2006 and have two young daughters. Besides her daughters, she also has her mother and one brother living with her. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Touch and her husband have been selling fish for two years. The couple always travels to buy fish from Prek Phnao market, about thirty kilometers from their house, for resale at Takhmao market.

Touch hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Bopha N., 31, and her husband, Mr. Phalla Lun, 27, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2003 and have a three-year-old daughter.

Bopha has been selling fruit since she was seventeen years old. She buys the fruit from her fellow villagers and sells it in the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a chef for five years. She runs the business with her mother. Now she wants to launch her own business, but she doesn’t have enough capital. Therefore, Bopha she is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase longan fruit on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase longan on contract for resale.

loans.name: Shkerullah Group

texts.en:
Shkerullah is the group leader of Shkerullah group. There are six members in this group and they all want to expand their businesses. They are requested a group of loan 60,000 Afghani.

Shkerullah wants to take a loan for his fruit and vegetables shop.

Moh Gul wants to take a loan for her husband who has a truck.

Gul Hara wants to take a loan for her bakery business.

M. Uaqab wants to take a loan for his carpet-weaving business.

Bebe Shah wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Abdul Maten wants to take a loan for his carpentry business.

They are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who are able to support all the world.

loans.use: To expand his fruit and vegetables shop

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Mr. Bunna S., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Savang Sou, 44, have been married since 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. All of the children are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bunna has been a mason for 27 years. He works in other provinces, far away from his house. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He is asking for a loan of $500 in order to pay school fees for his children, who are studying traditional Khmer music skills.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy animals (buffalo) for her animal selling business. Sharfan baji and Zahida baji and Imtiaz baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Amina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

Sakina baji is a wife of M. R.. They both have been citizens of Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), but he drives a rented rickshaw and therefore doesn't get the whole income from his work. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Sakina baji wears a black and white dupatta in this picture and the buffalo belongs to Bilquis baji.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy N., 29, and her husband, Mr. Leanseng Hun, 30, were married in 2000 and have just one young son. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Channy has been selling vegetables for three months. She buys them from farmers in her village for resale in the Phnom Penh market. Mr. Leanseng Hun has been driving a motor taxi for two years. He drives in Phnom Penh as well. The motorbike is old and doesn’t work properly; therefore Channy is applying for her first loan of $600 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for her husband to continue his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one

loans.name: Mhlullah Group

texts.en:
Mhlullah is the group leader of Mhlullah group. There are two members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan for her business. So they are requesting a group loan of 15,000 Afghani.

Mhlullah wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver.

Alluia wants to take a loan for her husband who has a shop that sells batteries.

So they are very thanking to Kiva lenders who are able to support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To use for her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy N., 49, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Koim, 48, live along National Road Number Two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment factory workers and other three are in school.

In the past, Phy stayed at home to take care of her children. Then she started to grow rice. Mr. Thoeun Koim has been working on a crocodile farm for over five years. Because they don’t have their own well, they have to ask to use their neighbor’s well. Now Phy is asking for her second loan of US$400 in order to dig one well for her family's use and to connect to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: To dig a well and connect to an electricity utility service

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Jamil Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

Ayeshan baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and mirrors) for her barber shop.

Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart.

Shamim baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies who all belong to a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Shamim baji is a very active lady. She takes care of her members. Her husband’s name is M. J. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been in this business for the over three years. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for his grocery shop.

Shamim baji is seated on the right side in the photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Kirimya 2 Namirembe Proscovia Group

texts.en: Proscovia N., a 40-year-old single mother of three children who are training in various skills, has operated a hardware business for the past five years. She is requesting the loan to purchase hardware items such as nails, building bars, iron sheets, cement, etc. and to use as working capital.   Proscovia is a hardworking woman whose dream is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase hardware items and use as working capital.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mr. Bora S., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Saosilin Keo, 25, were married in 2003 and just have one 4-year-old son. The couple lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bora has been a mason for over ten years; he works in his village and in Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eight years. Bora doesn’t have his own transportation and he always travels to work with his relative. So, he is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Kirimya 2 Nakabazi Immaculate Group

texts.en: Immaculate N. is a 40 year-old widowed mother of six children, three of whom are attending school; she is also looking after four other dependents, three of whom are in school. For the past three years she has been buying and   selling cattle. Immaculate is requesting the loan to purchase Frisian breeds of cattle for both milk and beef sales. She is an active lady whose dream is to also rear poultry.

loans.use: Purchasing Frisian breeds of cattle for milk and beef sales.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
“Through cooperation and hard work we can surpass every crisis in life,” says Arlyn. She is 24 years old and married to Ernesto Jr. She is thankful that they were gifted with a baby boy named Drassel who is now one year old. Her husband works as a fisherman since they are living near the Cagayan River in the village of Dalibubon Jones, Isabela. 

Arlyn is engaged in a village store business and in fish-vending. She helps her husband in raising their family to a progressive living through her business. They are both doing their best in order to meet the needs of their family. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for her store.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.

Shamim S. baji wants a loan to buy another water-buffalo for her milk selling business.

Allah rakhi baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business.

Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Shamim baji, wife of M. A., is the group leader of these aforementioned ladies. Her husband runs an ice-selling business. He sells ice on a cart and treks to different communities and towns to sell it. His business grows in the summer season. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy ice to advance her husband’s business.

Shamim baji is seated on the left side in the photo wearing a pink dupatta and the water-buffalo belong to Shamim S. baji.

loans.use: To buy more ice to sell

loans.name: Dedicasion

texts.en:
Dedicasion is 59 years old. She is married to Warlito, a farmer, and they live in Dalibubon Jones, Isabela. Their children are: Lourdes, 28 years old; Rolly, 26 years old; Rogelio, 25 years old and Roderick, 22 years old. 

Dedicasion manages an eatery. She came up with this in order to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their family, especially for the education of their youngest child. Improvement of her business is what Dedicasion aims for. For this, she would like to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital. The couple is doing their best for the welfare of their family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital

loans.name: Kaniz Allah Ditta Group

texts.en:
Irshad Baji and Sheema Baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling business. Anwar Baji and Sakina Baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Jannat Rani Baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. 

Kaniz Baji has been a wife of A. D. and a citizen of a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. She is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. Her husband runs a dairy business. Presently, he has one buffalo, and Kaniz Baji also helps him by getting milk from her. They both want to expand their dairy business. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to increase the profit from the dairy business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Kaniz Baji wears a black shawl in this picture.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Kalagala B Matovu Goreti Group

texts.en: M. Goreti is thirty-seven years of age, married with two children—one going to school—and is also looking after five dependents, three of them in schooling. She owns a drug shop where she has been operating for over four years. She stocks various drugs, using the loan to meet her customers’ demands. M. Goreti is an encouraging and hardworking woman whose dream is to construct a commercial house to rent to generate income. Purchasing a car is her dream too.

loans.use: To stock various drugs

loans.name: Razia Muhammad Mansha Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Baji wants a loan to buy a musical instrument (guitar) for her musical band. Bilquis Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shahnaz Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy carpets to sell. Anwar Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Razia Baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. They all have resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Razia Baji is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses. She insisted her mother teach her a carpet-weaving skill. With this skill, she was able to start her own carpet-weaving business. Now her skill rewards her in the shape of money. She used her amount as needed. Her husband's name is M. M., and he has a barber shop in the community. Razia Baji is applying for a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs, and a mirror) for her husband’s barber shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Razia Baji is seated in the picture, wearing a black shawl and showing her business.

loans.use: To buy items for her barber shop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 54 years old. Erlinda is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMP)C is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Sacrifice, love and patience are some of the ingredients to make a business grow, says Erlinda. She manages a general store business in the rural and peaceful village of Dalibubon Jones, Isabela. Her desire to make her business grow motivated her to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000. She knows that this amount will help her a lot in making her business more productive.

Erlinda is 41 years old and still single. She manages her business well in order to extend financial support to her parents and siblings. She aims to generate more income from the business and therefore patiently sacrifices even her personal life. She hopes that the lenders will grant her request and help her attain her goals in life.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Felesa

texts.en:
Felesa D. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old. Felesa is widowed and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felesa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Felesa is just starting this business.

In 2005, Felesa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felesa successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Felesa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Felesa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Jannat Khan Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Jannat baji married K. M. at the age of 20. They have lived in Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Jannat baji is a very active lady. She gets up early in the morning and prepares breakfast for her family and then cleans the whole house. Her husband runs a dairy business. He gets milk from the buffalo that he has in his house. He sells the milk in the milk shops and earns income. Jannat baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to increase her husband’s dairy business.

Jannat baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy timbers to sell. Najma baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Jannat baji is seated in the center of the group.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Dadeth

texts.en:
Dadeth T. is from the village of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 22 years old. Dadeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Dadeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dadeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dadeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dadeth successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Dadeth is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dadeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to provide tuition for her children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin C. is 30 year old and resides in the Province of Pursat. She was married, but divorced her husband a year ago and has no child.

Since early 2008, Kin C. has been selling groceries from her home, selling items such as cooked ingredients, sweets, candies, and some plastic goods. Most of her clients are neighbors who live near her house in Dong Keap Kdam village. She normally generates an income of $4 a day.

Kin C. currently faces difficulty with her transportation in that she always hires the neighbor’s motor for traveling. However, she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase an old motorbike. She will use the motorbike to support her investment by using it to transport produce from the market to sell in her home.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorbike to transport produce

loans.name: Kalagala Nalubowa Rose Group

texts.en:
N. Rose is twenty-seven years of age. She is married with two children, one of whom is schooling. She is has been in the business of selling firewood for four years so far. She purchases firewood from far places in villages and brings it closer for sale. She will use this loan to add capital to her business.

N. Rose is encouraging others to work at whichever things they can manage to generate income. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to construct a house

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I. is happily married to Joseph Isarel. They were blessed with four children: Shiela, Crezyl, Gheavelle, and Jonavilee. Shiela is the eldest and is already a teacher, while Gheavelle, the youngest, is in elementary grade. Crezyl is in college and Jonavilee is in high school. For Josephine, having a child who has graduated from college is a source of pride and the best prize a mother could ever have from her hard work. Josephine is 43 years of age yet strong and determined to keep on with the business she started in order to provide for her three children who are still studying. Her husband is supporting her decisions.

Since she was young, Josephine has been involved in the farming business. Her parents’ source of income was planting rice. When Josephine joined ASHI, this was the kind of business she started with and maintained until now. Since Josephine's husband knows not only how to farm and plant rice but also how to drive a motorcycle, Josephine thought of taking out a loan from ASHI to buy a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached to it) for a service transport business and vehicle-for-hire business as their alternative source of income whenever it is not yet time to harvest and sell rice.

The tricycle is the main means of transportation in the village where Josephine and her family live. People coming in and out of the village and all over the municipality take a tricycle. Therefore, with a tricycle business, Josephine's husband will be able to earn income on daily basis, and Josephine will no longer need to worry about where to get money to buy food for her family or money for the educational needs of her children. The tricycle could also be very important for her in marketing her products, since it would bridge the gap between Josephine's location and the distant main municipality where her market is.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and sidecar and pay related fees

loans.name: Nusrat Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is married to Mr. R., who runs a wheat selling business. He buys wheat wholesale and sells it to his customers. He has been in this business for the last 5 years, and earns a good profit from it. Nusrat baji helps him by packing the wheat in sacks. She is applying for a loan to buy wheat to increase the profit of her husband’s wheat selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Farida baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches, and switch boards) for her business selling electrical supplies. Faryad baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Nusrat baji is seated in the center of the group.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta is 46 years old and still single. She owns and manages a general store in her village. One of her dreams is to improve and develop her store into a bigger one in order to generate more income for her family's needs.

Anacleta is now requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP12,000 as additional capital. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of merchandise to meet her customers' demands. She is happy that through her business, she has been able to assist her parents financially.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Kalagala Nabagala Nowe Group

texts.en:
N. Nowe is thirty years old and married with three children who go to school. She has been in the business of purchasing and selling chickens for one year so far. She will use this loan to purchase chicks, chicken feeds, drugs, etc. for the sale of healthy chicken to her customers.

The community is encouraged because of her business; the ladies especially are learning much from her. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feeds, drugs, etc.

loans.name: Shahnaz Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
My name is Shahnaz and I have been a citizen of the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan for the last 11 years. Pakpattan is famous for its shrines. My husband is M. A., and he makes a good living selling used handsets. I never received a formal education because our community was conservative and not in a position to send girls to school. Instead, my parents suggested that I stay at home. My father ran a carpet-weaving business, and taught me this art. Now I have expanded this activity into business, and am able to help my husband meet our expenses. I am applying for this loan so my husband can buy more handsets to sell.

I lead a group of four other women from my locality. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Sabran baji wants a loan to buy timbers to sell. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shahnaz baji is seated on the floor and showing her products.

loans.use: To buy used handsets for resale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda makes a living managing a general store and raising hogs.  She is happy because she has been able to improve her businesses despite starting with little capital. Her store is two years old and located in her village of Masaya, San Agsutin, Isabela. She has applied for a loan to expand her store and hopefully generate a larger income, which she can use to provide for the needs of her family. 

Belinda is married to Ronald and blessed with six children: Karen - 13 years old; Kristine - 11 years old; Don - 9 years old; Hannah - 8 years old; Dominic - 6 years old; and Aimee - 4 years old. Belinda hopes to be able to send all of her children to school someday, including college.

loans.use: To expand a small business

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey N., 61, is a married woman and the mother of three children, all of whom are married and living independently. Her husband is Cheap Bun, 58, a local rice farmer. Mey N. makes a living by selling fresh fish and vegetables in a very busy local market. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. 

Mey N.’s husband has begun sowing a new rice crop, but needs fertilizer. Mey N. is applying for this loan to buy fertilizer so that the family will grow a larger crop, and also to buy a cow so that they can begin growing a small herd. 
.
Note: Mey N.’s husband is pictured here because she was not available when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Kalisizo South Namujuzi Josephine Group

texts.en: Josephine N. is 32 years old and the single mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for a younger sister who is still in school. For the last 10 years, she has made a living buying and selling bananas. She is applying for this loan to to buy bananas in bulk for reasle to her customers. Josephine is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: To buy bananas in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en: Chita makes a living running a small general store. She is 54 years old and married to Flordelino, who works as a farmer. In addition to her store, Belinda manages a boarding house which offers rooms to rent in their village.  She is applying for a loan so that she can expand her businesses and do a better job of meeting her customers' needs.  Chita has five children and uses her income to pay their allowances, tuition and other expenses. She hopes that her loan will be granted and allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly I., 47, is a widow with one son and two daughters (she is in the picture with one of her daughters). One of her children was married and lives outside the family house, and the other two are garment factory workers. Besides her children, she also has two grandchildren are living with her. The family lives along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Somaly has been selling groceries since 1993. She buys grocery items from Prek Phnao market for resale in the village. She now is requesting another loan from Kiva through MAXIMA to purchase a motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for using in the family.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito H. is 42 years old, married with 3 children and is a resident of Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental, Philippines.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has owned and operated a fish vending business for the past 3 years.
She needs additional capital to increase her purchasing capacity so that with more fish to sell, she can expand her business and increase her profits and ultimately save enough money for the education of her children.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her fish vending business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga raises hogs in her village located in the mountainous municipality of San Agustin, Isabela. Hog raising is one of her family's sources of income that she patiently maintains. She is 56 years old and married to Rolando. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with three children. All three are married and living away from home.
