Dominga is requesting a loan amounting to 8,000 Philippine Pesos as additional capital for her business. She believes that the loan will be a big help in maintaining her hogs and in meeting their needs. The couple doesn’t want to depend on their children’s financial support, thus they are doing their best.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn K., 60, and her husband, Mr. Sorn Net, 61, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1972 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are garment factory workers.

Mr. Sorn Net is a construction constructor, while Mrs. Yorn is a housewife. Their son wants to drive a motor remoque taxi (a motorbike with a passenger trailer at the back) in which he can carry garment factory workers, but he doesn’t have enough money to buy one. Therefore, Yorn is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to help finance her son.

loans.use: For a motor remoque her son will drive as a taxi

loans.name: Kalisizo South Nabufu Eva Group

texts.en: N. Eva is 40 years old and the single mother of three children, who are all schooling. For 14 years, she has operated a grocery business. She is using the loan for adding capital to her business by purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, yams, etc., to sell to her customers. She is an active businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and construct a house.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, yams, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kimsreav

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsreav S., 26, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Say, 29, were married in 2000 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both children are in primary school. The family lives a long National Road Number six about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kimsreav has been selling soft drink since she was married. Mr. Vannak Say is assisting his wife in the business and has been a house constructor for seven years as well. The couple is in the process of building their new house, but they don’t have enough money to finish it. Therefore, Kimsreav is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to finish her house.

loans.use: To finish her house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, married, and blessed with three children, who are Jenny, 23; Janeth, 19; and Leopoldo Jr., 16 and attending high school. 

Gloria manages a sari-sari store (a kind of convenience store).  Lack of capital encouraged her to seek financial assistance amounting to 5,000 Philippine pesos (or about $125 US) from Kiva so she can expand her store.  Aside from her store, Gloria also raises hogs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: The smiling woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Sot V. is a 27-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Pursat Province. She feeds some pigs in a pigpen behind her house.  Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Her husband works in construction. Sot V. is looking for a $800 loan as capital to support her farming business.  She will use the loan to buy a buffalo to plow the farmland and to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Sot V. has two children who are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo, fertilizer, and rice seed

loans.name: Anamer

texts.en:
Anamer T. is 38 years old and is married to Patricio, her 33-year-old husband. The two are blessed with two children; they are Manna Mercy, 6, and Maria Gabrielle, 3. The T. family lives in a village surrounded by the sea and rice fields. These resources are the main sources of livelihood for people who live in the village, including Anamer and Patricio.

Patricio is a fisherman and a farmer while Anamer is a vendor of her husband's fish. Anamer bought a fishnet for her husband with aloan from ASHI. She started loaning in small amounts, increasing their size as her businesses grew. She was able to supplement the needs of her husband's rice farming business and expand their fishing business. 

Anamer and her husband were renting a hand tractor, but because of Anamer's loan with ASHI, she was able to buy a hand tractor. Now, they don't have to spend money to rent a tractor, and it costs the Tamboongs less to plow their land. However, the machine needs maintenance to work properly after several years of use. Anamer intends to use her newest  loan for the maintenance of their hand tractor and for an additional fishnet. 

While her children are still young, Anamer assiduously manages her family's businesses because she aspires to continue expanding their worth. Once her businesses become more stable, her children's future will be brighter and she will be able to fulfill her  vision of giving then a better education.

loans.use: The maintenance of a hand tractor and a new fishnet.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mr. Lun K., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Ratana Meas, 29, were married in 1998 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Their eldest daughter is in 4th grade, while the other two are still young. The family lives along National Road 6 about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ratana Meas stays at home to take care of their children. Mr. Lun K. was hired to repair motorbikes and bicycles; however, he now wants to launch his own business from his home. He is asking for a $1,000 loan, his first, to purchase spare motorbike and bicycle parts and tools for his business. He hopes to use part of the loan to repair his house as well.

loans.use: To repair his house and to purchase spare motorbike and bicycle parts for his motor repair business.

loans.name: Malai

texts.en:
Ms. Malai M., 27, is single and lives with her parents along National Road 1 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has one brother and three sisters.

Malai has been selling clothes for over two years. She buys them from a market located in Phnom Penh and resells them in front of a garment factory. She hopes to continue expanding her business so she can support her family more effectively. Thus, she is requesting a loan of $700 in order to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To continue expanding her selling clothes business.

loans.name: Kalisizo South Nakiwala Polly Group

texts.en: N. Polly is thirty-eight years old, married with two children, one going to school. She has been dealing in the banana business for one year. She is using the loan to purchase bananas in, great volume, for sale. This will help her to meet her customers’ demands. N. Polly is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bananas in bulk, for resale.

loans.name: Chanphally

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanphally U., 30, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Soun, 39, were married in 1985 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of the children attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Chanphally and her husband have been selling gasoline for eight years. They buy some from a gasoline station about 3 kilometers from her village and some from the Khmer-Vietnam border, for resale in their village. The couple wants to build a new house in which to live, but they lack the money. So, Chanphally is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to help build a house.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun K., age 47, is a widow with two sons and two daughters (she shown in the picture with her daughter). One daughter is married, but lives inside the family house. The other daughter weaves silk at home. One of Lun’s sons is a horse cart driver. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lun has been a silk weaver for 4 years; it’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. Besides weaving, she is also a farmer. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Lun is requesting a loan of 1,000USD to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to repair the horse cart for her son.

loans.use: Purchase of silk for weaving and repairs to horse cart.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren S., age 39, and her husband, Mr. Kunthea Toun, 41, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. 

Mrs. Saren S. has been selling fish for 16 years. She buys some of the fish from her villagers and her husband is also a fisherman. She sells the fish Korky market. Mr. Kunthea Toun has been a fisherman for 16 years; he catches fish from the lake nearby his house.

The couple hopes to supplement their income by growing vegetables, but they lack the capital. Therefore, Saren is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase bamboo and nets to build a shelter for her vegetables.

loans.use: To towards growing vegetables.

loans.name: Anake

texts.fr: Anake A. est un jeune homme de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Lomé. Anake exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans. Il désire avec ce crédit acheter sa propre moto. ceci lui permettra d’épargner beaucoup pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anake A., age 32, is married and the father of 2 children. He's been a motorcycle taxi driver in Lomé for 4 years. With this loan, he would like to buy his own motorcycle. This will enable him to save more, in order to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Kalisizo South Nakyange Goreti Group

texts.en: N. Goreti is a single businesswoman, aged thirty-eight, and mother of five children who are all going to school. She is also looking after one dependent. She has been dealing in the clothing business for three years, buying and selling used clothes. She is using the loan to purchase inventory; she will purchase used clothes in large quantities, for sale. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchasing of used clothes, in large quantity, for sale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old and married to Renato, a house carpenter in their village in Masaya, San Agustin, Isabela. They have three children: Renalyn - 24 years old, a college graduate and now working as a teacher; Mark Gil - 23 years old, a graduate of a two year course in college; and Gilbert - 21 years old, a college undergraduate.

Now, Leonora would like to obtain a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy sacks of feed for her hogs. She is hoping to become successful in her hog-raising business and for it to become bigger through the support of the lenders and her hard work.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed for her hogs

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally P. is already 41 years old. She is married to Francisco P. and both of them are thankful for they are blessed with three loving children. The eldest is Johnny - 21 years old, who is now in first year college, followed by John Carlo - 12 years old and Princes - 9 years old who are both in grade school. 

Sally offers home service manicure/pedicure and at the same time she is also a beautician. She doubles her time in order to have a bigger income to improve their way of living and sustain their basic needs as well. Aside from that, Sally also manages a hog-raising business.

In order for her to provide a better service for her customers, Sally wants to purchase more beauty products that she can use in her home service. For that, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan from Kiva. She can also use some of the amount for buying feed for her hog.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and to buy feed for her hog

loans.name: Kasambya 1 Nabibuga Nuriat Group

texts.en: N. Nuriat is forty-seven years old, married, with eight children and two dependents in schooling. She has been dealing in poultry for almost two years. She is using the loan to purchase chicks, feed, drugs, etc. for rearing healthy poultry to meet her customers’ demands. Her business is improving because she is adding capital. She will supply chickens and eggs, in much volume, to the customers. She is an active businesswoman whose future hope is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, feeds, drugs, etc for  poultry business.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мухиддин, мужчина , который занимается куплей и продажей скота.Он в основном продаёт и покупает коров и быков.Как раз на снимке он с быком в сарае.Мухиддин утверждает , что благодаря кредитам у него хорошо продвигается жизнь семьи получая прибыль с бизнеса.Он благодарит инвесторов за понимание и финансирование.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Muhiddin is a man who buys and sells cattle. He mainly buys and resells cows and bulls. On the photo he is with a bull in the shed. Muhiddin confirms that thanks to the loans his family's life is good because of the profits from the business. He is thanking the lenders for their understanding and financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
From only two piglets, Wilhelmina now has six hogs in her animal shelter. Through her hard work and patience she is able to surpass all the trials with regard to her business. At the age of 54, she sometimes has had difficulty in cleaning the pigpen because of the bad odor of hog manure. However, knowing that through the business of hog-raising, she can be able to send her children to school, she instantly disregards the smell. 

Wanting to sustain and maintain her hog-raising business, Wilhelmina wants to avail a loan of PHP12,000 from Kiva lenders to use as capital for purchasing feed for her animals. She is optimistic that her request will be granted. Wilhelmina also dreams to buy more piglets.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Kasambya 1 Namudu Sissy Group

texts.en: N. Sissy is a forty-eight year old, single, mother of nine children. She also looks after four dependents. Ms. N. has been decorating functions with dressings, braid and so forth for fifteen years. She will use the loan to add capital to her business. To develop her business with the changing of designs, purchasing flowers, flower stands, nets and so forth. Others are also encouraged by Ms. N.'s business. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to prosper in whatever she is trying to do.

loans.use: For changing designs, purchase of flowers for party business.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol S., 47 years old, owns a small shop in the local Pursat Market where she sells food for people who come to buy things in the market. She typically makes around $4 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. She was married, but divorced her husband when her three kids were very young. Although she is now a single woman, she is a fantastic mother who has tried to send all her children to attain the highest of education. One of her children has graduated from the university and is working as an internal staff for a micro finance institution. The other two are still studying. Pol S. will be using this Kiva loan to purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To purchase essential ingredients for her cooking foods.

loans.name: Bahodoor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Баходур досрочно хочет погасить свой кредит, оставшийся последний месяц погашения и получить повторно кредит на расширение бизнеса купли и продажи скота.У него сейчас пять больших коров, которые в день дают по семь литров молока, и его жена продаёт в его посёлке,соседям.Он хочет на повторный кредит закупить  побольше корма для коров и ещё пару быков.
texts.en:
Bahodoor would like pay back his loan in advance; he has one month left of payments, and would like to get another loan to expand his business buying and selling cattle. He now has five big cows, which give seven liters of milk each day. His wife sells the milk in his village to their neighbors. He wants with his next loan to purchase more feed for his cows, as well as a couple of bulls.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Kasambya 3 Kayima Lydia Group

texts.en: K. Lydia is thirty-two years old, married and blessed with two children of her own. She is also taking care of three dependents. All of the children are going to school. She has been in her business of selling drinks for six years. She is using the loan to purchase drinks such as water, sodas, etc., adding capital to her business. She is an active lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase drinks such as water, sodas, etc to capital to her business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita E. is from the village of Malibangcao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Esterlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting coconut and banana for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Adebinpe

texts.en:
V. is 48 years old and married with six children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes and sells hats and has been in this business for the past six years.

V. has been borrowing from LAPO for the past four years. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more hat materials. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making hats

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou S. is an old woman of fifty-five years who lives in Pursat Province. She is married with four children, three of whom are married and have already started new homes and the other one is studying in high school. Her husband died of senility years ago.

Since 1979, she has been cultivating various crops. In the past, she has always hired a villager’s cow to help plow a field. She right now hopes to reduce this expense by using a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to purchase a pair of cows so she will be able to use them to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of cows to plow her land

loans.name: Abdurabi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Абдураби на закончивший займ смог увеличить свой оборотный капитал по бизнесу купли продажи скота. Сейчас у него два больших быка темно коричнего цвета шведской породы.Скот данной породы очень ценится на рынке.На следующий кредит Абдураби планирует купить ещё пару молодых бычков этой породы.
texts.en:
Abdurabi, upon paying back his loan could increase his working capital for his business buying and selling cattle. He currently has two big dark cinnamon-colored bulls of Swedish breed. Cattle of this breed are highly valued in the market. In his next loan, Abdurabi plans to buy several more young bulls of this breed.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Cell 8 Nampijja Clare Group

texts.en:
N. Clare is thirty years old, married with two children schooling, and also taking care of five dependents.

Clare has been operating a business dealing in used clothes so far for seven years. She is using the loan to purchase more used clothes, especially from Owino Market in Kyotera Town. There is a difference in her life because her standard of living is uplifted from where it was. Her services are closer to her community. She is an active lady whose dream is to purchase used clothes in much greater volume.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes, especially from Owino market

loans.name: Akeremale

texts.en:
F. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and married with three children.

F. sells cooked food and drinks and has been in this business for the past two years. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is a native of Cardona, Rizal, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, 43 years old, who is a tricycle (somewhat like a rickshaw) driver. They have two children, both boys and both are in school.

In 2008, Virginia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of hope to overcome and get out from the spiral of poverty. Life was not easy to her considering that the source of income for the family was only from her husband’s work as a driver.

When she joined ASHI, she ventured her first loan in the direct selling of ready-to-wear goods from Natasha and MSE products. This business is very popular among Filipino women. Now, on her 2nd loan, she is requesting 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her direct-selling business.

She is hopeful that with the proceeds from her business, she can sustain the educational needs of her children and be able to let them graduate from college and find jobs. She also dreams of having a jeepney (a small bus) someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Hazzan

texts.en: B. is 34 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. B. sells table water and cooked foods and has been in this business for the past two years. She is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and table water. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bottled water and more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen K. is a widowed 53-year-old living in Pursat Province. She has six children, two of whom are single and four of whom are married.

K. earns a living by selling Khmer noodles and raising poultry. She is also a local rice farmer. She earns approximately $10 a day to support her family's living expenses from these businesses which she began in 1979. To further help meet the family's needs, two of her children are employed as electricians for a company.

Due to this coming rice-planting season, K. requested a loan of $1000 to pay for plowing the farmland as well as buying rice seed and fertilizers.

loans.use: To pay for plowing the farmland as well as buying rice seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Fawazu Group

texts.en:
Fawazu is the group leader of Fawazu group. There are two members in this group and they each want to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

Fawazu wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business.

Gullah wants to take a loan for her bakery business.

They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who are able to support the whole world.

loans.use: To expand her business
